programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero 2025
programme.desc: The MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero Replay showcases elite surfing at Supertubos, one of Europe's premier beach-breaks known for its powerful, hollow waves and consistent barrels. As the third stop on the 2025 World Surf League Championship Tour, this event is crucial for competitors looking to build momentum in their World Title campaigns.

programme.title: All In | A Last Chance For Surfing Glory At Pipeline And Honolua Bay
programme.desc: The European leg of the WSL World Tour season is finished and Kanoa Igarashi and Steph Gilmore are off to Hawaii, where a year's worth of surfing their hearts out will culminate at two of the best waves in the world: Maui's Honolua Bay and Oahu's Pipeline. See how Kanoa and Steph handle the mounting pressure in this episode of All In: Life on the WSL Championship Tour.

programme.title: WSL Competition Highlights
programme.desc: See all the best scores from the WSL surfing season.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero 2025
programme.desc: The MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero Replay showcases elite surfing at Supertubos, one of Europe's premier beach-breaks known for its powerful, hollow waves and consistent barrels. As the third stop on the 2025 World Surf League Championship Tour, this event is crucial for competitors looking to build momentum in their World Title campaigns.

programme.title: All In | Julian Wilson Surfs Through Injury at Snapper Rocks
programme.desc: As the surfers make final preparations to travel to their next WSL World Championship Tour events in France for the Quiksilver & Roxy Pro, they reflect on their 2018 season so far. For Julian Wilson and Lakey Peterson, a World Title is within reach. And while Carissa Moore and Jordy Smith are out of the title hunt this year, they still want to prove they are the two best surfers in the world. The stakes are raised at the Quiksilver & Roxy Pro France and the Surf Ranch Pro as the race for points and the fight for the WSL World Title intensifies.

programme.title: Land Of Teranga | Brilliant Corners: Senegal, Episode 1
programme.desc: Sam Bleakley starts his journey through Senegal joined by Irish big wave surfer Easkey Britton and French pro Adrien Toyon. Their first stop is N'Gor Island, where they ride the wave seen in the opening sequence of "Endless Summer." On the island, they learn about Teranga, the Senegalese quality of hospitality, sharing, and welcomeness. They also meet up with Marta Imarisio, who has helped inspire the country's women and girls to get into surfing.

programme.desc: The final day of the 2016 Billabong Pro Tahiti, featuring an epic battle between Kelly Slater and John John Florence.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the Western Australia Margaret River Pro 2025
programme.desc: The Western Australia Margaret River Pro is the 7th stop on the 2025 World Surf League Championship Tour. Replay Final's Day at this crucial event, marking the mid-season cut, where the world's best surfers put it all on the line to advance through to the next section of the tour. Margaret River brings raw power, pumping waves and unforgettable drama.

programme.title: Inside Pro Surfing: Rip Curl Pro Bells Beach presented by Bonsoy 2025
programme.desc: Bells Beach on Victoria's South Coast is the longest-running surfing competition and will host the 62st edition this year. Bells is Australian surfing heritage. With the hope of scoring long-period, groomed walls, the surfers will need to display the perfect combination of power, precision, and timing. The biggest surfing legends have had the honor of winning and ringing ‘The Bell' and 2025 will see a hungry new generation vying for the opportunity to cement their names in one of surfing's most prestigious events.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the MEO Rip Curl Pro Portugal presented by Corona Cero 2025

As the third stop on the 2025 World Surf League Championship Tour, this event is crucial for competitors looking to build momentum in their World Title campaigns.

programme.title: All In | Jordy Smith Searches For The Magic Surfboard For France
programme.desc: The surfers arrive in France for the next stop on the WSL World Championship Tour, the Quiksilver & Roxy Pros. For Jordy Smith and Lakey Peterson, the search is on for the magic surfboard to compete in the shifting beachbreak waves of Hossegor. Meanwhile, Carissa Moore and Julian Wilson prepare for competition by fine-tuning their bodies for the grueling days of competition ahead.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the VIVO Rio Pro presented by Corona Cero 2025
programme.desc: The World Title race is set to supercharge in Saquarema. The passion of Brazil's surf fans, the electric atmosphere of Saquarema, and the pressure of the back half of the season are unmatched. It's loud. It's wild. It's must-watch professional surfing. Replay Final's Day as the World Title race continues in Brazil.

programme.title: Casbah Coast | Brilliant Corners: Algeria, Episode 1
programme.desc: Host and Longboard Champion Sam Bleakley travels to Algeria with Australian longboarder and writer Lucy Small, French surfer and adventurer Erwan Simon, and local Dihya Nasri, the only female surfer in all of Algeria. They continue to explore the over 1,000 miles of mostly unsurfed Mediterranean coastline, paddling out at a slabbing wave near the capital city of Algiers. Sam Bleakley, Lucy Small, Erwan Simon, and Dihya Nasri have a dawn patrol session at a nearby break and meet some of the local surfers in the tight-knit community as they continue to explore Algeria, one of the Brilliant Corners of the earth.

programme.title: 2025 TUDOR NAZARÉ Big Wave Challenge | REPLAY
programme.desc: The deepwater canyon of Portugal's famous Nazaré set the stage for Big Wave's finest to battle for the 2025 Tudor Nazaré Big Wave Challenge. Heavy wipeouts, full sends, and a clash of defending champs taking on perennial Big Wave standouts provided plenty of adrenaline-pumping action. Nic Von Rupp and Clement Roseyro emerged victorious with Justine Dupont stamping her authority at the arena of Nazaré once more to top the women's leaderboard alongside Roseyro taking the men's leaderboard win.

programme.title: Inside Pro Surfing: Surf Abu Dhabi Pro 2025
programme.desc: The WSL Championship Tour makes its groundbreaking debut in the Middle East at the 2025 Surf Abu Dhabi Pro. The second stop on the CT marks professional surfing's continued global expansion and also establishes Abu Dhabi as an official surf destination. Engineered for excellence, this high-performance wave will provide a canvas for the world's best surfers set against a stunning backdrop of the Arabian Gulf. The event will showcase not only the remarkable evolution of professional surfing beyond its traditional roots, but also the infinite possibility for progression from athletes like rookie Erin Brooks, former World Champion Italo Ferreira, and reigning World Champ Caity Simmers.

programme.title: REPLAY | All the Action from the Lexus Pipe Pro presented by YETI 2025
programme.desc: Welcome to the starting line. The champs are back, the rookies have arrived, and the entire surf universe turns its eyes to the place where it all begins: the North Shore of O`ahu. Relive Final's Day action as the world’s best fire the Championship Tour back up. The 2025 Tour starts NOW.

programme.title: Can Julian Wilson Keep His Winning Momentum Going in Portugal? | All In Ep5
programme.desc: While Julian Wilson and Jordy Smith head to Portugal for the MEO Rip Curl Pro Peniche, Carissa Moore and Lakey Peterson travel home to relax for a month before having to compete in the final event on the women's WSL World Tour season, the Beachwaver Maui Pro. After his win in France, Julian needs a good result in Portugal to have a chance at the men's world title. For Jordy, Portugal is a chance to let loose and charge. For every surfer, this is the most critical point in the world tour season, as the Hawaiian leg looms on the horizon.

programme.title: All In | Kanoa And Steph Exit Hawaii With The Weight Of Two Nations On Their Shoulders
programme.desc: In the final moments of his World Tour season, Kanoa must face off against one of his best friends, Leonardo Fioravanti. programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: He’s the original fishing coach. From the helm of one of the most iconic inshore shows ever made, Captain C.A. Richardson has taught a generation how to fish. This documentary dives into his story. The man, the mission, and the waters that made him who he is.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade and Caleb head back to Missouri to catch the end of bow season, and the start of rifle. Slade arrows a great buck (twice), and we preview the latest property Slade & Co. purchased in MO.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade and the crew are finally able to catch up with these elk despite some pretty terrible weather conditions. It comes right down to the wire! Don’t miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The "Trained Assassins" are back and it’s turkey season in the Midwest. In this first episode, Slade, Blake, and Ryan start in Missouri, run into some trouble, but end up getting it done on the first leg of the 2024 turkey tour.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade is staying busy busy around the house, lots of testing on summer plots with Deergro and Backwoods bachelor pad blend. Also, there locally he takes a quick look at the new 60 acres he and Ryan bought as an investment property. Then ends with a throwback hunt from under the barn.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Bass fishing takes on numerous forms, from the simplicity of backyard pond fishing to the apex of competitive tournament angling. Yet, within this pursuit lies a distinct niche: trophy hunting via swimbait fishing. Unlike traditional baits, swimbaits stand out in their uniqueness within an angler's arsenal. Ranging from six to twelve-plus inches in length and weighing two to sixteen ounces, these baits require a quiver of specialized equipment and a different mindset. The adage "big bait, big fish" is the guiding principle, firmly centered on catching the biggest bass in the lake, armed with the largest baits from your tackle box.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Throughout the years, our friendships have been forged in deer camps across the country, and this week is a continuation of some of those times. This week, we have Dave Peterson and Mike Winkler from Do All Outdoors and Jurassic Rock in camp with us. When all is said and done, we even got to do a little hunting ourselves and create more memories that will last a lifetime

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Jennifer Brooks has spent her life answering the call to serve. From flying Blackhawk helicopters on multiple combat missions during two tours in Iraq to now serving as an Air Medical Pilot and first responder, her story is one of courage, sacrifice, and humility. In this episode of Storytellers, we join Jennifer in the field for a hunt that offers a rare moment to slow down, reflect, and honor a life dedicated to protecting others.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Blake Barnett alongside hunter Jimmy Reynolds as they take part in the 2nd Annual Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. This meaningful whitetail hunt is made possible by the great folks at Disabled Outdoorsmen. Jimmy settles in at the G2 Ranch in South Texas, where prime whitetail country and a shared passion for the outdoors set the stage for an unforgettable hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair tries for an upgrade off the coast of Naples.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads out by himself out of Cape Canaveral and gets a surprise at the end.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: The first half Blair heads out with Greggor Dornau of Starbrite Solutions, then in the second half goes fishing with Capt. Bobby lane for bass.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: A collection of the fish that didn't make the cut for an episode, so they get their own episode.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle explores the Great Lakes on his Sea-Doo in search of walleye and lake trout.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: : Colder temps in the South bring two things: ducks and duck hunters. Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are back in public timber, but so is the public. Will they get the hole? Will birds flare from sky busters? Find out on this week's episode.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree’s Colton Jordan brings down a banded mallard at Fowlers Point, a legendary duck hunting club in the heart of the Arkansas flyway.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck checks one off the bucket list. He's hunting gators for the first time.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew wraps up duck season in Louisiana.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Highlights from Dr. Duck and Billy's Duckcation in Washington. Dennis and Billy take a break every year during the Texas Split to hunt with Eagles Lakes Ranch. It is a good break from the public land duck hunting grind. Check out the highlights from this years trip.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela is on a mission to better understand how wild-harvested protein contributes economically and culturally to society in North America. Join him as he learns more about the Wild Harvest Initiative and sets out to harvest his own food for the freezer.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Travelling to Vancouver Island, Dan Cabela meets with tribal leader Chief Cootes to learn more about how the careful management of black bears offers economic benefits while maintaining cultural importance to his community.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela joins conservationists in unraveling the complexity of human wildlife conflict and the reality of living with Africa’s apex predator - the Lion. While the Cabela Family Foundation undertakes the largest ever lion translocation.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explains the domestic trade in exotic wildlife and how some of our planet’s most threatened species are being protected by the practice.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson's thrilling adventure in Tanzania continues as he sets his sights on the elusive Grant's Gazelle and the striking Fringe-Eared Oryx. Armed with his precision-engineered Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, Mark is poised to make every shot count. The real challenge lies not just in the accuracy of his aim but in getting close enough to these magnificent creatures.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and his father Earl have spent six thrilling days immersed in the wilds of Tanzania, exploring the heart of Africa. Next on their adventure, they set out to hunt the elusive Chandler's Mountain Reed buck. However, the raging river poses a formidable challenge, making it too dangerous to cross. Undeterred, they adapt by using alternative means of transportation. Armed with their trusty Gunwerks rifles, they navigate the rugged terrain, determined to get close to these elusive creatures amidst the stunning and challenging landscape.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isn’t able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he continues his hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of Maasai Land, Tanzania. Mark moves to a different camp in this episode to pursue a Gerenuk, known for its long neck and unique browsing habits. He soon after turns his attention to the East African Impala.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke grabs a TenPoint crossbow and kicks back on "Island Time," along with the Nashville rockers from Loose Lips.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: Designed for hunters and outdoor enthusiasts, this machine combines power, comfort, and versatility to tackle even the toughest terrain. From its impressive suspension to its spacious design, the RMAX4 1000 LE is built to perform in the field and beyond.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We follow along with the crew from Struttinbuck on their annual Father Son hunt at FE Hill. No matter what happens throughout the year this is always a must have trip and a time to settle down and enjoy the great outdoors.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc:
"On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.
Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen’s 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin’s history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson finds himself deep in the heart of Peru and focuses on completing the prestigious South America Upland Slam. With only one bird remaining, the Western Peruvian Dove, the trip has led him to a private hunting property. This final challenge will take place over a cut cornfield, a favorite spot for the doves. To blend in, Mark and his team craft a makeshift blind using a mix of corn stalks, and timber, just enough cover while allowing for a clear shot. These West Peruvian Doves are known for their erratic flight patterns, often bouncing from one tree to another in a random manner, making timing and placement critical.

programme.desc:
In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true?
We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like.
We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Wildbound by Forloh
programme.desc: In this episode Andy and his friend Scotty take on Kodiak Island, Alaska for an adventure of Salmon fishing and hunting black tail deer. Whilst traversing steep mountains in the company of Kodiak brown bears and taking on cold Alaskan waters, Andy presents useful information for fellow outdoor enthusiasts all whilst building friendships with the great people of Kodiak Big Timber Lodge.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey from The Lindsey Way is on a mission for one deer — a buck they call “Junior.” After passing him the year before, Jeff spends months trying to catch up with the elusive whitetail. He makes mistakes, second-guesses himself, and faces plenty of close calls. But exactly one year to the day after letting Junior walk, Jeff climbs back into the same stand — and this time, it all comes together.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, we're headed out to Oklahoma to follow along with the Sharp brothers as they hunt whitetails in their home state. You never know what to expect with these two but one thing you can always rely on is that they always have some big deer to go after!

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Heading to one of the great wilderness areas of North America, Dan Cabela is in search of Stone Sheep in British Columbia. Joining scientists, they embark on an ambitious conservation project to help conserve this incredible species.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: To kill ducks late season, you need to get off the grid and "FIND THE X". Realtree's Cole Barthel, Kyle Barefield, Stephen McNelly and Producer Matt Garger do exactly that. Hunting Ducks from a boat won't be easy but their struggles are well worth their while.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2023 - US Open 2023 – Women’s Pro Doubles Bronze Medal – Truong & Rane vs Pisnik & Emmrich
programme.desc: At the 2023 US Open Pickleball Championships in Naples, Florida, Tina Pisnik and Tammy Emmrich square off against Alix Truong and Milan Rane in the Women’s Pro Doubles Bronze Medal match. Expect aggressive shot-making, quick court coverage, and intense chemistry on both sides as these athletes leave it all on the court.

programme.title: National Collegiate Pickleball Association (NCPA) - NCPA Utah Regional 2025 - Utah Tech1 vs. Utah Tech2
programme.desc: A high-level pickleball match from the 2025 NCPA Utah Regional as the Utah Tech collegiate program's top two teams battle head-to-head. Filmed live at Club Pickleball USA in Orem, Utah, this episode features the Women's Doubles showdown between the #2 seed Utah Tech 1, featuring Lauren Mercado and Ella Boydston, against the #3 seed Utah Tech 2, anchored by NCPA commentator Dillon Champigny and rising star Mary Monson. Experience the intense collegiate format, which includes singles, doubles, and mixed doubles, a design optimized based on direct player feedback.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2023 - US Open Pickleball Championships 2023 - Men's Senior Pro Doubles - Gold Medal
programme.desc: John Sperling & Dave Weinbach fighting for Gold against Altaf Merchant & Dayne Gingrich at the Men’s Pro Doubles

programme.title: Tuesday Night Pickleball - Tuesday Night Pickleball 2023 – AZ PBL Team Match – Gladiators vs Tornadoes
programme.desc: Tune in for a high-energy match between the Gilbert Gladiators and the Tempe Tornadoes at The Orchard in Scottsdale, Arizona. This April 25, 2023 episode of Tuesday Night Pickleball features fast-paced action and strategic plays as both teams battle it out in a pivotal match. With sharp shots, effective communication, and critical moments, the Gladiators and Tornadoes go head-to-head for a thrilling finish. Watch as the teams showcase their pickleball prowess in one of the most exciting events of the AZ PBL season.

programme.title: NPL - 2024 NPL – Women’s Team Match – Scorpions vs Iconics
programme.desc: The Coachella Valley Scorpions take on the Denver Iconics in a thrilling women’s National Pickleball League showdown from the 2024 season. From powerful baseline drives to lightning-fast net battles, both teams bring competitive spirit and polished teamwork to the court. Whether you're a seasoned fan or new to the NPL, this match showcases the rising talent and intensity of women’s pro pickleball. Every point matters — and momentum can shift in a flash.

programme.title: World Pickleball League (WPBL) - WPBL 2025 - Bengaluru vs. Pune - Finals
programme.desc: It's the moment of truth! Championship Sunday has arrived for the World Pickleball League (WPBL) as the Bengaluru Jawans take on Pune United for the title. Prepare yourself for an intense matchup -from Men's Singles right through to Mixed Doubles!

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2024 - US Open 2024 – Men’s Split Pro Doubles Gold Medal Match – Frazier & Merchant vs Daescu & Weinbach
programme.desc: In this thrilling gold medal match from the 2024 US Open Pickleball Championships, Dylan Frazier and Altaf Merchant take on defending champions Andrei Daescu and Dave Weinbach in the Men’s Split Pro Doubles division. The action heats up fast as Frazier and Merchant dominate early, only to be met with a fierce comeback from Daescu and Weinbach in game two. Momentum swings, net-cord drama, and tactical shifts lead to an electrifying third game where every point counts.From Frazier’s lightning-fast hands to Daescu’s towering net play, this match showcases elite shot-making, sharp strategy, and high emotion on Championship Court. With the crowd on edge and the gold medal on the line, it’s a true masterclass in professional pickleball.

programme.title: All Florida Pro League - AFPL Stop 4 Championship Court - Game 1 - Miami Blaze vs. Fort Myers Flamingos
programme.desc: The episode kicks off with the women's singles match, where the Miami team battles it out against the Fort Myers Flamingos. The focus shifts to men's singles in the second half of the game, highlighting the veteran Miami team and their notable chemistry on the court. Tune in to see key plays, player highlights, and team strategy.

programme.title: NPL - Scorpions vs Iconics (Men)
programme.desc: The Coachella Valley Scorpions face off against the Denver Iconics in a men's NPL team match.

programme.title: Picklebowl 2022 - Picklebowl 2022 – Mixed Doubles – Patterson & Taylor vs Fudge & Anderson
programme.desc: The 2022 Picklebowl offers an unforgettable mixed doubles match featuring some of the biggest names in sports. US Olympian Casey Patterson and pickleball pro Chuck Taylor join forces to take on pickleball standout Megan Fudge and former tennis world No. 5 Kevin Anderson. Set against the scenic backdrop of Sea Island, Georgia, this unique event blends elite pickleball play with charity and college pride. Expect explosive rallies, pinpoint accuracy, and powerful serves in this high-energy exhibition that showcases the crossover appeal of pickleball.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2024 - US Open Pickleball Championships 2024 - Women's Split Pro Doubles - Semifinal
programme.desc: Megan Fudge and Karin Kochis take on Ryann Foster and Lee Whitwell in this Women's Split Pro Doubles semifinal match.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2023 - US Open Pickleball Championships 2023 - Mixed Pro Split Age - Semifinal 2
programme.desc: Mixed Pro split age - Simone Jardim & Jaime Oncins competing with Susannah Barr & Dave Weinbach in the second Semifinal match.

programme.title: Picklebowl 2023 - Picklebowl 2023 - Full Tournament
programme.desc: In this charity showdown, Pro pickleball players and celebs will represent their alma maters and battle it out for the Picklebowl 2023 trophy. Hosted by Heisman Trophy winner and former NFL player turned pickleball enthusiast, Danny Wuerffel.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2025 - US Open 2025 - Women's Pro Singles - Jardim vs. Kop
programme.desc: Get ready for a great singles match as Simone Jardim takes on Kristen Kopp at the Usopp National Pickleball Center. This venue, home to the Usopp Pickleball Academy, is a hub for lessons and training, making it an amazing facility for all things pickleball.

programme.title: National Collegiate Pickleball Association (NCPA) - NCPA Indiana Regional 2025 - Collegiate Team Match - Wisconsin vs. Purdue
programme.desc: Live from The Picklr in Noblesville, this NCPA Indiana Regional 2025 matchup features a critical battle between the University of Wisconsin-Madison and Purdue University. With eight national bids and $5,000 in prize money on the line, the stakes are high as the 16th-seeded Purdue takes on the 17th-seeded Wisconsin in a best-of-seven format.The match kicks off with Gender Doubles, where Wisconsin’s duo of Noah and Sarah Sowinski showcase dominant net play and quick hands against Purdue’s Caleb Yang and Trevor Ju. Watch for standout moments, including an incredible Ernie from Wisconsin and strategic adjustments in the Mixed Doubles games involving Colton Thielman and Elena Schlichte.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2023 - US Open 2023 – Women’s Senior Pro Doubles Quarterfinal – Wilhelm & Shirley vs LeBlang & Tarn
programme.desc: In this gripping quarterfinal from the 2023 US Open Pickleball Championships, Helen Wilhelm and Anna Shirley face Suzanne LeBlang and Teresa Tarn in a thrilling three-game battle. Featuring powerful strokes, smart resets, and tactical momentum shifts, this senior pro women’s doubles match highlights both experience and finesse. Watch as the teams adapt and clash in a showcase of skill and strategy at the highest level.

programme.title: Pickleball England - English Nationals 2023 – Women’s Doubles Final – Giuliano & Kao vs Kubrick-Finney & Lock
programme.desc: Catch the final showdown from the 2023 English Nationals as Mollie Kubrick-Finney and Thaddea Lock challenge reigning champs Antonella Giuliano and Pei Chun Kao. Featuring sharp angles, aggressive volleys, and expert analysis, this match crowns the best in British women’s doubles.

programme.title: World Pickleball League (WPBL) - WPBL 2026 - Delhi vs Chennai - Day 1 Tie 2
programme.desc: The World Pickleball League Season 2 continues its high-energy opening day at the Jio World Garden in Mumbai with a star-studded clash between Delhi Dilwale and the Chennai Super Champs. Watch as international stars like Delhi’s Max "Purple Jesus" Manthao and Chennai’s Hwang Nam Lee—a former Wimbledon junior doubles champion—bring world-class precision to the court. With celebrity co-owner Samantha cheering from the sidelines and strategic masterclasses from coach Wesley Gabrielsson, this tie features a gauntlet of intense Women’s Singles, Men's Singles, and high-speed Doubles matches. Experience every "Ernie" shot, tactical "pickle play," and the longest video challenge in league history as these two powerhouse teams battle for early-season dominance.

programme.title: World Pickleball League (WPBL) - WPBL 2026 - Mumbai Pickle Power vs. Delhi World - Day 2 Tie 1
programme.desc: Experience the "clash for the ages" as host city Mumbai Pickle Power takes on their fierce rivals, Delhi Dilwale, in a thrilling Day 2 encounter of the World Pickleball League Season 2. The day begins on a somber note with a tribute to the late Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Shri Ajit Pawar, as players compete with black armbands in front of a quieted stadium.

programme.title: National Collegiate Pickleball Association (NCPA) - NCPA Indiana Regional 2025 - Collegiate Team Match - Wisconsin vs. Purdue
programme.desc: Live from The Picklr in Noblesville, this NCPA Indiana Regional 2025 matchup features a critical battle between the University of Wisconsin-Madison and Purdue University. With eight national bids and $5,000 in prize money on the line, the stakes are high as the 16th-seeded Purdue takes on the 17th-seeded Wisconsin in a best-of-seven format.The match kicks off with Gender Doubles, where Wisconsin’s duo of Noah and Sarah Sowinski showcase dominant net play and quick hands against Purdue’s Caleb Yang and Trevor Ju. Watch for standout moments, including an incredible Ernie from Wisconsin and strategic adjustments in the Mixed Doubles games involving Colton Thielman and Elena Schlichte.

programme.title: US Open Pickleball Championships 2025 - US Open 2025 - Mixed Split Pro Age - Oncins/Jardim vs. Miscik/Domoracki
programme.desc: Get ready for an exciting Mixed Split Pro Age pickleball match featuring the formidable team of Jaime Oncins and Simone Jardim against the new pairing of Ryan Miscik and Christie Domoracki. Oncins is a former professional tennis player from Brazil. His partner, Simone Jardim, is a professional pickleball player, a Pickleball Hall of Fame inductee, and was once ranked the number one female player in the world. They face a new team with Ryan Miscik, a pro pickleball player and coach based in Venice, Florida. His partner, Christie Domoracki, is a player located in Boca Grande, Florida. This match brings together a mix of experienced pros and up-and-coming talent for a high-stakes competition on Florida's Paradise Coast.

programme.desc: In this US Open 2025 Pro Women's Doubles match, the Waters duo (Anna Lee Waters and Lee Waters) take on Amanda Rosati and Kaitlyn Campbell. The commentators highlight the Waters' dominant performance, particularly Anna Lee's disguised shots and aggressive play, as they secure a swift victory. They also discuss the challenges of the progressive draw format in pickleball and preview Anna Lee Waters' upcoming mixed doubles match with Andre Agassi.

The rivalry matchup features the top teams from Utah Valley University and Utah Tech.This broadcast highlights the intense Men's Doubles game, where Utah Tech's star player Liam Duffin—hailed as one of the top collegiate players nationwide—teams up with Clayton Boydston to face Utah Valley's duo of Bryce Larson and Charles Case.The stakes are high: teams are competing for $5,000 in scholarship money and a coveted bid to the National Championship in St. Louis, Missouri, where $30,000 is on the line. Ultimately, Utah Tech's first team prevails, taking home the national bid and the Utah Regional title.

The match is a tactical masterclass, with Willie Chung noted for his consistent, pro-level reset game and Farias praised for his on-court intelligence.

Follow expert commentary highlighting key plays including Susannah Barr’s precise lobs, Megan Fudge’s powerful forehand, and strategic teamwork. See how the match unfolds in a best-of-three games format with a hard stop on time. This showcase of top-level English pickleball captures the skill, tactics, and intensity of the sport. Stay tuned for post-match insights and upcoming mixed doubles action.

programme.title: Flipside - NowHere Episode 10
programme.desc: Flipside is the show that takes you behind the scenes with Absinthe Films during the making of our latest snowboard movie - NowHere. Follow the life and times of a handful of the most progressive and entertaining riders in snowboarding. Our 2010 Flipside series is broadcasted in 10-12 minute webisodes on various networks, but you can always get the newest releases at absinthe-films.com.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: NowHere
programme.desc: A 2010 winter journey with riders facing harsh conditions and deeper questions. This Absinthe Films documentary explores perception, purpose, and the fine line between feeling lost and finding where you truly belong.

programme.title: Flipside - NowHere Episode 10
programme.desc: Flipside is the show that takes you behind the scenes with Absinthe Films during the making of our latest snowboard movie - NowHere. Follow the life and times of a handful of the most progressive and entertaining riders in snowboarding. Our 2010 Flipside series is broadcasted in 10-12 minute webisodes on various networks, but you can always get the newest releases at absinthe-films.com.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: NowHere
programme.desc: A 2010 winter journey with riders facing harsh conditions and deeper questions. This Absinthe Films documentary explores perception, purpose, and the fine line between feeling lost and finding where you truly belong.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: NowHere
programme.desc: A 2010 winter journey with riders facing harsh conditions and deeper questions. This Absinthe Films documentary explores perception, purpose, and the fine line between feeling lost and finding where you truly belong.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Back Yard Boogie
programme.desc: Terje Haakonsen rips his back yard on the snow-skate and Rip Zinger...well, yeah he gets creative too.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Winter Leisure
programme.desc: Legendary snowboarder Terje Haakonsen finds new joy in riding small parks and mellow terrain wherever he goes, explaining, “What I like about snowskates is that it makes small hills big again.” Join us for this fascinating look at snowskate subculture.

programme.title: Mission Antarctic
programme.desc: ‘Mission Antarctic’ is a snowboarding expedition to the world’s end. Xavier de le Rue and Lucas DeBari set out from the Falklands on a 20-meter sailboat, navigating the Drake Passage to explore the Antarctic Peninsula. Awarded ‘Best Freeride Movie’ at the 2013 International Freeride Film Festival.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: Yellow Flickers
programme.desc: Do the lines in the road countdown to a supposed arrival? Or are they added up within us, allowing us to grow?

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: Visions
programme.desc: Starring: Nikolai Schirmer, Flo Bastien, Julien Lange, Anttu Oikonen. Directed by Joonas Mattila Supported by Black Crows, Level, Norrona, O'neil. Locations: Chamonix, Arlberg, Val d'Isere.

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: WOLF
programme.desc:
Everything is back to normal... But why do we feel that we've lost something? WOLF is a feeling, about mountains and skiing.
WOLF is the new movie by Sam Favret. Sequel to the successful FLOW, made during the pandemic in Chamonix. WOLF is quite the opposite, and it makes us think about what was good last winter.
Skier: Sam Favret (IG samfavret) Directed by: Maxime Moulin (IG maximemoulin) Drone by: Hensli Sage Sound Design: Mix & Mouse Voice over: Bird - Michael Shaffer Screenplay: Jerome Llado Photographer: Fabian Bodet Producer: Sam Favret
Produced by: Clustr.Films lin (IG clustrfilms)
Supported by: blackcrows DB Bollé
Special thanks : Samaya Nikolai Schirmer Sebastien Overney Simon Morice Yannick Boissenot Flo Bastien
Additional cinematography Joonas Mattila

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 1: Julien Regnier
programme.desc: In Episode 1, we meet Julien Regnier. For many years, Regnier has been a central figure in freeskiing. First, as an athlete and trick inventor, then as a connoisseur collector of skis. Today, he is a master ski shaper at Black Crows, providing the means for any trick to be performed.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 2: Yorgo Tloupas
programme.desc: In Episode 2, we meet Yorgo Tloupas, the graphic development manager and visual identity creator for Black Crows. Yorgo is a cosmopolitan artist, action-sports aficionado, cigarillo smoker, fixie pedaller, and cylinder head. He wears many hats. Above all, he is a great illuminator of oblong shapes.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 3: Minna Riihimaki
programme.desc: In Episode 3, you will encounter a Crow from the early days, Minna Riihimaki. A native of northern Europe. A passionate and lively adventurer. With contagious joy, Minna fed the Black Crows DNA. When she’s not skiing, she’s also a dentist, which is cool.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 4: Callum Pettit
programme.desc: In Episode 4, we meet Callum Pettit, a mountain calligrapher, in his Whistler hideout in the heart of British Columbia, Canada.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Here Goes
programme.desc: Before ‘Skier of the Year’ Sam Kuch drops into any line, he utters the mantra, “here goes.” What began as a superstitious habit has become the confidence booster he uses to face any task. Watch this high-caliber short film about skiing, focus, and execution.

programme.title: Live For This: Float
programme.desc: A film about snowboarders and skiers slashing snow-covered walls, chasing the feeling of weightlessness. We crave those moments when distractions fall away and we lock into mountain life. We dream of it. We study weather forecasts all season. We wake before sunrise. We hit the road in search of it.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 5: Jose Lagarellos
programme.desc: In Episode 5, we meet Jose Lagarellos. He is a passionate big mountain skier. He is also the DJ and electronic events organizer behind the Chamonix Unlimited Festival. Like us, he loves original spaces and synthetic sounds. Watch now.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 6: Bruno Compagnet & Camille Jaccoux
programme.desc: In Episode 6, we meet Camille Jaccoux and Bruno Compagnet, the founders of Black Crows. In 2000, two pro skiers brought a new ski to life. Their sole aim was to make a ski that could adapt to the needs of big mountain skiing. Today, their products are used on every mountain range around the globe.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 7: Hervé Picamelot
programme.desc: For Hervé Picamelot, winter is first and foremost about the road. Each weekend, he leaves his native village in Burgundy and his family’s ancient vines for his second home, Chamonix. A radical life choice, between two vastly different universes and their celestial aromas: skiing and wine.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 8: Christina Lustenberger
programme.desc: In Episode 8, we meet Christina Lustenberger. This ex-alpine racer, turned ACMG ski guide possesses all the attributes of a prominent mountain skier: passion, drive and constant wonder. If you enjoy skiing adventures, this episode is not to be missed.

programme.title: Drawn From Here
programme.desc: Drawn From Here is an exploration of professional skier Eric Pollard's processes as an athlete, product designer, and artist. The film follows the influences he draws from and chronicles a pivotal injury Pollard endured during the winter of 2013. Named Powder Magazine's "Movie of the Year.”

programme.title: After The Sky Falls
programme.desc: "After The Sky Falls" captures the skiing of Eric Pollard, Chris Benchetler and Pep Fujas. Two years in the making, this film beautifully documents the Nimbus crew’s approach to skiing, their focus on fun and creativity, and their desire to inspire everyday skiers.

programme.title: Unraveling - Chris Benchetler
programme.desc: Progression means something different to everyone. To Chris Benchetler, progression means evolving as a professional skier, as an artist, and as a father. It means growth, unraveling expectations, and changes over time. It means simplicity, clarity, and freedom. Filmed by director Tyler Hamlet.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 9: Kristoffer Turdell
programme.desc: In Episode 9, we encounter skier Kristoffer Turdell, two-time champion of the freeride world. Join us for this special Black Crows documentary about the animal from Gallivare, Sweden. Directed by Nikolai Schirmer.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 10: Beau Fredlund
programme.desc: A yurt, 140 inhabitants in town, a door that opens on the northeast of Yellowstone National Park in Montana, a fireplace, a pair of skis, welcome to Beau's wild garden. a film by Nikolai Schirmer

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 11: The Jackson 9
programme.desc: Jackson Hole, Wyoming is home to some of the most epic skiing in North America. It is also home to a bunch of bohemian skiers nicknamed the Jackson 9. In Episode 11, we kick off Part One of our documentary series dedicated to these hobo shredders and beautiful souls. Directed by Nicolai Schirmer.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 12: Nikolai Schirmer
programme.desc: He is tall, handsome, smart, sensitive and on fire while on skis. Nikolai Schirmer, skier, bohemian-movie-maker, reveals himself in this black doc where his meandering path unfolds. An itinerary full of waves and mountains where we discover a man whose heart has progressively tuned in to the rhythm of nature.

programme.title: Snowflake
programme.desc: Witness the joys and wonders of nature through the eyes of Snowflake, an eccentric Swiss skier with a life philosophy just as beautiful and perfectly unique as his namesake.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Motherload
programme.desc: The hardest part of any adventure is getting out the door. Planning is tedious. Packing is time consuming. Once on-hill, everything falls into place. Follow pro skiers Izzy Lynch and Tessa Treadway as they carry the load of life changing events and the love of their children into the mountains.

programme.title: The Ghost Ski Resorts - Fortress
programme.desc: Deep in the Rockies stands Fortress Mountain. From the late 1960s through the 1980s, this landmark ski area buzzed with activity. Today, it is a quiet thing of abandoned beauty. Skiers Mark Abma and Callum Pettit explore the past and ponder the future of this once iconic Alberta destination.

programme.title: The Ghost Ski Resorts - Ski Rio
programme.desc: In January 2000, Ski Rio closed one night. The resort has remained dormant ever since. It’s no stretch to compare Ski Rio’s snow covered lodgings to the Overlook Hotel in the cult classic thriller The Shining. Just like in the film, the innkeeper Joe Musich admits his job can get a little spooky.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 13: The Groomer Crow - Bernie Rosow
programme.desc: Do you despise your office job? If so, Episode 13 offers the truth, the way, and the light. Bernie Rosow could neither consider a life without skiing, nor skiing without the freedom of skiing. Now a snowcat operator, his night shift allows him to solve the equation and to freeski every day, freely.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 14: Tony & Deano - Ski Bums Forever
programme.desc: In Episode 14, we honor our friends Tony Stadler and Deano Dacas. Before Black Crows was ever conceived, we were skiing for years with these two. And we will keep on skiing with them, whatever happens. We are the ski bum crows brotherhood forever.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 15: Gabriella Palko
programme.desc: Gabby Palko is living what many skiers would call a dream life. From her sailboat in the Port of Valdez, she is able to ski the Alaskan mountains as often as she likes. In this emotional documentary, she connects the dots between the two parts of her life, broken by the long illness of her father.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Ep 16: Mustafa Ceylan
programme.desc:
a skier's journey from soccer prodigy to falling in love with the ski experience A Swiss crow of Kurdish descent, necessarily multilingual and multiple, Moustique (French for “mosquito”) is a relentless lover of skiing. Having fun is the most important thing for this skier who only fell in love with skiing at the age of 15 but whose passion has grown more intense every day since. Moustique falls a lot but as he says, "that's how you learn". A true skibum, dedicated and single minded.
directed by : Jules Guarneri & Benoît Goncerut produced by : Camille Jaccoux filmed and edited by : Jules Guarneri color grading : Julien Roserens audio mix : Marc Staedler

programme.title: The Black Crows - Ep 17: Michael “Bird” Shaffer
programme.desc:
Bird's story is a patchwork, fragments and colorful stages that, in retrospect, mark out a journey still in motion. As everything is a cycle, and for this winged animal, it all comes back to the source, as he does himself every summer, back in Twisp (Washington), in the hilly land of his childhood.
Born into an atypical family, a fighter pilot father who left everything behind to follow his wife to a hippie project in the hills of Washington State, Michael Shaffer was raised free and happy, close to nature. Those were also hard and frugal years, which forged an iconoclastic character but above all one of unlimited freedom. Whether he skis, flies or speaks, Bird radiates this independence, this quiet sovereignty, of one who has no ties and is content with little. He is happy to sleep on a sofa if the skiing is good and to drink water, as long as, the party goes on.
In this new black doc, we fly in the wake of the rare bird, this original crow who has been skiing the chevron since the very beginning, in a unique and unbridled sensory flashback, from the chicken coop to the dance floor.
additional thanks to Shane Wilder and the Stevens Pass Crew, Logan Sheppard-Bird the kid stunt-double and Alex Bosco for the conceptualizaton and additional cinematography. As well as all the fine-feathered shredder friends out there kaw kaw

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: Wavy 2
programme.desc: After filming WAVY, director Nikolai Schirmer promised himself that he would never set foot on a ship again. Find out how he ended up off the coast of Svalbard with an excited rookie, a contemptuous captain, and a reformed drug addict, in this thrilling and often comical ski adventure documentary.

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: La Sentinelle - The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Bruno Compagnet and Camille Jaccoux are friends and co-founders of Black Crows, the iconic ski brand, and La Sentinelle, the renown ski touring event. Two passionate practitioners in conversation, always seeking the wild, beautiful, and natural side of the mountain.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 1 - LAAX
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes with Absinthe Films and the legendary professional snowboarders Nicolas Müller and Wolfgang Nyvelt as they score epic powder at Laax Resort in Switzerland. Nicolas shows the crew around his home terrain, hitting up big hits and dreamy powder fields.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 2 - LAAX
programme.desc: In episode 2 of the Absinthe Films Flipside series, Nicolas Müller and Wolfgang Nyvelt continue exploring Nicolas’ backyard, the Laax Resort in Switzerland. With snow this deep, the mountain is an endless playground.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 3 - LAAX
programme.desc: Snowboarders always have secret stashes. This is especially true for Nicolas Müller. Watch as the Laax local takes Wolle Nyvelt to his favorite spots on the mountain. If you like perfect jumps high above the clouds, powder landings, frontside 1080s, and beautiful sunsets, this episode is for you.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 4 - ARLBERG
programme.desc: In 2012, snowboarder Danny Kass captured his debut part with Absinthe Films. To begin, Kass met up with Eric Jackson in Gigi Rüf’s hometown of Arlberg, Austria. While there, a war broke out between the film crew and the locals. Watch as Gigi steps in to keep the peace.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 5 - ARLBERG
programme.desc: Danny Kass, Gigi Rüf, and Wolle Nyvelt meet up in Arlberg, Austria. The crew spends the day fine-tuning their jump and bagging a perfect bluebird session. Danny puts down his first 720 of the year. Gigi takes a heavy slam trying backside double corks. But wait, there’s more! Drama ensues!

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 6 - SAINT LUC
programme.desc: The Absinthe Films crew scores great weather, perfect snow, and no shortage of terrain options in Saint Luc, Switzerland. Young guns Pat Burgener and Mat Schaer send it during a double cork session. Sylvain Bourbousson, Lucas Debari and Mat tackle more natural kickers and lines.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 7 - SAAS FEE
programme.desc: The superhuman Danny Kass and legendary Nicolas Müller reunite with the Absinthe Films crew in Switzerland. From the word “GO!,” the guys score epic powder conditions. Nico goes off slashing. Danny locks down the biggest backflip of his life.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 8 - SAAS FEE
programme.desc: In this episode of Flipside, Danny Kass flips a coin in Saas Fee. Tails he stays in Switzerland. Heads he goes home. Switzerland it is! Now on a solo mission, Kass stacks clips for the cameras of Absinthe Films director Patrick Armbruster. This is Danny Kass at his best.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Resonance
programme.desc: Resonance stands as a defining Absinthe Films classic, shot across Japan, Switzerland, and Alaska. Featuring Gigi Rüf, Nicolas Müller, Lucas Debari, Danny Kass, Annie Boulanger, Scotty Lago, Bode Merrill, and more in peak form.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 01
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 02
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 03
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 04
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 05
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Lay Down Your Weapons
programme.desc: “Lay Down Your Weapons” is a respite from the cacophony of the world. Atoms and Void is musician Arlie Carstens, of Seattle’s Juno, and producer Eric Fisher. Known for his skateboarding films, Director Greg Hunt here lets landscapes and cityscapes slowly unfold. Breathe deeply, watch and listen.

programme.title: Echo Chamber
programme.desc: In 2020, Brandon Cocard dropped “Echo Chamber,” featuring cameos from Miles Fallon, Kazu Kokubo, Taylor Elliott, Brendon Rego, Kevin Backstrom, Mike Rav, Kaede Yasunaga, Keisuke Yoshida and Chris Beresford. Filmed in Hokkaido, Japan and Salt Lake City, Utah by Sam Tuor. Music by Cocard and friends.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Turbo Dojo
programme.desc: Hailed as one of the standout Absinthe productions "TurboDojo" features Mikkel Bang, Nicolas Müller, Kimmy Fasani, Hans Mindnich, Brandon Cocard, Austen Sweetin, Brendan Gerard, Ben Ferguson, Max Buri, and more.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Nippow Holiday
programme.desc: Snowboarder Terje Haakonsen invites the filmmaker and musician, Leo Cittadella, to join him and Rip Zinger on a powder trip to Hokkaido, Japan. Along the way, they meet up with Nicolas Müller and Mikkel Bang to film for the Absinthe Films feature "TurboDojo.”

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Happo One
programme.desc: On his 45th trip to Japan (since 1991), Terje rides powder in the Japanese Alps with the snowboarders Leo Cittadella, Rip Zinger, Curtis Ciszek, Oli Gittler and Ian Tobin.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Happo Two
programme.desc: The snowboarders Rip Zinger and Terje Haakonsen ride powder in Japan. Years after his recovery from a debilitating head injury, they get Kevin Pearce back on snow. Join us for this episode of friendship, freshies, and freeriding.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Happo Three
programme.desc: Snowboarder Terje Haakonsen explores the joys of Japanese mountain culture with his friends Kevin Pearce, Mikkel Bang, Rip Zinger, Oli Gittler, Curtis Ciszek, Leo Cittadella and Ian Tobin.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Relax If You Can
programme.desc: Terje Haakonsen and Leo Cittadella go snowskating at the vast Austrian ski resort of Ischgl. While enjoying a timeout along the Swiss-Austrian border, they discuss European cultural differences and similarities.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Half Banked at Mt Baker
programme.desc: Terje and Leo Cittadella head to Mt. Baker, Washington to meet up with with Russell Winfield and Rip Zinger to compete in the 33rd Legendary Banked Slalom. During a windstorm, a tree falls on the house while everyone is asleep. Terje gets waxing tips from Olympic gold medalist Seth Westcott.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: Attunga - A Higher Place
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of three Norwegian snowboarders: legendary purist Terje Haakonsen, holistic-minded Torgeir Bergrem, and carefree wunderkind Marcus Kleveland. Watch as filmmaker and snowboarder Seth Huot pulls back the curtain to examine their common purpose, potential, pitfalls, and paychecks.

programme.title: Artist Profile - José Medeles
programme.desc: For most artists, music is a way of life. On this episode of the Artist Profile series, we follow José Medeles through a day in the life as he shares his journey from La Salle, Illinois to touring with The Breeders, to founding the Revival Drum Shop and making music as one half of 1939 Ensemble.

programme.title: Marmoset Presents: Bridge City Revival
programme.desc: Bridge City Revival is the acclaimed music collective from Portland, Oregon. Inspired by the soulful 60s, BCR was raised on The Chi-Lites, Otis Redding, Isley Brothers, Lee Fields, and Sharon Jones. Banger drum breaks. Driving bass. Rhythmic guitar. Rolling keyboards. Soulful brass. That’s BCR!

programme.title: Artist Profile - WebsterX
programme.desc: In this episode, we focus our cameras on the hip-hop artist WebsterX as he prepares for his hometown performance at the summer TDM Festival in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. FIlmed by Josh Brine and Kale Chesney.

programme.title: Visitations - La Sera: Devil’s Hearts Grow Gold
programme.desc: La Sera performing "Devils Hearts Grow Gold" at Room 205. A few days before embarking on their first UK tour, mastermind Katy Goodman (vox/bass), Jennifer Prince (guitar/vox), and Jonathan Weil (drums), stopped by to blast through a few songs from Katy's upcoming full-length on Hardly Art.

programme.title: Visitations - La Sera: Never Come Around
programme.desc: La Sera performing 'Never Come Around' at Room 205. A few days before embarking on their first UK tour, La Sera stopped by Room 205 to play songs from the band’s upcoming LP on Hardly Art. The project's inspiration springs from an attraction to ethereal choral vocals and pop hits of the 1950's.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Lay Down Your Weapons
programme.desc: “Lay Down Your Weapons” is a respite from the cacophony of the world. Atoms and Void is musician Arlie Carstens, of Seattle’s Juno, and producer Eric Fisher. Known for his skateboarding films, Director Greg Hunt here lets landscapes and cityscapes slowly unfold. Breathe deeply, watch and listen.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Waves Of Blood
programme.desc: The core of Atoms and Void is formed in the friendship and songwriting partnership of Arlie Carstens and Eric Fisher. “Waves of Blood” features cartwheeling post-rock guitars, buoyant bass, and double-drummers bashing away like shutters in a hurricane. Good for long walks and red-eye flights.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - This Departing Landscape
programme.desc: Atoms and Void is formed in the songwriting partnership of Arlie Carstens and Eric Fisher.
