The video for the song, “This Departing Landscape,” is an awkwardly beautiful collection of footage from years of touring and recording, proving the maxim, “life is about the journey, not the destination.”

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Golden Shivers
programme.desc: Atoms and Void is formed in the songwriting partnership of Arlie Carstens and Eric Fisher. “Golden Shivers” is a beautiful piece of ambient electronic music akin to the works of minimalist composers Steve Reich and Meredith Monk. Good for running, dancing, driving, and doing the dishes. Play loud.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Pop
programme.desc: Pop stands as a genre-defining Absinthe Films release, featuring peak performances from Travis Rice, Romain De Marchi, Nicolas Müller, Gigi Rüf, and more. In 2004, awarded Best Film of the Year by TransWorld Snowboarding and Snowboarder Magazine.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Twe12ve
programme.desc: A winter of extremes sets the stage for Twe12ve. Absinthe Films follows twelve riders chasing record snow across legendary ranges, pushing boundaries and redefining what’s possible in another wintry shred classic.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: Escramble
programme.desc: In a time beyond and close to now... a vision was revealed. A vision of the very first dream of life. The dream of life before there was life. The dream that vapor dreams of becoming solid and falling to meet whatever will catch and hold it. Thus begins "ESCRAMBLE". Featuring Bjorn Leines, Terje Haakonsen, Mark Landvik, Wille Yli-Louma, Shaun White, Seth Huot, Gigi Rüf, Erik Leines, Bryan Iguchi, Chris Demolski and Jamie Lynn.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: 9191
programme.desc: 9191 is a sideways introspective into the bewildering snow-covered dreamscape of international time traveler and mystic of the shred - Gigi Rüf.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Isle Of Snow
programme.desc: Join us as we explore the snowboard world through the perspectives of the people who live it and have made it their lives follow their passions.

programme.title: The Manboys Movie
programme.desc: The boys are back with new friends and a brand new snowboard film. The Manboys Movie will definitely top your expectations. Featuring bangers from Chris Rasman, Rusty Ockenden, Craig McMorris, Jody Wachniak, Matt Belzile, Anto Chamberland, and Mark Sollors.

programme.title: The ManBoys Presents: Snowdance
programme.desc: Snowdance is a backcountry snowboarding film. Because even if you’ve never set foot in the backcountry, you can still be grateful that it’s there. Seven years and one pandemic since their fruition, The ManBoys roster still remains largely intact with Chris Rasman, Rusty Ockenden, Matt Belzile, Jody Wachniak, Beau Bishop & Eric Jackson. Snowdance was filmed by Ben Webb, Connor Winton, Dave Craig, and Ryan Kenny.

programme.title: The ManBoys Presents: Business Casual
programme.desc: Business Casual follows the Burton Snowboards crew and the Manboys as they enjoy the best part of the season in the Whistler area while Rusty Ockenden learns to operate a camera. The ManBoys crew encourages anyone who wants to get into the backcountry to take a first aid & avalanche course with your whole crew. Be safe, have fun, learn from your mistakes - and learn from theirs. Featuring Jody Wachniak, Mark Sollors, Noah Cohen, Mikey Rencz, Matt Belzile, and Beau Bishop. Directed and edited by Rusty Ockenden

programme.title: Air Time Podcast - Sean Miskiman
programme.desc: Sean is an up-and-comer from Saskatchewan, Canada. He grew up riding contests and by the age of 18 bailed and dove head first into filming in the backcountry. He's been making a name for himself the past couple of years and has been through a lot for someone so young; from overcoming injuries, avalanche rescues, stand out clips and much more. The kids got a bright future! Thanks for joining me boss. Enjoy.

programme.title: La Zone
programme.desc:
In the early 2000's, snowboard filmer David 'Vlad' Vladyka and a handful of riders discovered an off-the-radar area on the French-Swiss border that held massive potential for shooting freestyle snowboarding. The mountain pass featured rolling terrain punctuated by steep roll overs that are perfect for building jumps. The area was Le Col de Cou, and though it had a name, the riders called it 'La Zone', a purposefully vague nickname that would help them keep the area a secret.
Over the next decade, La Zone would become one of the most productive and standard setting locations for filming freestyle snowboarding in all of Europe. Shots from La Zone were featured in several Absinthe films, and many others.
Now 20 years later, Jones team rider Mat Schaer and Vlad still return to La Zone to film from time to time, but the pristine slopes they enjoyed in the past are much harder to find as Le Col de Cou has become a popular ski touring destination.
Featuring new and historic footage from La Zone, this new short film directed by Julien Rosens, and produced by Absinthe Films, highlights the history, beauty and inevitable evolution of this legendary shred spot.
Credits LA ZONE, a movie directed by Julien Roserens Produced by Absinthe Films Supported by Jonessnowboards, Region Dents du Midi, Doodah store Edited by Jules Guarneri Soundmix by Stephane Chapelle Graphics by René Zumstein Photo by Michael Cordey Music : Tugrul by Ochre, Rhea by Yehezkel Raz, Where It Beginns It Ends by Be Still The Earth, Strange Life de YGGL, Let Us Get Out by Redder

programme.title: Doodah Presents: Spacé - Couloir
programme.desc: Snowboarder Frederik Kalbermatten lives surrounded by 13 mountains, each higher than 4,000 meters. Only a few have dared these descents. Some couloirs are accessible when conditions are perfect, others only open their doors for a brief moment. Kalbermatten masters them all with flow and style.

programme.title: La Quinta Films Presents: Lines
programme.desc: Lines is a documentary about big mountain snowboarding. The dedication. The nerve. The skill. As we follow the Absinthe Films crew for six weeks in Haines, Alaska, we also explore the colorful characters, history and dangers of big mountain riding. Directed by Axel Pauporté and Flora Richard.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Motherload
programme.desc: The hardest part of any adventure is getting out the door. Planning is tedious. Packing is time consuming. Once on-hill, everything falls into place. Follow pro skiers Izzy Lynch and Tessa Treadway as they carry the load of life changing events and the love of their children into the mountains.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 1
programme.desc: Your friends at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 2
programme.desc: The fine folks at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 3
programme.desc: The fine folks at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 4
programme.desc: The fine folks at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 01
programme.desc: Kimmy Fasani is a world class athlete, a loving mother, a natural leader, and a true champion of women in professional snowboarding. In Episode 1 of her Microdose series, we learn where Fasani’s glorious story begins. Featuring Shannon Dunn, Donna Carpenter, Hana Beaman, Gabe Taylor and Ryan Runke.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 02
programme.desc: In Episode 2 of her Microdose series, we learn how Kimmy Fasani stepped away from the contest scene and into backcountry snowboarding with help from shred legend Devun Walsh and innovator Iikka Backstrom. Featuring Chris Benchetler, Devun Walsh, Adam Moran, Bryan Knox and Peter Morning.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 03
programme.desc: As a Burton athlete, Kimmy Fasani has long been a champion of change in women's snowboarding. Innovative products. Fair pay. Better contracts. Sick ripping. Watch and be uplifted. Featuring Hana Beaman, Pat Bridges, Danny Davis, Gabe Taylor, Kevin Pearce, Bryan Knox, Adam Moran and Peter Morning.

programme.title: Evo Explores - Kimmy Fasani
programme.desc: Over the course of her career, snowboarder Kimmy Fasani has won the coveted “Women’s Rider of The Year Award” from TransWorld Snowboarding Magazine, and the “Women’s Video Part of The Year Award” from Snowboarder Magazine. This fascinating documentary captures Fasani’s first time riding in Alaska.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: AfterForever
programme.desc: When resistance fades, growth begins. AfterForever is a meditation on change, exploring evolution in snowboarding and life, and asking what happens when one chapter ends and another begins.

programme.title: Wash'Dup
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this mockumentary film will follow a group of ex- snowboard filmmakers and ex-pro riders who never hung it up. Still in love with the sport and fueled by mid life crisis, these shred for lifers are extremely vulnerable to delusions of grandeur. But the dream is always “still alive” in their minds. In turn they ignore all the red flags and continue to do what seems completely irrational to everyone except for them. After a 16 year hiatus, they irresponsibly put their adult obligations behind, and join a pact to make just one last movie. But they are missing a solid presence of youth to make their movie marketable. As a remedy they end up filming with riders that span 2 generations. This unlikely alliance leads them to discover much more about snowboarding and themselves by living the snowboarding dream through an ageless lens. Filled with sketch comedy skits, this film expresses the nuanced story of a young sport reaching a level of maturity the current industry now begins to embrace. From the death of the snowboard shop, and extinction of film media, to the old pro struggling to find their way in life after the glory days are long gone, WashDup is a story that finally needs to be told.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 01
programme.desc: Elena Hight is one of the most accomplished women in snowboarding history. Interestingly, her passion for boardsports culture originated in her home state of Hawaii on the island of Kauai. This is where Elena’s Microdose series begins. Featuring Jamie Anderson, Papa Mike, Chris Owen, Louie Vito.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 02
programme.desc: From the moment she strapped into a snowboard, Elena Hight has been an innovative and visionary force in women’s snowboarding. In Episode 2 of her Microdose series, we take a look at two of Elena’s greatest achievements. Featuring Jamie Anderson, Scotty Lago and Louie Vito.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 03
programme.desc: At age 16, during the 2006 Torino Olympics, Elena Hight was the youngest American to compete in Women’s Halfpipe. In 2010, at the Vancouver Olympics, she sowed the seeds of change to come. In Episode 3 of Elena’s Microdose series we explore more. Featuring Selema Masekela, Papa Mike and Louie Vito.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 04
programme.desc: Failure in life can be our biggest teacher. In Episode 4 of her Microdose series, we learn how Elena Hight embraced failure on the global stage, embarked on transformative change, and unlocked her next level. Featuring Selema Masekela, Hana Beaman, Spencer O'Brien, Jamie Anderson, and Jeremy Jones.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 05
programme.desc: When Elena Hight made the surprising decision to set aside her Olympic routine to pursue backcountry riding, she astonished her peers and mentors. In Episode 5 of her Microdose series, we learn how and why Elena made the leap. Featuring Jeremy Jones, Hana Beaman, Todd Jones, and Jamie Anderson.

programme.title: Hwuy’xwet Pune’luxutth (Opening Penelakut)
programme.desc: This beautiful documentary follows a group of First Nation’s students at Penelakut Island Elementary School as they work with Riley McIntosh to create a new mountain bike trail for the community. Throughout the film, director Jason Mannings shares the history of Penelakut Island and its people.

programme.title: Artist Profile - Y La Bamba
programme.desc: In this episode, we highlight the Mexican American artist Luz Mendoza of Y La Bamba. The film follows the musician as she traces her roots and creative inspirations. Filmed in 2017, on the eve of Y La Bamba's Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead) performance at Holocene in Portland, Oregon.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: On The Verge
programme.desc: In the mountains behind the coastal town of Powell River, BC, rock climbers have spent decades quietly pioneering routes on some of the largest granite walls in Canada. As the landscape comes under threat of logging, the climbing community faces an uncertain future. Lives! Logs! Legacies!

programme.title: Arc'teryx Presents: Em
programme.desc: Emilie Pellerin is the best climber you’ve never heard of. In her debut film, “Em”, director Alexa Fay sets out to prove it. To become a world class climber requires a problem-solving mindset, positivity, natural ability and commitment to the “dirtbag life.” This film puts Pellerin front and center.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Vivid
programme.desc: Absinthe Films’ Vivid highlights the breakout years of Travis Rice, Romain De Marchi, Nicolas Müller, and Gigi Rüf, delivering some of their most memorable early riding in a fan-favorite classic.

programme.title: Artist Profile - Scott Lenhardt
programme.desc: Artist Scott Lenhardt has kept everything he’s ever made for Burton Snowboards. Everything he’s ever done is stored in his childhood bedroom. After his year-long solo show at the Vermont Ski & Snowboard Museum, he organized his archives. Just like his creative process, this film is mind blowing.

programme.title: Artist Profile - Sebo Walker
programme.desc: In 2022, the art-inspired accessories brand Slowtide launched a summer collection with Portland, Oregon-based artist and skateboarder Sebo Walker. To capture the collaboration, director Jake Price spent a day cruising around Walker’s hometown, seeing the city and learning what inspires his artwork.

programme.title: Without a Paddle
programme.desc: ‘Without a Paddle’ is a canoe film about snowboarding. Four snowboarders retrace a portion of the 19th century explorer David Thompson’s journey down the Columbia River, during one of the coldest cold snaps in Revelstoke’s recorded history. Surreal landscapes, epic paddling, deep powder, and pain.

programme.title: Without a Pedal: A Bicycle Film About Snowboarding
Northbound and Around
programme.desc: Hungry for clips and greedy for turns, Johan Rosen, Garrett “Worm” Warnick and friends spent the season leaving no line unridden and no pillow unsmashed. Driven by the most unsatisfiable of desires, finding good snow, the crew spent the season running from warm temperatures and chasing down a dream. To get to the promised land, they found themselves traveling… Northbound and Around. Featuring: Garrett Warnick, Johan Rosen, Nils Arvidsson, Ryan Paterson, Keenan Filmer, Kareem El Rafie Nils Mindnich, Jess Kimura, Bode Merrill, Ben Bilocq, Brandon Davis, Nick Khattar, Kyle Mack Edited by: Johan Rosen

programme.title: CHANNEL ZeRO
programme.desc: Released in 2020, this Absinthe Films feature highlights the unifying power of snowboarding during a divisive moment in history, celebrating a global community that refuses to be separated by physical or mental barriers.

programme.title: Echo Chamber
programme.desc: In 2020, Brandon Cocard dropped “Echo Chamber,” featuring cameos from Miles Fallon, Kazu Kokubo, Taylor Elliott, Brendon Rego, Kevin Backstrom, Mike Rav, Kaede Yasunaga, Keisuke Yoshida and Chris Beresford. Filmed in Hokkaido, Japan and Salt Lake City, Utah by Sam Tuor. Music by Cocard and friends.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 01
programme.desc: Jamie Lynn is an introvert. In his snowboarding and art-making, however, he’s big and expressive. Watch Episode 1 of his legendary Microdose series. Featuring Circe Wallace, Mike Hatchett, Sean Sullivan, Temple Cummins, Jason Loeb, Micah Shapiro, Colter Gerber, Apostalos and Demetrius Karabotsos.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 02
programme.desc: In Episode 2 of the Jamie Lynn series, Jamie talks about how the creativity of the artists and skateboarders Mark Gonzales and Neil Blender guides his approach to life as a snowboarder and artist. Featuring Circe Wallace, Matt Cummins, Dano Pendygrasse, Joel Gomez, Scott Sullivan, and Matt Remine.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 03
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series, we talk with a pioneering professional snowboarder and filmmaker, an iconic 90s shredder, and a Tahoe photographer about Jamie Lynn. Join us for tales of guts, gusto, and good jumping genes. Featuring Dave Seoane, Peter Line, and Ruben Sanchez.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 04
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series we talk with a handful of Jamie’s fellow athletes and industry peers about his loyalties to Sessions, Volcom, Vans, and LibTech among other sponsors. Featuring Joel Gomez, Dave Seoane, Richard Woolcott, Bryan Iguchi, Mike Parillo, and Billy Anderson.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 05
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series, Terje Haakonsen shares his insights on Mr. Lynn. From annual meet-ups at Mt. Baker to destinations around the world, Terje takes you there. Featuring Terje Haakonsen, Bryan Iguchi, Richard Woolcott, Ryan Immegart, Mike Parillo, and Troy Eckert.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 06
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series, Jamie details the process of filming the iconic Volcom snowboarding movie, ‘The Garden,’ directed by Richard Woolcott. Spoiler Alert: The experience was awesome. Featuring Troy Eckert, Tucker Hall, Billy Anderson, Nicholas Adams, and Mike Parillo.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 07
programme.desc: In Episode 7, we set the snowboarding tales aside to go deep on Jamie Lynn’s passion for art-making. Tune-in to learn how Lynn’s tight-knit crew motivated one another, both on and off the hill, to pursue parallel paths in visual art. Featuring Bryan Iguchi, Schoph, Jamie Heinrich and Pete Saari.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 1: California to Arizona
programme.desc: In Episode 1, the Volcom Skate Team ride motorcycles through the California and Arizona deserts, embracing all that the open road has to offer. Featuring Collin Provost, Arto Saari, Remy Stratton, Chris Pfanner, Jelle Keppens, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, and Lannie Rhoades.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 2: Arizona to Utah
programme.desc: In Episode 2, the Volcom Skate Team find themselves motorcycling and skateboarding through Arizona and Utah, with a stop at the Grand Canyon. Featuring Collin Provost, Arto Saari, Remy Stratton, Chris Pfanner, Jelle Keppens, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, and Lannie Rhoades.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 3: Belgium to Germany
programme.desc: In Episode 3, the Volcom Skate Team motorcycle through Belgium and Germany, ride skateboards, and visit The Picturebooks. Featuring Jonathan Thijs, Chris Pfanner, Jelle Keppens, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, Lannie Rhoades, Fynn Grabke, Phillip Mirtschink, Claus Grabke, and Baumi.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 4: Germany to Denmark
programme.desc: In Episode 4, the Volcom Skate Team ride through Germany and Denmark. In Copenhagen, they visit Motorious, a vintage motorcycle shop. Featuring Collin Provost, Arto Saari, Chris Pfanner, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, Lannie Rhoades, Jelle Keppens, Jonathan Thijs and Kasper Krogh.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 5: Denmark to Sweden
programme.desc: In Episode 5, the Volcom Skate Team ride motorcycles through Denmark and Sweden, go camping, and hang at Fücker Fest, a motorcycle festival in Sweden. Featuring Collin Provost, Chris Pfanner, Jackson Pilz, Arto Saari, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, Lannie Rhoades, Jelle Keppens, and Jonathan Thijs.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 6: Mexico
programme.desc: In this bonus episode, skaters CJ Collins, Jackson Pilz, and others ride motorcycles between Mexico City and San Miguel de Allende. Featuring Collin Provost, CJ Collins, Braulio Sagas, Kervin Miranda, Luka Barrena, Arto Saari, Diego Espinoza, Ginther Estrada, Ryan Loughridge, and Lannie Rhoades.

programme.title: La Quinta Films Presents: Lines
programme.desc: Lines is a documentary about big mountain snowboarding. The dedication. The nerve. The skill. As we follow the Absinthe Films crew for six weeks in Haines, Alaska, we also explore the colorful characters, history and dangers of big mountain riding. Directed by Axel Pauporté and Flora Richard.

programme.title: Ride Snowboards Presents: Rough Around The Edges
programme.desc: Rough Around The Edges dives into 30 years of Ride Snowboards. Pow days, lawsuits, trespassing, wild decisions, and relentless innovation. A raw, honest look at the brand that shaped modern riding.

programme.title: Assisted Living
programme.desc: After watching Spencer Schubert’s part in the Torment snowboarding film, “Good Sport,” Mikey Leblanc found himself inspired to get back on the toboggan. One phone call later and the newly formed duo got to work filming "ASSISTED LIVING.” This short-film will have you icing your knees in no time.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Brighton Resort - Episode 01
programme.desc: In our latest MICRODOSE series we aim to explore the most influential resorts and iconic locations in snowboarding history, starting with—that’s right—Brighton Resort in Salt Lake City, Utah. Welcome to Brighton Resort Episode 1 of 5. For many riders young and old, Brighton Resort will forever be the epicenter of the snowboarding world. The plentiful snowfall, terrain parks, lift ops, cat drivers, mechanics, management, cafeteria, cooks, and mountain culture are all first class. Back in the early days, very few ski resorts were willing to take a chance on the newfound “lifestyle sport” of snowboarding, but Brighton took the leap. In doing so, Brighton made all the difference. Within a few years, hundreds of ski areas around the world came to see Brighton’s approach to snowboarding as the gold standard. From the biggest vacation destinations to the smallest trash heaps covered in fake snow, everyone (whether they’ve known it or not) has borrowed from the Brighton playbook. This has made it possible for millions of would-be snowboarders to make their first turns safely in-bounds via rope-tows, chairlifts, and gondola rides. Newbies need not traipse into the backcountry with no snow sense and little skill. For this we have Brighton to thank.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: NowHere
programme.desc: A 2010 winter journey with riders facing harsh conditions and deeper questions. This Absinthe Films documentary explores perception, purpose, and the fine line between feeling lost and finding where you truly belong.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Back Yard Boogie
programme.desc: Terje Haakonsen rips his back yard on the snow-skate and Rip Zinger...well, yeah he gets creative too.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Winter Leisure
programme.desc: Legendary snowboarder Terje Haakonsen finds new joy in riding small parks and mellow terrain wherever he goes, explaining, “What I like about snowskates is that it makes small hills big again.” Join us for this fascinating look at snowskate subculture.

programme.title: Mission Antarctic
programme.desc: ‘Mission Antarctic’ is a snowboarding expedition to the world’s end. Xavier de le Rue and Lucas DeBari set out from the Falklands on a 20-meter sailboat, navigating the Drake Passage to explore the Antarctic Peninsula. Awarded ‘Best Freeride Movie’ at the 2013 International Freeride Film Festival.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: Yellow Flickers
programme.desc: Do the lines in the road countdown to a supposed arrival? Or are they added up within us, allowing us to grow?

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: Visions
programme.desc: Starring: Nikolai Schirmer, Flo Bastien, Julien Lange, Anttu Oikonen. Directed by Joonas Mattila Supported by Black Crows, Level, Norrona, O'neil. Locations: Chamonix, Arlberg, Val d'Isere.

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: WOLF
programme.desc:
Everything is back to normal... But why do we feel that we've lost something? WOLF is a feeling, about mountains and skiing.
WOLF is the new movie by Sam Favret. Sequel to the successful FLOW, made during the pandemic in Chamonix. WOLF is quite the opposite, and it makes us think about what was good last winter.
Skier: Sam Favret (IG samfavret) Directed by: Maxime Moulin (IG maximemoulin) Drone by: Hensli Sage Sound Design: Mix & Mouse Voice over: Bird - Michael Shaffer Screenplay: Jerome Llado Photographer: Fabian Bodet Producer: Sam Favret
Produced by: Clustr.Films lin (IG clustrfilms)
Supported by: blackcrows DB Bollé
Special thanks : Samaya Nikolai Schirmer Sebastien Overney Simon Morice Yannick Boissenot Flo Bastien
Additional cinematography Joonas Mattila

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 1: Julien Regnier
programme.desc: In Episode 1, we meet Julien Regnier. For many years, Regnier has been a central figure in freeskiing. First, as an athlete and trick inventor, then as a connoisseur collector of skis. Today, he is a master ski shaper at Black Crows, providing the means for any trick to be performed.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 2: Yorgo Tloupas
programme.desc: In Episode 2, we meet Yorgo Tloupas, the graphic development manager and visual identity creator for Black Crows. Yorgo is a cosmopolitan artist, action-sports aficionado, cigarillo smoker, fixie pedaller, and cylinder head. He wears many hats. Above all, he is a great illuminator of oblong shapes.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 3: Minna Riihimaki
programme.desc: In Episode 3, you will encounter a Crow from the early days, Minna Riihimaki. A native of northern Europe. A passionate and lively adventurer. With contagious joy, Minna fed the Black Crows DNA. When she’s not skiing, she’s also a dentist, which is cool.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 4: Callum Pettit
programme.desc: In Episode 4, we meet Callum Pettit, a mountain calligrapher, in his Whistler hideout in the heart of British Columbia, Canada.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Here Goes
programme.desc: Before ‘Skier of the Year’ Sam Kuch drops into any line, he utters the mantra, “here goes.” What began as a superstitious habit has become the confidence booster he uses to face any task. Watch this high-caliber short film about skiing, focus, and execution.

programme.title: Live For This: Float
programme.desc: A film about snowboarders and skiers slashing snow-covered walls, chasing the feeling of weightlessness. We crave those moments when distractions fall away and we lock into mountain life. We dream of it. We study weather forecasts all season. We wake before sunrise. We hit the road in search of it.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 5: Jose Lagarellos
programme.desc: In Episode 5, we meet Jose Lagarellos. He is a passionate big mountain skier. He is also the DJ and electronic events organizer behind the Chamonix Unlimited Festival. Like us, he loves original spaces and synthetic sounds. Watch now.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 6: Bruno Compagnet & Camille Jaccoux
programme.desc: In Episode 6, we meet Camille Jaccoux and Bruno Compagnet, the founders of Black Crows. In 2000, two pro skiers brought a new ski to life. Their sole aim was to make a ski that could adapt to the needs of big mountain skiing. Today, their products are used on every mountain range around the globe.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 7: Hervé Picamelot
programme.desc: For Hervé Picamelot, winter is first and foremost about the road. Each weekend, he leaves his native village in Burgundy and his family’s ancient vines for his second home, Chamonix. A radical life choice, between two vastly different universes and their celestial aromas: skiing and wine.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 8: Christina Lustenberger
programme.desc: In Episode 8, we meet Christina Lustenberger. This ex-alpine racer, turned ACMG ski guide possesses all the attributes of a prominent mountain skier: passion, drive and constant wonder. If you enjoy skiing adventures, this episode is not to be missed.

programme.title: Drawn From Here
programme.desc: Drawn From Here is an exploration of professional skier Eric Pollard's processes as an athlete, product designer, and artist. The film follows the influences he draws from and chronicles a pivotal injury Pollard endured during the winter of 2013. Named Powder Magazine's "Movie of the Year.”

programme.title: After The Sky Falls
programme.desc: "After The Sky Falls" captures the skiing of Eric Pollard, Chris Benchetler and Pep Fujas. Two years in the making, this film beautifully documents the Nimbus crew’s approach to skiing, their focus on fun and creativity, and their desire to inspire everyday skiers.

programme.title: Unraveling - Chris Benchetler
programme.desc: Progression means something different to everyone. To Chris Benchetler, progression means evolving as a professional skier, as an artist, and as a father. It means growth, unraveling expectations, and changes over time. It means simplicity, clarity, and freedom. Filmed by director Tyler Hamlet.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 9: Kristoffer Turdell
programme.desc: In Episode 9, we encounter skier Kristoffer Turdell, two-time champion of the freeride world. Join us for this special Black Crows documentary about the animal from Gallivare, Sweden. Directed by Nikolai Schirmer.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 10: Beau Fredlund
programme.desc: A yurt, 140 inhabitants in town, a door that opens on the northeast of Yellowstone National Park in Montana, a fireplace, a pair of skis, welcome to Beau's wild garden. a film by Nikolai Schirmer

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 11: The Jackson 9
programme.desc: Jackson Hole, Wyoming is home to some of the most epic skiing in North America. It is also home to a bunch of bohemian skiers nicknamed the Jackson 9. In Episode 11, we kick off Part One of our documentary series dedicated to these hobo shredders and beautiful souls. Directed by Nicolai Schirmer.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 12: Nikolai Schirmer
programme.desc: He is tall, handsome, smart, sensitive and on fire while on skis. Nikolai Schirmer, skier, bohemian-movie-maker, reveals himself in this black doc where his meandering path unfolds. An itinerary full of waves and mountains where we discover a man whose heart has progressively tuned in to the rhythm of nature.

programme.title: Snowflake
programme.desc: Witness the joys and wonders of nature through the eyes of Snowflake, an eccentric Swiss skier with a life philosophy just as beautiful and perfectly unique as his namesake.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Motherload
programme.desc: The hardest part of any adventure is getting out the door. Planning is tedious. Packing is time consuming. Once on-hill, everything falls into place. Follow pro skiers Izzy Lynch and Tessa Treadway as they carry the load of life changing events and the love of their children into the mountains.

programme.title: The Ghost Ski Resorts - Fortress
programme.desc: Deep in the Rockies stands Fortress Mountain. From the late 1960s through the 1980s, this landmark ski area buzzed with activity. Today, it is a quiet thing of abandoned beauty. Skiers Mark Abma and Callum Pettit explore the past and ponder the future of this once iconic Alberta destination.

programme.title: The Ghost Ski Resorts - Ski Rio
programme.desc: In January 2000, Ski Rio closed one night. The resort has remained dormant ever since. It’s no stretch to compare Ski Rio’s snow covered lodgings to the Overlook Hotel in the cult classic thriller The Shining. Just like in the film, the innkeeper Joe Musich admits his job can get a little spooky.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 13: The Groomer Crow - Bernie Rosow
programme.desc: Do you despise your office job? If so, Episode 13 offers the truth, the way, and the light. Bernie Rosow could neither consider a life without skiing, nor skiing without the freedom of skiing. Now a snowcat operator, his night shift allows him to solve the equation and to freeski every day, freely.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 14: Tony & Deano - Ski Bums Forever
programme.desc: In Episode 14, we honor our friends Tony Stadler and Deano Dacas. Before Black Crows was ever conceived, we were skiing for years with these two. And we will keep on skiing with them, whatever happens. We are the ski bum crows brotherhood forever.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Episode 15: Gabriella Palko
programme.desc: Gabby Palko is living what many skiers would call a dream life. From her sailboat in the Port of Valdez, she is able to ski the Alaskan mountains as often as she likes. In this emotional documentary, she connects the dots between the two parts of her life, broken by the long illness of her father.

programme.title: The Black Crows - Ep 16: Mustafa Ceylan
programme.desc:
a skier's journey from soccer prodigy to falling in love with the ski experience A Swiss crow of Kurdish descent, necessarily multilingual and multiple, Moustique (French for “mosquito”) is a relentless lover of skiing. Having fun is the most important thing for this skier who only fell in love with skiing at the age of 15 but whose passion has grown more intense every day since. Moustique falls a lot but as he says, "that's how you learn". A true skibum, dedicated and single minded.
directed by : Jules Guarneri & Benoît Goncerut produced by : Camille Jaccoux filmed and edited by : Jules Guarneri color grading : Julien Roserens audio mix : Marc Staedler

programme.title: The Black Crows - Ep 17: Michael “Bird” Shaffer
programme.desc:
Bird's story is a patchwork, fragments and colorful stages that, in retrospect, mark out a journey still in motion. As everything is a cycle, and for this winged animal, it all comes back to the source, as he does himself every summer, back in Twisp (Washington), in the hilly land of his childhood.
Born into an atypical family, a fighter pilot father who left everything behind to follow his wife to a hippie project in the hills of Washington State, Michael Shaffer was raised free and happy, close to nature. Those were also hard and frugal years, which forged an iconoclastic character but above all one of unlimited freedom. Whether he skis, flies or speaks, Bird radiates this independence, this quiet sovereignty, of one who has no ties and is content with little. He is happy to sleep on a sofa if the skiing is good and to drink water, as long as, the party goes on.
In this new black doc, we fly in the wake of the rare bird, this original crow who has been skiing the chevron since the very beginning, in a unique and unbridled sensory flashback, from the chicken coop to the dance floor.
additional thanks to Shane Wilder and the Stevens Pass Crew, Logan Sheppard-Bird the kid stunt-double and Alex Bosco for the conceptualizaton and additional cinematography. As well as all the fine-feathered shredder friends out there kaw kaw

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: Wavy 2
programme.desc: After filming WAVY, director Nikolai Schirmer promised himself that he would never set foot on a ship again. Find out how he ended up off the coast of Svalbard with an excited rookie, a contemptuous captain, and a reformed drug addict, in this thrilling and often comical ski adventure documentary.

programme.title: The Black Crows Presents: La Sentinelle - The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Bruno Compagnet and Camille Jaccoux are friends and co-founders of Black Crows, the iconic ski brand, and La Sentinelle, the renown ski touring event. Two passionate practitioners in conversation, always seeking the wild, beautiful, and natural side of the mountain.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 1 - LAAX
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes with Absinthe Films and the legendary professional snowboarders Nicolas Müller and Wolfgang Nyvelt as they score epic powder at Laax Resort in Switzerland. Nicolas shows the crew around his home terrain, hitting up big hits and dreamy powder fields.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 2 - LAAX
programme.desc: In episode 2 of the Absinthe Films Flipside series, Nicolas Müller and Wolfgang Nyvelt continue exploring Nicolas’ backyard, the Laax Resort in Switzerland. With snow this deep, the mountain is an endless playground.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 3 - LAAX
programme.desc: Snowboarders always have secret stashes. This is especially true for Nicolas Müller. Watch as the Laax local takes Wolle Nyvelt to his favorite spots on the mountain. If you like perfect jumps high above the clouds, powder landings, frontside 1080s, and beautiful sunsets, this episode is for you.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 4 - ARLBERG
programme.desc: In 2012, snowboarder Danny Kass captured his debut part with Absinthe Films. To begin, Kass met up with Eric Jackson in Gigi Rüf’s hometown of Arlberg, Austria. While there, a war broke out between the film crew and the locals. Watch as Gigi steps in to keep the peace.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 5 - ARLBERG
programme.desc: Danny Kass, Gigi Rüf, and Wolle Nyvelt meet up in Arlberg, Austria. The crew spends the day fine-tuning their jump and bagging a perfect bluebird session. Danny puts down his first 720 of the year. Gigi takes a heavy slam trying backside double corks. But wait, there’s more! Drama ensues!

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 6 - SAINT LUC
programme.desc: The Absinthe Films crew scores great weather, perfect snow, and no shortage of terrain options in Saint Luc, Switzerland. Young guns Pat Burgener and Mat Schaer send it during a double cork session. Sylvain Bourbousson, Lucas Debari and Mat tackle more natural kickers and lines.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 7 - SAAS FEE
programme.desc: The superhuman Danny Kass and legendary Nicolas Müller reunite with the Absinthe Films crew in Switzerland. From the word “GO!,” the guys score epic powder conditions. Nico goes off slashing. Danny locks down the biggest backflip of his life.

programme.title: Flipside - Resonance - Episode 8 - SAAS FEE
programme.desc: In this episode of Flipside, Danny Kass flips a coin in Saas Fee. Tails he stays in Switzerland. Heads he goes home. Switzerland it is! Now on a solo mission, Kass stacks clips for the cameras of Absinthe Films director Patrick Armbruster. This is Danny Kass at his best.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Resonance
programme.desc: Resonance stands as a defining Absinthe Films classic, shot across Japan, Switzerland, and Alaska. Featuring Gigi Rüf, Nicolas Müller, Lucas Debari, Danny Kass, Annie Boulanger, Scotty Lago, Bode Merrill, and more in peak form.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 01
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 02
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 03
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 04
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Danny Kass - Dose 05
programme.desc: Danny Kass changed snowboarding at a crucial time. Here is how it all began. Starring Danny Kass and the Grenerds.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Lay Down Your Weapons
programme.desc: “Lay Down Your Weapons” is a respite from the cacophony of the world. Atoms and Void is musician Arlie Carstens, of Seattle’s Juno, and producer Eric Fisher. Known for his skateboarding films, Director Greg Hunt here lets landscapes and cityscapes slowly unfold. Breathe deeply, watch and listen.

programme.title: Echo Chamber
programme.desc: In 2020, Brandon Cocard dropped “Echo Chamber,” featuring cameos from Miles Fallon, Kazu Kokubo, Taylor Elliott, Brendon Rego, Kevin Backstrom, Mike Rav, Kaede Yasunaga, Keisuke Yoshida and Chris Beresford. Filmed in Hokkaido, Japan and Salt Lake City, Utah by Sam Tuor. Music by Cocard and friends.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Turbo Dojo
programme.desc: Hailed as one of the standout Absinthe productions "TurboDojo" features Mikkel Bang, Nicolas Müller, Kimmy Fasani, Hans Mindnich, Brandon Cocard, Austen Sweetin, Brendan Gerard, Ben Ferguson, Max Buri, and more.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Nippow Holiday
programme.desc: Snowboarder Terje Haakonsen invites the filmmaker and musician, Leo Cittadella, to join him and Rip Zinger on a powder trip to Hokkaido, Japan. Along the way, they meet up with Nicolas Müller and Mikkel Bang to film for the Absinthe Films feature "TurboDojo.”

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Happo One
programme.desc: On his 45th trip to Japan (since 1991), Terje rides powder in the Japanese Alps with the snowboarders Leo Cittadella, Rip Zinger, Curtis Ciszek, Oli Gittler and Ian Tobin.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Happo Two
programme.desc: The snowboarders Rip Zinger and Terje Haakonsen ride powder in Japan. Years after his recovery from a debilitating head injury, they get Kevin Pearce back on snow. Join us for this episode of friendship, freshies, and freeriding.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Happo Three
programme.desc: Snowboarder Terje Haakonsen explores the joys of Japanese mountain culture with his friends Kevin Pearce, Mikkel Bang, Rip Zinger, Oli Gittler, Curtis Ciszek, Leo Cittadella and Ian Tobin.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Relax If You Can
programme.desc: Terje Haakonsen and Leo Cittadella go snowskating at the vast Austrian ski resort of Ischgl. While enjoying a timeout along the Swiss-Austrian border, they discuss European cultural differences and similarities.

programme.title: Terje Haakonsen - Half Banked at Mt Baker
programme.desc: Terje and Leo Cittadella head to Mt. Baker, Washington to meet up with with Russell Winfield and Rip Zinger to compete in the 33rd Legendary Banked Slalom. During a windstorm, a tree falls on the house while everyone is asleep. Terje gets waxing tips from Olympic gold medalist Seth Westcott.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: Attunga - A Higher Place
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of three Norwegian snowboarders: legendary purist Terje Haakonsen, holistic-minded Torgeir Bergrem, and carefree wunderkind Marcus Kleveland. Watch as filmmaker and snowboarder Seth Huot pulls back the curtain to examine their common purpose, potential, pitfalls, and paychecks.

programme.title: Artist Profile - José Medeles
programme.desc: For most artists, music is a way of life. On this episode of the Artist Profile series, we follow José Medeles through a day in the life as he shares his journey from La Salle, Illinois to touring with The Breeders, to founding the Revival Drum Shop and making music as one half of 1939 Ensemble.

programme.title: Marmoset Presents: Bridge City Revival
programme.desc: Bridge City Revival is the acclaimed music collective from Portland, Oregon. Inspired by the soulful 60s, BCR was raised on The Chi-Lites, Otis Redding, Isley Brothers, Lee Fields, and Sharon Jones. Banger drum breaks. Driving bass. Rhythmic guitar. Rolling keyboards. Soulful brass. That’s BCR!

programme.title: Artist Profile - WebsterX
programme.desc: In this episode, we focus our cameras on the hip-hop artist WebsterX as he prepares for his hometown performance at the summer TDM Festival in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. FIlmed by Josh Brine and Kale Chesney.

programme.title: Visitations - La Sera: Devil’s Hearts Grow Gold
programme.desc: La Sera performing "Devils Hearts Grow Gold" at Room 205. A few days before embarking on their first UK tour, mastermind Katy Goodman (vox/bass), Jennifer Prince (guitar/vox), and Jonathan Weil (drums), stopped by to blast through a few songs from Katy's upcoming full-length on Hardly Art.

programme.title: Visitations - La Sera: Never Come Around
programme.desc: La Sera performing 'Never Come Around' at Room 205. A few days before embarking on their first UK tour, La Sera stopped by Room 205 to play songs from the band’s upcoming LP on Hardly Art. The project's inspiration springs from an attraction to ethereal choral vocals and pop hits of the 1950's.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Lay Down Your Weapons
programme.desc: “Lay Down Your Weapons” is a respite from the cacophony of the world. Atoms and Void is musician Arlie Carstens, of Seattle’s Juno, and producer Eric Fisher. Known for his skateboarding films, Director Greg Hunt here lets landscapes and cityscapes slowly unfold. Breathe deeply, watch and listen.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Waves Of Blood
programme.desc: The core of Atoms and Void is formed in the friendship and songwriting partnership of Arlie Carstens and Eric Fisher. “Waves of Blood” features cartwheeling post-rock guitars, buoyant bass, and double-drummers bashing away like shutters in a hurricane. Good for long walks and red-eye flights.

programme.title: Atoms and Void - This Departing Landscape
programme.desc: Atoms and Void is formed in the songwriting partnership of Arlie Carstens and Eric Fisher. The video for the song, “This Departing Landscape,” is an awkwardly beautiful collection of footage from years of touring and recording, proving the maxim, “life is about the journey, not the destination.”

programme.title: Atoms and Void - Golden Shivers
programme.desc: Atoms and Void is formed in the songwriting partnership of Arlie Carstens and Eric Fisher. “Golden Shivers” is a beautiful piece of ambient electronic music akin to the works of minimalist composers Steve Reich and Meredith Monk. Good for running, dancing, driving, and doing the dishes. Play loud.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Pop
programme.desc: Pop stands as a genre-defining Absinthe Films release, featuring peak performances from Travis Rice, Romain De Marchi, Nicolas Müller, Gigi Rüf, and more. In 2004, awarded Best Film of the Year by TransWorld Snowboarding and Snowboarder Magazine.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Twe12ve
programme.desc: A winter of extremes sets the stage for Twe12ve. Absinthe Films follows twelve riders chasing record snow across legendary ranges, pushing boundaries and redefining what’s possible in another wintry shred classic.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: Escramble
programme.desc: In a time beyond and close to now... a vision was revealed. A vision of the very first dream of life. The dream of life before there was life. The dream that vapor dreams of becoming solid and falling to meet whatever will catch and hold it. Thus begins "ESCRAMBLE". Featuring Bjorn Leines, Terje Haakonsen, Mark Landvik, Wille Yli-Louma, Shaun White, Seth Huot, Gigi Rüf, Erik Leines, Bryan Iguchi, Chris Demolski and Jamie Lynn.

programme.title: Volcom Presents: 9191
programme.desc: 9191 is a sideways introspective into the bewildering snow-covered dreamscape of international time traveler and mystic of the shred - Gigi Rüf.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Isle Of Snow
programme.desc: Join us as we explore the snowboard world through the perspectives of the people who live it and have made it their lives follow their passions.

programme.title: The Manboys Movie
programme.desc: The boys are back with new friends and a brand new snowboard film. The Manboys Movie will definitely top your expectations. Featuring bangers from Chris Rasman, Rusty Ockenden, Craig McMorris, Jody Wachniak, Matt Belzile, Anto Chamberland, and Mark Sollors.

programme.title: The ManBoys Presents: Snowdance
programme.desc: Snowdance is a backcountry snowboarding film. Because even if you’ve never set foot in the backcountry, you can still be grateful that it’s there. Seven years and one pandemic since their fruition, The ManBoys roster still remains largely intact with Chris Rasman, Rusty Ockenden, Matt Belzile, Jody Wachniak, Beau Bishop & Eric Jackson. Snowdance was filmed by Ben Webb, Connor Winton, Dave Craig, and Ryan Kenny.

programme.title: The ManBoys Presents: Business Casual
programme.desc: Business Casual follows the Burton Snowboards crew and the Manboys as they enjoy the best part of the season in the Whistler area while Rusty Ockenden learns to operate a camera. The ManBoys crew encourages anyone who wants to get into the backcountry to take a first aid & avalanche course with your whole crew. Be safe, have fun, learn from your mistakes - and learn from theirs. Featuring Jody Wachniak, Mark Sollors, Noah Cohen, Mikey Rencz, Matt Belzile, and Beau Bishop. Directed and edited by Rusty Ockenden

programme.title: Air Time Podcast - Sean Miskiman
programme.desc: Sean is an up-and-comer from Saskatchewan, Canada. He grew up riding contests and by the age of 18 bailed and dove head first into filming in the backcountry. He's been making a name for himself the past couple of years and has been through a lot for someone so young; from overcoming injuries, avalanche rescues, stand out clips and much more. The kids got a bright future! Thanks for joining me boss. Enjoy.

programme.title: La Zone
programme.desc:
In the early 2000's, snowboard filmer David 'Vlad' Vladyka and a handful of riders discovered an off-the-radar area on the French-Swiss border that held massive potential for shooting freestyle snowboarding. The mountain pass featured rolling terrain punctuated by steep roll overs that are perfect for building jumps. The area was Le Col de Cou, and though it had a name, the riders called it 'La Zone', a purposefully vague nickname that would help them keep the area a secret.
Over the next decade, La Zone would become one of the most productive and standard setting locations for filming freestyle snowboarding in all of Europe. Shots from La Zone were featured in several Absinthe films, and many others.
Now 20 years later, Jones team rider Mat Schaer and Vlad still return to La Zone to film from time to time, but the pristine slopes they enjoyed in the past are much harder to find as Le Col de Cou has become a popular ski touring destination.
Featuring new and historic footage from La Zone, this new short film directed by Julien Rosens, and produced by Absinthe Films, highlights the history, beauty and inevitable evolution of this legendary shred spot.
Credits LA ZONE, a movie directed by Julien Roserens Produced by Absinthe Films Supported by Jonessnowboards, Region Dents du Midi, Doodah store Edited by Jules Guarneri Soundmix by Stephane Chapelle Graphics by René Zumstein Photo by Michael Cordey Music : Tugrul by Ochre, Rhea by Yehezkel Raz, Where It Beginns It Ends by Be Still The Earth, Strange Life de YGGL, Let Us Get Out by Redder

programme.title: Doodah Presents: Spacé - Couloir
programme.desc: Snowboarder Frederik Kalbermatten lives surrounded by 13 mountains, each higher than 4,000 meters. Only a few have dared these descents. Some couloirs are accessible when conditions are perfect, others only open their doors for a brief moment. Kalbermatten masters them all with flow and style.

programme.title: La Quinta Films Presents: Lines
programme.desc: Lines is a documentary about big mountain snowboarding. The dedication. The nerve. The skill. As we follow the Absinthe Films crew for six weeks in Haines, Alaska, we also explore the colorful characters, history and dangers of big mountain riding. Directed by Axel Pauporté and Flora Richard.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: Motherload
programme.desc: The hardest part of any adventure is getting out the door. Planning is tedious. Packing is time consuming. Once on-hill, everything falls into place. Follow pro skiers Izzy Lynch and Tessa Treadway as they carry the load of life changing events and the love of their children into the mountains.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 1
programme.desc: Your friends at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 2
programme.desc: The fine folks at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 3
programme.desc: The fine folks at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: Mountain Minded - Episode 4
programme.desc: The fine folks at Absinthe Films, along with Nils Mindnich, Pat Moore, Kimmy Fasani, Jeff Pensiero and others, remind you to prepare for the season with safe practices in mind.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 01
programme.desc: Kimmy Fasani is a world class athlete, a loving mother, a natural leader, and a true champion of women in professional snowboarding. In Episode 1 of her Microdose series, we learn where Fasani’s glorious story begins. Featuring Shannon Dunn, Donna Carpenter, Hana Beaman, Gabe Taylor and Ryan Runke.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 02
programme.desc: In Episode 2 of her Microdose series, we learn how Kimmy Fasani stepped away from the contest scene and into backcountry snowboarding with help from shred legend Devun Walsh and innovator Iikka Backstrom. Featuring Chris Benchetler, Devun Walsh, Adam Moran, Bryan Knox and Peter Morning.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Kimmy Fasani - Dose 03
programme.desc: As a Burton athlete, Kimmy Fasani has long been a champion of change in women's snowboarding. Innovative products. Fair pay. Better contracts. Sick ripping. Watch and be uplifted. Featuring Hana Beaman, Pat Bridges, Danny Davis, Gabe Taylor, Kevin Pearce, Bryan Knox, Adam Moran and Peter Morning.

programme.title: Evo Explores - Kimmy Fasani
programme.desc: Over the course of her career, snowboarder Kimmy Fasani has won the coveted “Women’s Rider of The Year Award” from TransWorld Snowboarding Magazine, and the “Women’s Video Part of The Year Award” from Snowboarder Magazine. This fascinating documentary captures Fasani’s first time riding in Alaska.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: AfterForever
programme.desc: When resistance fades, growth begins. AfterForever is a meditation on change, exploring evolution in snowboarding and life, and asking what happens when one chapter ends and another begins.

programme.title: Wash'Dup
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this mockumentary film will follow a group of ex- snowboard filmmakers and ex-pro riders who never hung it up. Still in love with the sport and fueled by mid life crisis, these shred for lifers are extremely vulnerable to delusions of grandeur. But the dream is always “still alive” in their minds. In turn they ignore all the red flags and continue to do what seems completely irrational to everyone except for them. After a 16 year hiatus, they irresponsibly put their adult obligations behind, and join a pact to make just one last movie. But they are missing a solid presence of youth to make their movie marketable. As a remedy they end up filming with riders that span 2 generations. This unlikely alliance leads them to discover much more about snowboarding and themselves by living the snowboarding dream through an ageless lens. Filled with sketch comedy skits, this film expresses the nuanced story of a young sport reaching a level of maturity the current industry now begins to embrace. From the death of the snowboard shop, and extinction of film media, to the old pro struggling to find their way in life after the glory days are long gone, WashDup is a story that finally needs to be told.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 01
programme.desc: Elena Hight is one of the most accomplished women in snowboarding history. Interestingly, her passion for boardsports culture originated in her home state of Hawaii on the island of Kauai. This is where Elena’s Microdose series begins. Featuring Jamie Anderson, Papa Mike, Chris Owen, Louie Vito.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 02
programme.desc: From the moment she strapped into a snowboard, Elena Hight has been an innovative and visionary force in women’s snowboarding. In Episode 2 of her Microdose series, we take a look at two of Elena’s greatest achievements. Featuring Jamie Anderson, Scotty Lago and Louie Vito.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 03
programme.desc: At age 16, during the 2006 Torino Olympics, Elena Hight was the youngest American to compete in Women’s Halfpipe. In 2010, at the Vancouver Olympics, she sowed the seeds of change to come. In Episode 3 of Elena’s Microdose series we explore more. Featuring Selema Masekela, Papa Mike and Louie Vito.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 04
programme.desc: Failure in life can be our biggest teacher. In Episode 4 of her Microdose series, we learn how Elena Hight embraced failure on the global stage, embarked on transformative change, and unlocked her next level. Featuring Selema Masekela, Hana Beaman, Spencer O'Brien, Jamie Anderson, and Jeremy Jones.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Elena Hight - Dose 05
programme.desc: When Elena Hight made the surprising decision to set aside her Olympic routine to pursue backcountry riding, she astonished her peers and mentors. In Episode 5 of her Microdose series, we learn how and why Elena made the leap. Featuring Jeremy Jones, Hana Beaman, Todd Jones, and Jamie Anderson.

programme.title: Hwuy’xwet Pune’luxutth (Opening Penelakut)
programme.desc: This beautiful documentary follows a group of First Nation’s students at Penelakut Island Elementary School as they work with Riley McIntosh to create a new mountain bike trail for the community. Throughout the film, director Jason Mannings shares the history of Penelakut Island and its people.

programme.title: Artist Profile - Y La Bamba
programme.desc: In this episode, we highlight the Mexican American artist Luz Mendoza of Y La Bamba. The film follows the musician as she traces her roots and creative inspirations. Filmed in 2017, on the eve of Y La Bamba's Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead) performance at Holocene in Portland, Oregon.

programme.title: Arc’teryx Presents: On The Verge
programme.desc: In the mountains behind the coastal town of Powell River, BC, rock climbers have spent decades quietly pioneering routes on some of the largest granite walls in Canada. As the landscape comes under threat of logging, the climbing community faces an uncertain future. Lives! Logs! Legacies!

programme.title: Arc'teryx Presents: Em
programme.desc: Emilie Pellerin is the best climber you’ve never heard of. In her debut film, “Em”, director Alexa Fay sets out to prove it. To become a world class climber requires a problem-solving mindset, positivity, natural ability and commitment to the “dirtbag life.” This film puts Pellerin front and center.

programme.title: Absinthe Films Presents: Vivid
programme.desc: Absinthe Films’ Vivid highlights the breakout years of Travis Rice, Romain De Marchi, Nicolas Müller, and Gigi Rüf, delivering some of their most memorable early riding in a fan-favorite classic.

programme.title: Artist Profile - Scott Lenhardt
programme.desc: Artist Scott Lenhardt has kept everything he’s ever made for Burton Snowboards. Everything he’s ever done is stored in his childhood bedroom. After his year-long solo show at the Vermont Ski & Snowboard Museum, he organized his archives. Just like his creative process, this film is mind blowing.

programme.title: Artist Profile - Sebo Walker
programme.desc: In 2022, the art-inspired accessories brand Slowtide launched a summer collection with Portland, Oregon-based artist and skateboarder Sebo Walker. To capture the collaboration, director Jake Price spent a day cruising around Walker’s hometown, seeing the city and learning what inspires his artwork.

programme.title: Without a Paddle
programme.desc: ‘Without a Paddle’ is a canoe film about snowboarding. Four snowboarders retrace a portion of the 19th century explorer David Thompson’s journey down the Columbia River, during one of the coldest cold snaps in Revelstoke’s recorded history. Surreal landscapes, epic paddling, deep powder, and pain.

programme.title: Without a Pedal: A Bicycle Film About Snowboarding
Northbound and Around
programme.desc: Hungry for clips and greedy for turns, Johan Rosen, Garrett “Worm” Warnick and friends spent the season leaving no line unridden and no pillow unsmashed. Driven by the most unsatisfiable of desires, finding good snow, the crew spent the season running from warm temperatures and chasing down a dream. To get to the promised land, they found themselves traveling… Northbound and Around. Featuring: Garrett Warnick, Johan Rosen, Nils Arvidsson, Ryan Paterson, Keenan Filmer, Kareem El Rafie Nils Mindnich, Jess Kimura, Bode Merrill, Ben Bilocq, Brandon Davis, Nick Khattar, Kyle Mack Edited by: Johan Rosen

programme.title: CHANNEL ZeRO
programme.desc: Released in 2020, this Absinthe Films feature highlights the unifying power of snowboarding during a divisive moment in history, celebrating a global community that refuses to be separated by physical or mental barriers.

programme.title: Echo Chamber
programme.desc: In 2020, Brandon Cocard dropped “Echo Chamber,” featuring cameos from Miles Fallon, Kazu Kokubo, Taylor Elliott, Brendon Rego, Kevin Backstrom, Mike Rav, Kaede Yasunaga, Keisuke Yoshida and Chris Beresford. Filmed in Hokkaido, Japan and Salt Lake City, Utah by Sam Tuor. Music by Cocard and friends.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 01
programme.desc: Jamie Lynn is an introvert. In his snowboarding and art-making, however, he’s big and expressive. Watch Episode 1 of his legendary Microdose series. Featuring Circe Wallace, Mike Hatchett, Sean Sullivan, Temple Cummins, Jason Loeb, Micah Shapiro, Colter Gerber, Apostalos and Demetrius Karabotsos.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 02
programme.desc: In Episode 2 of the Jamie Lynn series, Jamie talks about how the creativity of the artists and skateboarders Mark Gonzales and Neil Blender guides his approach to life as a snowboarder and artist. Featuring Circe Wallace, Matt Cummins, Dano Pendygrasse, Joel Gomez, Scott Sullivan, and Matt Remine.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 03
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series, we talk with a pioneering professional snowboarder and filmmaker, an iconic 90s shredder, and a Tahoe photographer about Jamie Lynn. Join us for tales of guts, gusto, and good jumping genes. Featuring Dave Seoane, Peter Line, and Ruben Sanchez.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 04
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series we talk with a handful of Jamie’s fellow athletes and industry peers about his loyalties to Sessions, Volcom, Vans, and LibTech among other sponsors. Featuring Joel Gomez, Dave Seoane, Richard Woolcott, Bryan Iguchi, Mike Parillo, and Billy Anderson.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 05
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series, Terje Haakonsen shares his insights on Mr. Lynn. From annual meet-ups at Mt. Baker to destinations around the world, Terje takes you there. Featuring Terje Haakonsen, Bryan Iguchi, Richard Woolcott, Ryan Immegart, Mike Parillo, and Troy Eckert.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 06
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of the Jamie Lynn Microdose series, Jamie details the process of filming the iconic Volcom snowboarding movie, ‘The Garden,’ directed by Richard Woolcott. Spoiler Alert: The experience was awesome. Featuring Troy Eckert, Tucker Hall, Billy Anderson, Nicholas Adams, and Mike Parillo.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Jamie Lynn - Dose 07
programme.desc: In Episode 7, we set the snowboarding tales aside to go deep on Jamie Lynn’s passion for art-making. Tune-in to learn how Lynn’s tight-knit crew motivated one another, both on and off the hill, to pursue parallel paths in visual art. Featuring Bryan Iguchi, Schoph, Jamie Heinrich and Pete Saari.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 1: California to Arizona
programme.desc: In Episode 1, the Volcom Skate Team ride motorcycles through the California and Arizona deserts, embracing all that the open road has to offer. Featuring Collin Provost, Arto Saari, Remy Stratton, Chris Pfanner, Jelle Keppens, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, and Lannie Rhoades.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 2: Arizona to Utah
programme.desc: In Episode 2, the Volcom Skate Team find themselves motorcycling and skateboarding through Arizona and Utah, with a stop at the Grand Canyon. Featuring Collin Provost, Arto Saari, Remy Stratton, Chris Pfanner, Jelle Keppens, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, and Lannie Rhoades.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 3: Belgium to Germany
programme.desc: In Episode 3, the Volcom Skate Team motorcycle through Belgium and Germany, ride skateboards, and visit The Picturebooks. Featuring Jonathan Thijs, Chris Pfanner, Jelle Keppens, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, Lannie Rhoades, Fynn Grabke, Phillip Mirtschink, Claus Grabke, and Baumi.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 4: Germany to Denmark
programme.desc: In Episode 4, the Volcom Skate Team ride through Germany and Denmark. In Copenhagen, they visit Motorious, a vintage motorcycle shop. Featuring Collin Provost, Arto Saari, Chris Pfanner, Jackson Pilz, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, Lannie Rhoades, Jelle Keppens, Jonathan Thijs and Kasper Krogh.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 5: Denmark to Sweden
programme.desc: In Episode 5, the Volcom Skate Team ride motorcycles through Denmark and Sweden, go camping, and hang at Fücker Fest, a motorcycle festival in Sweden. Featuring Collin Provost, Chris Pfanner, Jackson Pilz, Arto Saari, Jake Smith, Christian Vankelst, Lannie Rhoades, Jelle Keppens, and Jonathan Thijs.

programme.title: Speak Two The Wind - Part 6: Mexico
programme.desc: In this bonus episode, skaters CJ Collins, Jackson Pilz, and others ride motorcycles between Mexico City and San Miguel de Allende. Featuring Collin Provost, CJ Collins, Braulio Sagas, Kervin Miranda, Luka Barrena, Arto Saari, Diego Espinoza, Ginther Estrada, Ryan Loughridge, and Lannie Rhoades.

programme.title: La Quinta Films Presents: Lines
programme.desc: Lines is a documentary about big mountain snowboarding. The dedication. The nerve. The skill. As we follow the Absinthe Films crew for six weeks in Haines, Alaska, we also explore the colorful characters, history and dangers of big mountain riding. Directed by Axel Pauporté and Flora Richard.

programme.title: Ride Snowboards Presents: Rough Around The Edges
programme.desc: Rough Around The Edges dives into 30 years of Ride Snowboards. Pow days, lawsuits, trespassing, wild decisions, and relentless innovation. A raw, honest look at the brand that shaped modern riding.

programme.title: Assisted Living
programme.desc: After watching Spencer Schubert’s part in the Torment snowboarding film, “Good Sport,” Mikey Leblanc found himself inspired to get back on the toboggan. One phone call later and the newly formed duo got to work filming "ASSISTED LIVING.” This short-film will have you icing your knees in no time.

programme.title: MICRODOSE Brighton Resort - Episode 01
programme.desc: In our latest MICRODOSE series we aim to explore the most influential resorts and iconic locations in snowboarding history, starting with—that’s right—Brighton Resort in Salt Lake City, Utah. Welcome to Brighton Resort Episode 1 of 5. For many riders young and old, Brighton Resort will forever be the epicenter of the snowboarding world. The plentiful snowfall, terrain parks, lift ops, cat drivers, mechanics, management, cafeteria, cooks, and mountain culture are all first class. Back in the early days, very few ski resorts were willing to take a chance on the newfound “lifestyle sport” of snowboarding, but Brighton took the leap. In doing so, Brighton made all the difference. Within a few years, hundreds of ski areas around the world came to see Brighton’s approach to snowboarding as the gold standard. From the biggest vacation destinations to the smallest trash heaps covered in fake snow, everyone (whether they’ve known it or not) has borrowed from the Brighton playbook. This has made it possible for millions of would-be snowboarders to make their first turns safely in-bounds via rope-tows, chairlifts, and gondola rides. Newbies need not traipse into the backcountry with no snow sense and little skill. For this we have Brighton to thank.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 100 Last Heavyweight Standing
programme.desc: GLORY 100 features four GLORY world title bouts, four separate four-man one-night tournaments to determine who qualifies for the Last Heavyweight Standing finals, and several key matchups involving some of GLORY’s most popular fighters.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 105: Last Heavyweight Standing Finals
programme.desc: In the quarter finals, Belgian Moroccan Anis Bouzid (48-4, 37 KO) takes on kickboxing legend Errol Zimmerman (112-20-1, 45 KO), Serbian sensation Milos Cvjeticanin (17-5, 10 KO) meets number one French heavyweight Sofian Laidouni (42-5-1, 20 KO), monstrous Tariq ‘Cookie’ Osaro (29-4-1, 16 KO) clashes with ‘The Soldier’ Nidal Bchiri (20-5-1, 5 KO), and ‘The Black Ghost’ Mory Kromah (35-3-1, 21 KO) collides with outspoken rival Michael ‘Timebomb’ Boapeah (23-5-1, 29 KO). Only one fighter can come out on top and walk away as the new ‘King of Kickboxing’. Elsewhere, the always exciting Bahram Rajabzadeh (72-6, 64 KO) goes up against ‘The Gladiator’ Cristian Ristea (44-27, 13 KO), Hamicha (42-2, 31 KO) puts his undefeated GLORY record on the line against late replacement Brice Kombou (20-6, 5 KO), and featherweights Andre Santos (23-2, 10 KO) and Deniz Demirkapu (15-5, 10 KO) will kick-off the main card.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 100 Last Heavyweight Standing
programme.desc: GLORY 100 features four GLORY world title bouts, four separate four-man one-night tournaments to determine who qualifies for the Last Heavyweight Standing finals, and several key matchups involving some of GLORY’s most popular fighters.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 99: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: The year-long, five-event tournament kicks off at GLORY 99 in Rotterdam Ahoy, featuring 32 heavyweights in 16 bouts on a mega all-heavyweight card.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 105: Last Heavyweight Standing Finals
programme.desc: In the quarter finals, Belgian Moroccan Anis Bouzid (48-4, 37 KO) takes on kickboxing legend Errol Zimmerman (112-20-1, 45 KO), Serbian sensation Milos Cvjeticanin (17-5, 10 KO) meets number one French heavyweight Sofian Laidouni (42-5-1, 20 KO), monstrous Tariq ‘Cookie’ Osaro (29-4-1, 16 KO) clashes with ‘The Soldier’ Nidal Bchiri (20-5-1, 5 KO), and ‘The Black Ghost’ Mory Kromah (35-3-1, 21 KO) collides with outspoken rival Michael ‘Timebomb’ Boapeah (23-5-1, 29 KO). Only one fighter can come out on top and walk away as the new ‘King of Kickboxing’. Elsewhere, the always exciting Bahram Rajabzadeh (72-6, 64 KO) goes up against ‘The Gladiator’ Cristian Ristea (44-27, 13 KO), Hamicha (42-2, 31 KO) puts his undefeated GLORY record on the line against late replacement Brice Kombou (20-6, 5 KO), and featherweights Andre Santos (23-2, 10 KO) and Deniz Demirkapu (15-5, 10 KO) will kick-off the main card.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 99: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: The year-long, five-event tournament kicks off at GLORY 99 in Rotterdam Ahoy, featuring 32 heavyweights in 16 bouts on a mega all-heavyweight card.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - COLLISION 7
programme.desc: In the main event, ‘The King of Kickboxing’ Rico Verhoeven put his GLORY world heavyweight title on the line against number one contender ‘The Prince’ Levi Rigters in a hotly anticipated rematch from their GLORY Grand Prix final earlier this year. GLORY light heavyweight world champion Tarik Khbabez will collide with Donegi Abena in a trilogy fight to end their heated rivalry in the co-main event.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 98 Rotterdam
programme.desc: GLORY 98 features the highly anticipated return of Jamal Ben Saddik (36-9, 29 KO) against the Estonian powerhouse Uku Jürjendal (20-9, 16 KO). In the co-main event of the evening, GLORY Welterweight World Champion Chico Kwasi (43-5-1, 23 KO) is set to defend his title against number two ranked welterweight Teodor Hristov (18-3, 7 KO). Meanwhile, two of 2024’s best prospects will clash as Cem Caceres (18-1, 14 KO) faces Mory Kromah (31-2-1, 18 KO).

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 98 Rotterdam

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 95 Zagreb
programme.desc: A five-round heavyweight title eliminator between the number one ranked contender Levi Rigters (18-2, 8 KO) and ‘The Golden Wolf’ Bahram Rajabzadeh (69-3, 61 KO). The winner will face ‘The King of Kickboxing’ Rico Verhoeven (64-10, 21 KO) on December 7 in the main event of COLLISION 7. In the co-main event of the evening, Tariq ‘Cookie’ Osaro (25-4-1, 13 KO) clashes with Nico ‘Big Sexy’ Horta (23-9, 3 KO) in a monster heavyweight clash with big implication for the rankings. Croatian kickboxing legend Mladen Brestovac (55-14-1, 37 KO) will make his final walk to the ring in his hometown of Zagreb. ‘The Scorpion Sting’ will take on newcomer Karim Dian (16-13, 3 KO) to cap off an illustrious career. Top ten heavyweights Nordine Mahieddine (28-15, 13 KO) and Nikola Filipovic (11-2, 6 KO) will collide in what is a guaranteed barn burner between two prolific KO artist.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 96 Rotterdam
programme.desc: A Champ vs. Champ superfight takes place in the main event as GLORY welterweight world champion Chico Kwasi (43-5, 23 KO) puts his title on the line against GLORY lightweight world champ Tyjani Beztati (27-4, 9 KO). In the co-main event, Donovan Wisse (21-1, 10 KO) aims to defend his GLORY middleweight world championship for a fifth time when he welcomes the challenge of top German Sergej Braun (44-13, 27 KO).

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 95 Zagreb

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 94 Antwerp
programme.desc: The main event will see two of the light heavyweight division’s most explosive young prospects clash as Romania’s Stefan Latescu (17-3, 8 KO) faces Turkey’s Cem Caceres (16-1, 13 KO). Belgium based Albanian Berjan Peposhi (29-4, 16 KO) will compete in the co-main event. The always exciting featherweight welcomes rising star Ayoub Bourass (14-1, 4 KO) in to make his GLORY debut. International Muay Thai superstar Youssef Boughanem (188-43-8, 120 KO) returns for his sophomore GLORY outing against tough Italian Angelo Volpe (38-5, 12 KO). Former middleweight title contender Serkan Ozcaglayan (45-10, 36 KO) takes on Antwerp’s own Jente Nnamadim (21-5, 11 KO), who comes in to make his GLORY debut in his hometown.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY Light Heavyweight Grand Prix 2024
programme.desc: The eight-man one-night GLORY Light Heavyweight Grand Prix will crown the baddest light heavyweight striker on the planet. The eight participants are: GLORY champion, #C Tarik Khbabez (58-10-1, 28 KO), Morocco. Former champion, #1 Donegi Abena (27-10, 7 KO), Suriname. Former champion, #2 Sergej Maslobojev (38-6, 23 KO), Lithuania. Undefeated in GLORY, #3 Stefan Latescu (17-2, 8 KO), Romania. ‘Mister Cool’ #4 Ibrahim El Bouni (41-9-1, 22 KO), Morocco. The wild & unpredictable, #5 Bahram Rajabzadeh (67-2, 59 KO), Azerbaijan. Top French light heavyweight, #6 Pascal Toure (20-6, 7 KO), France. Veteran fighter, #7 Bogdan Stoica (58-14, 40 KO), Romania.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 93 Rotterdam
programme.desc: The welterweight superfight between former GLORY world champion Endy Semeleer (36-2, 18 KO) and current GLORY lightweight world champion Tyjani Beztati (26-4, 9 KO) will take center stage in the main event of the evening. After dominating the lightweight division, Beztati moves up to welterweight for the very first time in his GLORY career. GLORY featherweight world champion Petch (169-40-3, 27 KO) and RISE national champion Kento Haraguchi (25-3-1, 14 KO) made their trilogy fight official for the co-main event. Two former middleweight title challengers collide as the number one ranked Michael Boapeah (17-4-1, 7 KO) takes on the number three ranked Ulric Bokeme (32-5, 17 KO), both fighters chasing a rematch at champion Donovan Wisse. Top Dutch star Tayfun Özcan (86-10-3, 28 KO) will make his highly anticipated GLORY debut against French champion Majid Amarouche (25-2-1, 10 KO).

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY Heavyweight Grand Prix 2024
programme.desc: 3 wins to come out on top, who's it going to be? Rico Verhoeven, Levi Rigters, Tarik Osaro, Benjamin Adegbuyi, Sofian Laidouni, Uku Jurjendal, Bahram Rajabzadeh, and Nabil Khachab pair up and throw down for the GLORY Heavyweight Grand Prix, an 8-man 1-night heavyweight tournament for the ages.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing - GLORY 105: Last Heavyweight Standing Finals
programme.desc: In the quarter finals, Belgian Moroccan Anis Bouzid (48-4, 37 KO) takes on kickboxing legend Errol Zimmerman (112-20-1, 45 KO), Serbian sensation Milos Cvjeticanin (17-5, 10 KO) meets number one French heavyweight Sofian Laidouni (42-5-1, 20 KO), monstrous Tariq ‘Cookie’ Osaro (29-4-1, 16 KO) clashes with ‘The Soldier’ Nidal Bchiri (20-5-1, 5 KO), and ‘The Black Ghost’ Mory Kromah (35-3-1, 21 KO) collides with outspoken rival Michael ‘Timebomb’ Boapeah (23-5-1, 29 KO). Only one fighter can come out on top and walk away as the new ‘King of Kickboxing’. Elsewhere, the always exciting Bahram Rajabzadeh (72-6, 64 KO) goes up against ‘The Gladiator’ Cristian Ristea (44-27, 13 KO), Hamicha (42-2, 31 KO) puts his undefeated GLORY record on the line against late replacement Brice Kombou (20-6, 5 KO), and featherweights Andre Santos (23-2, 10 KO) and Deniz Demirkapu (15-5, 10 KO) will kick-off the main card.
