Plenty of people said it couldn’t be done, but that’s just the kind of challenge Stacey is up for. Plenty of sparks are gonna fly, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Stunt Double Interior
programme.desc: They say that true change comes from within… Well, this week Stacey turns his attention to the interior of the Stunt Double. The old, crusty junk hits the floor and our Fall Guy inspired build gets a new look: from painting trim and door panels, to a new bench seat. Man o’ man, this truck is starting to look completely different. A shower of sparks lights up the garage as Stacey demonstrates how to make a bracket that mounts our new bench seat to the truck while using the stock seat adjustment. It’s a tour de force of aftermarket parts and salvaging what we’ve got, this week on GearZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Stunt Double Gets a Lift
programme.desc: When you’re putting together a project that’s inspired by a high-flying stunt truck, you know you’ve got to add some lift, and our Stunt Double gets the goods this week. The front and rear suspension get treated to a 6” lift to get that rig up in the air. But a good lift won’t do any good if the steering and frame can’t hold up, so Stacey shows you how Offroad Design has fixed some serious issues that many late model four-wheel drives encounter. Bed need to come off your truck, but the carriage bolts are rusted and spinning? Stacey’s got a fix for that too. There’s a lot going on, and we’ve got you covered, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Ram Gets a Procharger
programme.desc: Everyone needs a little boost here and there. For some people, coffee does the trick. But here in the GearZ Garage we take our boost seriously. And we like ours packing 160 HP. Hang on to your seat as Stacey adds a bolt on Supercharger to a Ram 1500 breathes a little excitement into a daily driver. And speaking of things going on in the garage, you’ll definitely want to stick around as Stacey talks shop with the guys at Rebuilding Generations. Learn all about how this mentoring program is teaching the next generation about working on cars and sharing plenty of life lessons. We’ve got a lot going on this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Stunt Double Drivetrain
programme.desc: We’re running full steam ahead as the Stunt Double rolls back into the shop this week! First, Stacey reveals the wheels and tires that are going to accentuate that 6” lift, then He dives headlong into the drivetrain of this beast and comes up with a hot crate engine and a high-performance transmission to get the Stunt Double ready for the road. But that’s not all…. We also take some time out for a visit with the guys from American Powertrain and so much more. Check out the sparks flying in the garage this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Catalog Camaro Front Suspension
programme.desc: It’s business as usual in the garage this week. We’re back at work on the Catalog Camaro and really diggin’ into the front end. You know what they say, “out with the old and in with the new,” and that’s exactly what Stacey’s doing. The old sub frame, drivetrain, and suspension are hitting the garage floor in favor of a much-needed updated suspension system that’ll keep this awesome Camaro hugging the road at high speeds—From the wheels to the sub frame, Stacey’s replacing it all. And he’s not going to break the bank while doing it, either. Follow the GearZ crew as they hit the road and visit Cornwell Tools to see their latest and greatest tool box being manufactured. From powder coat to knuckle bustin’ bolts, we’ve got you covered this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Procharger Visit
programme.desc: We head out of the garage to visit one of the premiere supercharger manufacturers in the world… ATI Pro Charger. Follow along for the ride as Stacey walks through the entire process of how they have raised the bar on how a supercharger is built and what it does. From bulk metal to dyno runs, we’ve got it covered. Back in the garage, a young Gearhead drops by to learn how to install an air intake and cowl induction hood on his pick-up. After the wrench turning is done, he and Stacey have enough time to hit a few licks on their guitars. From massive horsepower increases with state-of-the-art tools and machinery, to simple intake and hood installs,….. it’s all here, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Recaps & Catchups
programme.desc: Stacey is in full hot rod mode as he unveils a wicked LS engine and Tremec 6spd tranny and stuffs it into the Catalog Camaro. If 600hp and a 6spd in a Camaro doesn’t get you going, the update on the Stunt Double will! It’s old school cool as Stacey shows off the stainless light bar, side steps and cutout flairs to give the truck that “Fall Guy” vibe. After that we introduce you to the amazing world of scale R/C that is sure to have you re-thinking what you want for Christmas! Finally we roll in some updates on the Cheetah and the Junkyard Jag too. If you’re a gearhead, you’re gonna find a whole lot to love about this show!......and that’s GEARZ!!!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Puttin’ on the B.R.A.K.E.S.
programme.desc: Season 12 opens with bang as Stacey starts the final assembly process on the V8 Interceptor. If you’ve ever wondered how to lay out an aftermarket A/C system, wiring harness, and steering column on your project… and make them all work together, you have to see this show! After that, NHRA legend and Hall-of-Famer, Doug Herbert drops by the GearZ garage to share the shocking story that inspired him to start the B.R.A.K.E.S. driving program. Hold on tight, because this ain't your typical high school driver's Ed. Program! If you want cool tech and awesome stories… you’re gonna find that on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Snowcat Bed Fabrication
programme.desc: It’s all about fabrication and thinking outside the box, or to be more specific... outside the bed! Sure, sure, there are plenty of custom pick-up truck beds you can buy but Stacey shows you what is involved in MAKING a custom bed to fit any vehicle, even something as crazy as a Thiokol Imp snowcat! That's right… our little snowcat is back from the sand blaster and ready for a cool bed to match the cab. Stacey goes in-depth about sizing up the project, picking the right parts, and most importantly: how to cut, weld, grind and finish sheet metal to get a bed that will fit your unique vehicle like a glove. So grab a welder… it’s time to make your bed!... only on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Fort Carson On The Road
programme.desc: Stacey takes a trip to Fort Carson, Colorado to visit the Army auto skills program during their world conference. Not only does Stacey get to meet a General, but he also meets a young Sergeant who is in the middle of a frame-off square body restoration. After a thorough walk around, Stacey decides to get LMC involved in helping out with this build. Parts for the bed of his truck can’t match the gratitude we share for our active military and all those who have served, but it’s a start. And we can’t wait to see the project when it’s finished. And speaking of new beds, with the custom bed on the Snow Cat, it’s time to address the tracks, and Right Track Systems has us covered. That little cat is going to tear it up when all is said and done! It’s going to be a lot of fun, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - V8 Interceptor Final Assembly
programme.desc: It’s all about Cougars! No, not that kind of Cougar... the kind with 4 wheels and a legendary pedigree! After a short history lesson about how these cars came into existence and why they were so cool, Stacey rolls the V8 Interceptor back into the shop and digs into the final assembly of this wild ’67 Mercury Cougar. This week’s episode focuses on planning out your final assembly, and taking care of all the little details, before you put the big things in like engine and transmission. Whether it’s planning out your brake system, battery location, or running fuel lines, Stacey shows how a little extra time in the planning department will make all the difference in your build.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - SR-71 Blackbird & Panel Truck
programme.desc: Stacey takes us through the history of the legendary SR-71 Blackbird. If you’re not familiar with this bird, it could fly mach 3.2, cruise at 80,000 feet and kept our country safe through its many reconnaissance missions. Never shot down, and never outrun, it was the hot rod of the sky! Stacey gets to sit down with pilot Lt. Col. Ed Yeilding and talk about his record setting transcontinental flight—Coast to Coast in 67 minutes and 54 seconds! The iconic Blackbird was such an inspiration that you know Stacey had to make a vehicle inspired by and paying tribute to it, so get ready to meet the SR-71 Rapid Tool Express!!!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Catalog Camaro Butt Lift and Tummy Tuck
programme.desc: The Catalog Camaro is back in the garage and ready to go under the knife as Stacey shows how to do a butt lift and tummy tuck on a 2nd generation Camaro. What does that mean? Well, last season Stacey performed a nose job on this old ’81 Camaro to show how easy it is to get rid of the 80’s plastic front bumpers and put on the classic early 70’s split-bumper, rally sport front sheetmetal. This week he continues the makeover by losing the plastic rear bumper and wrap-around taillights and grafting in the early 70’s quarter panels, round taillights and chrome bumper. It’s more in depth than the front and definitely requires some skilled metal surgery, but Stacey shows you all the tricks on how to do it properly. So, sit back and enjoy the ride as Stacey details how to measure, cut, and weld your way to a much younger looking Camaro.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Big Bad Buick
programme.desc: Stacey rolls in a Big Bad Buick Riviera and shows you what is possible with the right vehicle and some bolt on parts. This 1972 Riviera is a great entry-level project that won’t break the bank, and has the potential to serve some serious humble-pie to any unsuspecting hot shot that may want to mix it up at the stoplight. As it sits, the big 455 under the hood is a force to be reckoned with, but Stacey shows what a weekend in the garage and a top end rebuild can do for a car like this! Get ready to get your hands dirty and bust a few knuckles as Stacey pulls the old heads, intake, cam, and ignition off and replaces them with performance parts from companies like TA Performance, Edelbrock, and MSD. It’s a lesson in Buick and bolt-on horsepower, and you’re only gonna find it on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Cheetah Paint & Body
programme.desc: The GearZ crew hits the road this week and travels to the Charlotte Speed Shop to see how paint prep is going on Stacey’s Cheetah Evolution Car. With the hood and side vents glassed in and smoothed out, the first coat of primer gets sprayed and this awesome cat takes one big step closer to coming home! Stacey also stops by to visit with a fellow boat tail Riviera owner and trade tips on beefing up these classic beauties. It turns out that this guy and Stacey had both been watching this same car when it came up for sale! Come hang out with us as we visit some great folks this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Big Bad Buick Inside & Out
programme.desc: Stacey gets down to business on the Big Bad Buick. With the top end engine rebuilt, the exterior and interior of the car need some serious updating. You don’t have to spend a ton of cash on simple modifications. Stacey shows what’s behind making a good clean line with your bumpers and how a simple front and rear bumper tuck can drastically change the appearance. Replacing the grille and scraping off that old vinyl top are also sure-fire ways to add attitude to this big ol’ boat tail. That old carpet has got to go! Follow along as Stacey shows the ins and outs and some tips and tricks to keep your exterior and interior redo from breaking the bank.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Old #7 Camaro Part 1
programme.desc: Not everyone out there is wrenching on an a classic. In fact, we get tons of emails from viewers who want to upgrade brand-new vehicles but aren’t sure how to get started. Well, Stacey has the answer—and it comes with a little help from our friend and NASCAR legend Jimmie Johnson and a stunning 2018 Camaro SS. Come hang out in the garage as Stacey walks you through the top seven modifications that you can make to a car that you just drove off the lot! Everything from paint upgrades to wheels, Stacey’s got a list. Let’s get started!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Old #7 Camaro Part 2
programme.desc: Stacey’s hard at work on a 2018 Camaro SS. This build is super-cool, not only because he’s running down a list of the top seven mods you can make on a brand-new car, but also because seven-time NASCAR champion, Jimmie Johnson is involved with the project. We’ve covered paint mods, body mods, and interior mods. Now it’s time to go under the hood and under the car and talk powers gains and handling upgrades!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Rapid Tool Express
programme.desc: With our chassis and drivetrain out of the way, it’s time to get moving on the inside of the SR-71 Rapid Tool Express. But how do you organize a bunch of tools in and empty truck? Well, the guys from Summit Bodyworks do it every day on full size Cornwell tool trucks, so it’s only natural that they lend a hand in helping layout the inside our ’59 Panel to make it cool and serviceable. After that, Stacey addresses the issue of wooden floors and beds, and shows you an aluminum floor option that you’d swear came from the forest. Finally, the crew hits the road and gets a chance to talk with top fuel drag racer Leah Pritchett about her drive to become one of the best top fuelers in the nation. From design to drag racing, we’ve got it covered, this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - SR-71 Chassis & Drivetrain
programme.desc: The SR-71 Rapid Tool Express is really taking off! We get our custom chassis from the Roadster Shop—those guys know a thing or two about quality builds. Engine Master Jon Kaase delivers a one-of-a-kind engine to power our SR-71. This build is coming together fast! With the body back on, Stacey takes you through some of the other mods that are going to tie this build in with the SR-71 Blackbird. Get ready, ya’ll, we’ve got loads of good stuff on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - SR-71 On The Move
programme.desc: Season 13 is off and rumbling with Stacey showing off the new exhaust system for the SR-71 Rapid Tool Express project. From the headers to the tailpipes, this exhaust is going to scream! After that, it’s chassis details as Stacey lays out a plan for pedals, brakes and a fuel tank. Of course You can’t have an SR-71 inspired build without some killer wheels and wait ‘til you see what Stacey and our good friends at Neely Precision come up with. It’s all good, and it’s all here, this week on GearZ

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Heavy Metal Paint & Body
programme.desc: The biggest Toy in the shop is back... HEAVY METAL! Yes... Our old junk yard International Tow Truck rolls back into the garage as the freshly painted cab returns from the Hot Rot Institute. And it’s not just any paint, It’s Razzleberry from Axalta that’s so candy, you’ll want to take a bite! But there’s no time for that because Stacey jumps right in to putting a face and interior back in this old junkyard dog. The result will make you really glad that he rescued this one from the crusher! It’s recycling at it’s best... it’s GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Heavy Metal Dash & Interior
programme.desc: We’re moving full steam ahead with the Interior of the Heavy Metal cab coming together and now’s the time to get the dash set up. We’ve got new gauges, old gauges and a bunch of empty holes where switches and knobs lived in this truck’s former life. Stacey lays out the dos and donts of getting your dash updated and a layout that makes sense before it gets installed. GearZ hits the road with a special delivery for the Hot Rod Institute for all they’ve done for us and the restoration industry. Feeling a little down about your project? Well, Stacey has a tool tech that’s sure to lift you up! All this and more on GearZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - SR-71 Interior
programme.desc: The SR-71 Rapid Tool Express returns as Stacey digs into his old ’59 ford panel truck and shows how to convert it into a one-off tool delivery truck to show off a variety of Cornwell tools. From special shelves, lighting and floor, there are even a few surprises that are tucked away inside this rolling tool cart! Moving to the cab of the vehicle, Stacey addresses some of the issues people have when setting up seats and steering, and shows some simple tricks that make a huge difference in getting your seats and steering dialed in. Then it’s on the rear to lay out the gas tank, and then finally the SR-71 gets a new beak.... from a ’59 T-bird! ...What?!?.... how is that possible? Well, ya gotta watch GEARZ to find out!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Topping the Jeep
programme.desc: The Jeep may be the single most modified vehicle out there. From winches to lights, doors and fenders, if you’ve got a Jeep, it probably has some accessories on it. But despite all that, one of the best things about a Jeep is the removable top. It also sparks one of the biggest debates... What is best: a soft top or a hard top? Stacey takes on the challenge by comparing a factory hard top with the new Bestop Trektop. The test will include everything from ease of install to styling, overall sound decibels and of course, how watertight it is. Hopefully you won’t get wet on this ride! Then it’s back to the shop where Stacey shows you that rotisseries aren’t just for chickens, and how an automotive rotisserie can make life in the shop a lot easier. Finally, it’s on to the right and wrong way to use weatherstrip adhesive to hold your rubbers on. Sound risqué? It’s not... it’s just GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Stunt Double Paint
programme.desc: It’s all about square body GM trucks, because The Stunt Double is back in the shop. First, we take a look back at the this awesome ‘86 Chevy 4x4 Silverado long bed build that pays tribute to the legendary Fall Guy TV truck. From its beginnings as a well-worn farm truck, you’ll see it get an upgraded suspension, interior, drivetrain, as we make it better than I was before... better... stronger... faster... wait, that was a DIFFERENT Lee Majors TV show! After that, we walk you through the paint job and show how it is similar to the Fall Guy truck, only different.... because It’s the Stunt Double!!! No hocus pocus... no movie magic... just a tough truck being built to handle the toughest stunts... only on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - SR-71 Frame & Body Assembly
programme.desc: The SR-71 Rapid Tool Express is back on the block and going back together for the last time. Stacey finishes up the frame into a rolling masterpiece with the suspension and drivetrain assembled for the last time. Then the body goes back on, and the interior starts to go together. We’re talking fitting the carpet, steering column and the new dash bezel and stuffing that bezel with custom SR-71 gauges. After that, Stacey shows some tricks on how to choose the right transmission and why rechargeable power tools are giving the tried and true air tools a run for their money! It's all here and more on GearZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Gas, Tops, Brushes & Samurais
programme.desc: With the e85 market and flex fuel vehicles growing every day, Stacey dives into the myths and truths that surround ethanol and whether or not it’s a good choice for your vehicle. With a little help from Advanced Fuel Dynamics, Stacey installs a new fuel delivery system on a 2017 Mustang to show just how easy it is to up your performance and keep your engine safe at the same time. After that, Stacey and the crew head out west to tell the story of Bestop and how they’ve been making removable Jeep tops for decades. From rock-crawlers to the mall crawlers, Bestops unique past allows us to see what the future of the Jeep world will be. Finally, if you’re trying to decide between a stick or automatic transmission… hang out for a while as Stacey talks about converting your boring automatic to a lively manual transmission. We’ve got all this and more on GearZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Cornwell 100
programme.desc: It’s rare for people to reach the age of 100. It’s ever rarer for a business, but that just what Cornwell Quality Tools has done! Take a trip through the last century as Stacey tracks the development of a tool company started by a blacksmith, to the tool truck empire that stresses quality over everything else. Speaking of 100 years…trucks have been around for over a century, and for over a century, truck owners have struggled to find the best way to lift their trucks. Stacey sheds some light on picking the right kind of lift for the truck you’re driving. We’ve got all of this and more on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - The Return of Copperhead
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a good mystery. One of our favorite GearZ mysteries is the whereabouts of Copperhead, the legendary C10 that Stacey built more than a decade ago. It seemed like the truck just disappeared. Well, it’s back! And Stacey was reunited with it at the C10 Nationals in Ft. Worth, TX. Tag along as Stacey gets a chance to get behind the wheel again and boil some tires. Back in the garage, Stacey tackles a fuel injection install on a Jeep Scrambler, then checks out the new Core Doors from Bestop. There’s a lot going on and plenty of smoke on the Texas Motor Speedway on this episode of GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - SR-71 Fins, Logo and Mystery Paint
programme.desc: As the SR71 Rapid Tool Express nears completion there are a couple of major things left on the plate before we can fire her up and get her down the road. First, every aircraft must have fins, and Stacey finally finds the fins he’s been looking for since the beginning of this build. Second, a cool logo design shows up at the shop. Third, what’s a stealthy tribute vehicle without stealthy paint? Believe it or not, Stacey’s got some paint that should keep the SR71 flying under the radar. Also, a slightly modified March Performance system will help Stacey get that much closer to putting some spark to this awesome build and stick around for plenty of other tech advice from America’s Gearhead… on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - On the Road - Squarebody
programme.desc: We’re on the road, again, as Stacey visits a truck enthusiast working on his first ground up restoration. It’s a sweet, clean, square body that’s in good enough condition that it might be on the road in a couple of months. But every build can use a little push, and GearZ On the Road does just that! After that, we dig into toolboxes. Hang out as Stacey talks with two engineers about what makes the new Cornwell Platinum boxes so tough. From rollers to welds, these might be the Ultimate box! Then the Cheetah is back in the garage, but only for a day or two before it heads out to get the body work finished and get some new color. It’s all here on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - REVIVING THE SUR-TREK 8-WHEEL DRIVE ATV
programme.desc: STACEY DIGS INTO A PROJECT THAT SHOWS YOU JUST HOW MUCH FUN YOU CAN HAVE FOR ALMOST NO MONEY. BECAUSE HE’S TAKING A DERELECT 70’S ATV, STUFFING IN A JUNKYARD ENGINE, TOSSING IN SOME GOOD OL’ AMERICAN INGENINUITY AND ENDING UP WITH A REALLY COOL RIG. IT’S CHEAP! IT’S FUN! AND YOU’LL BE SURPRISED WHAT YOU LEARN ON A PROJECT LIKE THIS!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz - Banshee Part 1
programme.desc: What do you get when you cross the quentessential girl's car, the Mazda Miata, with the ultimate guy's car...the Shelby Cobra? Well, Gearz is the only place to find out as Stacey blows apart an innocent Miata to get it ready for its conversion into a V8 powered, screamin' machine called the "Banshee."

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - The Big Dipper
programme.desc: As the team works to complete a multitude of cars, Mark stresses over the metal dipping of the very rare and valuable ʻ71 Cuda 440-6. Tensions are high and time is limited, is the GYC crew up to the pressure?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - It's Alive
programme.desc: The ghouls get the remains back from the '71 440 Six Barrel, 4 Speed, Shaker Hood Phantom Cuda and determine if the car can be resurrected. A '69 Dodge Daytona Charger arrives ready to be brought back from the dead and Mark gets a 2011 SRT8 Dodge Challenger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Six-Pack to Go
programme.desc: The ghouls get the N96 Air Grabber installed on the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car. It's started and is ready for final assembly. The owners of '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car visit to check on the restoration progress.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Hey, Charger!
programme.desc: Mark is hired to restore the body, paint, and suspension of a '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car. The shop gets some needed upgrades and the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car is completed to OEM Specifications.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Wet Paint
programme.desc: The '70 Sunroof Challenger is painted and ready for final assembly. The '69 Daytona Charger is disassembled and readied to be shipped to the media blasters. Mark and the Ghoulz head out to the junkyard to blow off some steam playing paintball.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Factory Correct
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghoulz use their brand new Shop Crane to lower the body of the '71 Cuda 340 Triple Black 'Phantasm' Tribute car onto its restored suspension and its drive-train is assembled and installed.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Holley Equipped
programme.desc: The '69 Daytona Charger returns from the media blaster and Mark gives Josh a history lesson on the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel Car before removing it's drive-train and suspension.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Every Rose Has Its Thorn
programme.desc: The ghouls get the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car completely disassembled and off to the media blaster. Mark disassembles and restores the right-hand door to the 71' 440 Phantom Cuda. In addition, the headliner and vinyl top is installed in the 71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Every Rose Has Its Thorn
programme.desc: The ghouls get the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car completely disassembled and off to the media blaster. Mark disassembles and restores the right-hand door to the 71' 440 Phantom Cuda. In addition, the headliner and vinyl top is installed in the 71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - You Win Some …
programme.desc: The owner of the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car visits the shop and learns about assembly-line markings. Mark checks the paint on the body of the '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car and discovers a major problem.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Cuda Madness
programme.desc: The ghouls receives a '70 Barracuda Convertible to get a full restoration. Despite improbability, Mark straightens the fender for the '71 440 Phantom Cuda and the crew continues the restoration of the '71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Cuda Madness
programme.desc: The ghouls receives a '70 Barracuda Convertible to get a full restoration. Despite improbability, Mark straightens the fender for the '71 440 Phantom Cuda and the crew continues the restoration of the '71 'Phantasm' Tribute car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Flippin' the Bird
programme.desc: The ghouls detail and assemble the suspension of the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car. The owners of the '70 Plymouth Superbird, in the queue for resurrection, visit the shop and Daren convinces the crew to throw a birthday party for Mark.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Fish n' Chips
programme.desc: Mark takes some time for himself and leaves Daren in charge of the shop. The crew gets the newly painted panels installed on the '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car. And Mark discovers a chip on the '71 'Phantasm' Tribute car and no one will own up to it.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Game Day
programme.desc: The fuel and brake lines are installed in the '71 'Phantasm' Tribute car. Daren quits and won't return until Mark begins the restoration of his '70 Plum Crazy Challenger. A phone-call from the Phantasm car owner forces Mark to make a promise he might not be able to keep.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Phantasm ‘Cuda
programme.desc: The GYC crew is under the gun to get the '71 Cuda 340 Triple Black 'Phantasm' Tribute car finished by the end of the week. With the exhaust, ornamation, and the engine start still ahead of them, will they be able to finish the car before the director of the 'Phantasm' movie franchise arrives?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Back in Triple Black
programme.desc: Mark and the team rush to complete the triple-black, '71 Cuda, Phantasm homage car. The director and star of Phantasm, Don Coscarelli and A. Michael Baldwin, visit Graveyard Carz to check out the homage car and hopefully, drive it around town.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - AAR You Ready for This?
programme.desc: The team tears down Mike Hill's '70 Superbird and finishes up final touches on Chris Driscoll's '70 AAR Cuda. Daren confronts Mark about stealing parts from his car and Mark gets a rematch on Chris Driscoll's race track.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Go for It!
programme.desc: Holly asks Mark if she can work on cars. Mark Cain from Bad Boy Blasters brings the crew a huge gift. The '70 Barracuda Convertible is torn down and sent to the dipper, progress is made on the '70 Sunroof Challenger and Mark gets a surprise from one of his favorite actors.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Get Your Hands Dirty
programme.desc: Mark installs the hood decal on the '70 Sunroof Challenger, Holly helps Josh disassemble the Barracuda suspension, Mark and Daren work on the 440 engine for the Challenger, and the team assembles one of the rarest Mopar options, the sunroof for the '70 Challenger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - W-O-M-A-N, Mark Woman
programme.desc: The team rushes to ready the '69 Dodge Daytona for Tom Partridge and his family's visit. The guys settle a leadership dispute the old fashioned way, the Graveyard Carz van gets a face lift, and Daren retaliates when Mark won't let him sign for deliveries.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Pop Secrets
programme.desc: Holly helps Mark on the '70 Challenger, Daren annoys everyone with his popcorn and causes Mark to damage a very rare car. Tony D'Agostino, from Tony's Mopar Parts, visits and lends a hand on the '70 sunroof Challenger. Mark lets Holly in on the big secret and Daren reveals a secret of his own.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Let the Sunshine In
programme.desc: Mark gets a portable showroom, the '70 Hemi Charger is dissembled and the team finishes the 1970 Sunroof Challenger. Mark finally reveals his big secret project to the Graveyard Carz team and Royal makes a video tribute to the Sunroof Challenger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - The Royal Treatment
programme.desc: Mark and the ghouls build out the 440 Super Commando engine for their '70 Plymouth Superbird and install the suspension for the '69 Daytona Charger. Daren finally has enough of Mark's foolishness.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - The Grand Torino
programme.desc: Body man Derrick becomes an official Graveyard Carz crew member and assists in the disassembly of the rare '67 Plymouth Hemi GTX Convertible. Josh and Daren play "the game" with Mark.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - The Waltons
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghoulz get a massive sheet-metal order from AMD for their '70 Plymouth Superbird. Meanwhile, the owners of the '72 Charger visit and talk about what made their car so special. Daren gets the offer of a lifetime on his '70 Challenger R/T.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - It's the Great Pumpkin, Goldberg!
programme.desc: It's a Moparween at Graveyard Carz! Just when things couldn't get crazier, Bill Goldberg shows up to go over his '68 GTX Convertible and knock some sense into the guys. He can handle the NFL and the WCW, but can he hold his own at GYC?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Daytona Reborn Pt. 1
programme.desc: Mark is behind on his promise to get Tom Partidge's '69 Daytona Charger finished by the end of the month. The crew kicks into high gear to get Tom's Daytona looking great and out the door.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage - Exterior Car Care
programme.desc: Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for properly washing your vehicle to avoid instilling swirl marks

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage - Restoring A Used Car
programme.desc: Nick Rutter teaches how to restore headlights, clean engine, remove water spots and other tips on a used car

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Dang’ Mustang
programme.desc: The guys install a stiffer suspension on this Mustang to help get it ready for power adders and they toss on a new exhaust to sweeten its sound.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Beat up Blazer
programme.desc: Willie and Kevin freshen up a rough looking Chevy Blazer with paint and a new front fascia. They also fix a starting issue and get it running right again.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Wrangler Ready
programme.desc: The guys take a Jeep from meh, to mean - when they install a new long arm suspension kit to get this Jeep Wrangler Unlimited ready for the trails.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Righteous Rear End
programme.desc: This 2010 Camaro will soon be churning out close to 1000 Horsepower, so Kevin and Willie get it ready to handle that power by installing a new Ford 9 inch, new rear axle shafts, and a new drive shaft.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Two BMWs
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie have two BMWs in the shop today, an M3 and a 528i. One is the weekend driver in need of a little more power, and the other is the family car that needs some maintenance after throwing a few codes.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Super Duty Hauler
programme.desc: The guys help this 2017 Ford Super Duty with a 5th wheel, see its loads better by adding a second rear camera. They also give it a little more get up and go with a performance tune.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Federated Project Truck
programme.desc: The guys have Federated’s 1990 454SS Project Truck in house and they’re doing a ton of work to it. From brakes and shocks to chassis work, this truck needs some love.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - 2013 Jeep Wrangler JK Steering
programme.desc: The guys tackle a steering issue in this supped up Jeep by replacing the worn-out power steering gear and installing a new power steering cooler. They toss in a few extras for the owner as well.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Diamond in Dodge City
programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Don't Tell Dale
programme.desc: Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Biker Lore
programme.desc: Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Vegas Payday
programme.desc: Big Time Motorcycle Auction

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Second Time's a Charm
programme.desc: The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Wounded Warrior Project
programme.desc: Home Depot Senior Vice President, Gordon Erickson, is a huge fan of Wheels Through Time. He is also a huge supporter of the Wounded Warrior program. For years the hardware giant has been donating goods and services to help returning servicemen with their fix-it-up projects. Now they would like to go one step further and build a WWII military bike to raise awareness and funds. Only problem is where to get one? Enter Dale and an exhaustive, time sensitive, cross country search for a rare military machine.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Orphan Bikes
programme.desc: Promoters of the prestigious Amelia Island Concours have called on Dale to develop a show and field bikes for an “Orphan Bike” show. They have defined orphan bike as extremely rare, that aren't a Harley nor Indian machines.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Time is Not On Their Side
programme.desc: For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Doubling Down
programme.desc: A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - The Century Race
programme.desc: “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Motorcycle Crime Story
programme.desc: “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - 100 Year Old Harley
programme.desc: “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Davenport Swap
programme.desc: A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Peashooter
programme.desc: A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Hidden Hillclimbers
programme.desc: A cross-country race to lay claim to some of the world’s most sought after works specials.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - 12 Hours and Running
programme.desc: “12hrs. & Running”: Dale turns a surprise 60th birthday party into a challenge to his guests to start 120 of the rarest motorcycles in the world.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Diamond in Dodge City

Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.desc: Big Time Motorcycle Auction

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - 100 Year Old Harley

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Motorcycle Crime Story
programme.desc: “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - The Century Race
programme.desc: “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Doubling Down
programme.desc: A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - HOLLYWOOD MAKEOVER
programme.desc: Everyone has a car they fell in love with. Maybe it was the first? Maybe it was the hot rod the guy down the street owned? In Ray’s case, it was the ’58 Chevy he saw in the iconic coming of age car movie, American Graffiti. When Ray gets the chance to own the car after years and years of pursuit, he jumps on it. But restoring the car to its "movie state" proves to be a grueling task that goes way beyond a typical build. But when it's you first love, you can't let her down.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - WOODIE WAGONS
programme.desc: The premiere episode features a dive into the influence cars had on culture of California. From road racing in the 1940’s to the inception of the iconic Woody wagon on the California beach scene, automobiles undoubtedly shaped the West Coast attitude. Ray talks to The Beach Boys frontman Mike Love and surfing icon Laird Hamilton for a glimpse into the cars that are so connected to surfing culture.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - MOONSHINE
programme.desc: Ray uncovers the secrets of America’s greatest racing sport in the foothills of North Carolina. When moonshiners were looking to outrun police officers, they would custom fit engines to race the back woods tracks. That sport eventually evolved into NASCAR and Ray talks to the early adopters of this national pastime.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - MARTY ROBBINS
programme.desc: Grammy-winning musician Marty Robbins lived a double life, flawlessly crossing between the glitz of the Grand Ole Opry and track at Talladega. One of few musicians to ever achieve success in both genres, Ray is determined to return Marty’s iconic 777 car to the race track travel back to the 60’s and 70’s.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - HOT RODS
programme.desc: Legendary drag racer Don “The Snake” Prudhomme proves he is no stranger to the thrill of racing rivalry. Prudhomme’s career and subsequent competition with driver Tom “The Mongoose” McEwan earned the pair an unforgettable imprint on American pop culture. Legions of kids in the 60’s and 70’s flocked to the shelves for Snake and Mongoose Matchbox cars which helped make drag racing an undisputable American pastime. Famed director Ron Howard makes an appearance to discuss the incredible stories hidden within the world of Formula 1 Racing, the topic of his latest, epic feature ‘Rush”.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - BURIED TREASURE
programme.desc: Ray finds Buried Treasures in the form of two race cars that had been left almost completely untouched since the last time they were on a race track. One is found sitting in a barn with the other trapped in an old car hauler. Upon uncovering the cars, we find both have big stories to tell.

programme.title: What's In the Barn? - Time is Not On Their Side
programme.desc: For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.desc: An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage - Detailing an Electric Vehicle
programme.desc: Nick Rutter walks you through step-by-step on how to detail the exterior as well as the interior of an electric vehicle, including vegan leather cleaning and conditioning.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage - Detailing Tips & Techniques
programme.desc: Nick Rutter walks you through the best tools, chemicals, and accessories for performing a myriad of detailing tasks, including cleaning buffing pads, selecting the best tire shine, as well as quick interior maintenance.

programme.title: Truck U - Truck U Checklist
programme.desc: Matt and Bruno have a large Truck U checklist. They have to get a Bronco Project running again. Bruno has a racer friend stopping by who needs a hand and Matt shows us the new shop purchase.

programme.title: Truck U - K5 Blazer
programme.desc: Time to get low with a K5 Blazer. Matt and Bruno are going to C-notch the frame and and this 73’ blazer while still using the factory wheels and tires.

programme.title: Truck U - Operation Comfort
programme.desc: Bruno takes a trip to San Antonio, Texas to meet the soldiers of Operation Comfort and see what makes their Bronco Weapons Carrier so special

programme.title: Truck U - Monster in a Box
programme.desc: Bruno and Matt put together a Monster transmission from scratch and start building the tube chassis for the Rock Racer

programme.title: Truck U - Ford Common Problems
programme.desc: Not all trucks are perfect. Matt and Bruno dissect some common Ford problems in the engine and suspension.

programme.title: Truck U - Air Bag It Part 1
programme.desc: Bruno and Matt improve the ride quality and tow capacity on our Ford Super Duty tow project by installing an adjustable airbag system.

programme.title: Truck U - Air Bag It Part 2
programme.desc: We finish the Air Bag kit on our Super Duty tow project and put it to the test on the road.

programme.title: Truck U - Street Truck
programme.desc: Bruno and Matt install some upgrades on a 2010 Ford F 150 to make it more roadworthy

programme.title: AmeriCarna - DISCOVERIES IN JERSEY
programme.desc: Ray explores buying a unique, hand built car the Schultz family has kept in their New Jersey home for years. The car was originally called the Schultz El Fierro but it’s officially titled in New Jersey as a “Schultz Special” from 1958. It was used to drag race and held numerous racing records, but most important to the family was that it was driven by the legendary Carroll Shelby. With a frame and style much similar to the Shelby Roadster, the Schultz family wonders if it inspired one of the most well known automobiles in America. In another epic New Jersey story, Ray finds Mario Andretti’s 1965 IndyCar. The catch: it’s completely in pieces hidden away in a garage. The iconic driver talks about his days on the track with that car and Ray attempts to negotiate a deal to buy the parts.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - MOVIE CARS
programme.desc: How do you cast a car in a movie? What are the secrets to the build? Hollywood car designers give Ray the ultimate tour of some memorable movie cars, including a look at the recently found “Hells Chariot”, the last surviving car from Grease. We also hear the backstory to “Bumble Bee” from Transformers, take a look at the making of the tanks for Hunger Games and stumble upon the iconic 1958 Chevy Impala from American Graffiti.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - HOT ROD HOLY GRAIL
programme.desc: While visiting the estate of automotive genius and land speed record holder Willie Glass, Ray uncovers a set of extremely rare Ardun cylinder heads, which is a hot rodders dream discovery. He also visits the infamous H & H Flatheads outside of Los Angeles and discovers a surprise connection to the Earnhardt family.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - CORVETTE SINK HOLE
programme.desc: A massive sinkhole opened underneath the National Corvette Museum in Kentucky. Eight amazing cars were swallowed up, including the 1,000,000th Corvette. AmeriCarna was given exclusive access to document the removal of the cars from the sinkhole and the painstaking restoration of the 1,000,000th Corvette.

programme.title: AmeriCarna - ROAR AT THE SHORE
programme.desc: On the beaches of Wildwood, NJ, an iconic vintage race, The Race of Gentleman, takes place annually: period cars, period dress, pure authenticity. Ray puts a car in the race with a very special driver, who turns out not to be a Gentleman.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Hollywood's Cars Come to Life at Picture Car Productions
programme.desc: Covert cars that slipped into the U.S.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Rickey Gadson Stares Down a Steep Learning Curve at Rd. Atl
programme.desc: "Go Fast Girl" Katherne Legge's Model A Racer.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - A Sneak Peek at a Premier, Private Collection
programme.desc: Mecum Auction's push for a $15,000,000 sale.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - The World's Largest Monthly Car Show Goes Up for Sale to the Highest Bidder
programme.desc: Doubling down for cars and coffee.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Landscaping a Home with a Nod to Automotive
programme.desc: British Invasion through the decades.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - The Fertile Car Grounds in the North Georgia Mountains
programme.desc: Due diligence on custom builds and their quirky builders.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Cars and Coffee Takes Center Stage on Amelia Island
programme.desc: The Concourse d'lemons celebrates the oddball, mundane, & truly awful of the automotive world.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Concourse d'lemons: One Man's Trash Is a Car Enthusiast's Treasure
programme.desc: Rickey, Bryan and Adam explore all the cars that should never have been built at Concourse d'lemons.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Super Cars at Course d'Elegance
programme.desc: One of a kind cars at Amelia Island Caffeine & Octane.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - A New Generation Takes over Amelia Island Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane at Ameilia Island have everything from classic to extraterrestrial.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Voices: Blackberry Smoke
programme.desc: A new season kicks off with some big numbers: Featuring the world's fastest C8 Corvette, an overpowered Cortina Mark I, and a Buick Regal with over 1,700 horsepower

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Voices: Bishop Rob Wright
programme.desc: C & O: North America's most diverse car show: Featuring custom Bugs, John Kaase fire breathing '56 Fords, and Chevy Silverados touching 1000HP

programme.title: Brumos Collection with Hurley
programme.desc: C & O Jacksonville: Featuring Hurley Haywood's Brumos Porsches, a street legal Indy car, and a dynamic '60 Olds

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Brumos Collection with Hurley
programme.desc: C & O Jacksonville: Featuring Hurley Haywood's Brumos Porsches, a street legal Indy car, and a dynamic '60 Olds

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Graffiti Artist KBMER
programme.desc: Jacksonville's C & O's colorful and quirky car culture.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Voices: Sport's Radio Legend, Mike Bell
programme.desc: C & O: North America's greatest car show

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Voices: Killer Mike
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane: North America's greatest car show

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Fuller's Fab 5
programme.desc: Amelia Island's own Caffeine & Octane car show,: Featuring $2,000 Wrek Racing Truck, David Patterson's favorite C&O cars, a plastic Citroen Mehari, and much more.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Generation Amelia
programme.desc: The Concours d'Elegance from Amelia Island: Featuring bomb-proof Conquest Knight XV, '69 Camaro Hagerty Fixer-Upper, and car-enthusiast John Oates.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Delta Wing Racer with a Vengeance
programme.desc: State-of-the-art engineering and passion projects take center stage on this edition of Caffeine & Octane. The revolutionary Delta Wing Racer turns on hot lap after hot lap at Road Atlanta, and driver Katherine Legge offers insight on how “less is more” when it comes to power to weight ratios; the dark world of a graffiti artist paints a picture of a car called Vengeance while the hosts share the eclectic hybrids of machines that make it to Caffeine and Octane with Vengance’s creator Totem.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Henry Ford III & Counterfeit Cars
programme.desc: The word is out that Caffeine & Octane is the ultimate scene and the place to be seen. Even after 12 hours of racing at the Petit Le Mans endurance race, Henry Ford III, the great grandson of Henry Ford the industrial magnate and current member of Ford’s Board of Directors, showed up to take in the sights, address the crowds, and sign a one of a kind Ford Shelby GT350R. The GT350R will hit the road with Operation Hope to encourage young people to study math and science through motorsports; Covert car counterfeiter, Chuck Beck looks for Ford’s approval on his own version of a muscled up Festiva. YouTuber ‘That Dude in Blue’ David Patterson joins Skip and Bryan to get a special look at the motor-based philanthropic outreach and amazing cars that come with it done by John Hope Bryant, friend of Caffeine and Octane.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Go Fast Collections
programme.desc: Rickey and Bryan race outside of their comfort zones, each competing to find the raddest car collection. Rickey hangs out with classic racer, Ron Green, who shows him the ropes in the ultra light '83 Ralt RT5. Bryan visits a collection of 120 racing motorcycle owned by mechanic and racer Mike McConville. Mike takes Bryan motorcross racing in his backyard after showing off his high horsepowered car collection. Caffeine and Octane alongside Ron Green visit Atlanta's first Concours d'elegance to look at classic cars that have been perfectly maintained for decades.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - The Wrap on the Most Beautiful Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Phears’ Jaguar E-Type was nothing more than a diamond in the rough before the mineral rights attorney took on the basket case. Caffeine & Octane brings viewers the story of how Phears’, through relentless research and determination, restored and reunited the #10 Jag that Enzo Ferrari called “the most beautiful car ever made”; Atlanta Wraps shows how wrapping Corvettes and Lamborghinis can color a car fast. Caffeine and Exotics is featured again to show off the coolest wraps Atlanta can supply.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Panoz Racing & Chasing Chevys
programme.desc: Twenty-five years of hand building record-setting race cars is no easy task. But don’t tell that to Don Panoz who takes on Porsches and Ferraris with his laid back personality and a full-production facility that makes improvised versions of Americas V-8’s; Caffeine & Octane gets an exclusive look at an elusive man’s life long pursuit of everything Chevrolet.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Retrofitting a Psycho Mercury
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane goes old school with Psycho Deville singer and pin striper Walt Richards. Richards has less than a week to hand paint his signature flames on a way cool ’50 Mercury. An introduction to Retrofit Lighting’s trickle down technology - from cars to motorcycles - that will revolutionize how bikes will see and be seen.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Beetles, Bugs, and Buses, Oh My!
programme.desc: Caffeine & Octane is known for having something for everyone. That reputation is tested when over 100 VW’s, on the lunatic fringe of automotive, rattled into an event. The annual VW Invasion has swarmed C&O, bringing with it Bugs, Beetles, Buses and more by a very dedicated VW fan base.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Big Tigger v. Monster Muscle
programme.desc: Rapper, radio, and ATL TV personality Darian “Big Tigger” Morgan invites Caffeine & Octane into his home. Cameras look past his collection of 500 Michael Jordan shoes to focus their lenses on a one-off motorcycle the 6–time NBA Champion gave to Tigger as a gift; A second to none, muscle car collection by one of the founders of Monster Energy gets toured by one of our hosts.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Exotic Car Hunter
programme.desc: Vintage Testarossas and Quatra Valve Ferraris don’t just show up on a dealer’s floor, they’re hunted! Adam Merlin, exotic car expert, has spent a lifetime searching for the cars that defined his youth, but nothing is assumed or given in his high stakes game of Risk; A muscle car fiend shows off his private collection to host Skip Smith.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Andruw Jones' Super Jeep
programme.desc: The word is out that Caffeine & Octane is the major league of North American car shows. Former Atlanta Brave, World Series star, and 10-Time Gold Glove winner Andruw Jones acknowledged the stardom and showed up to show off his 6 wheeled Super Jeep. The state of the art creation took years in planning and execution, but Jones chooses one great event for its debut.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Jekyll and Hide
programme.desc: The natural landscape of Jekyll Island, GA makes for a great backdrop to showcase the country’s greatest cars. But the ocean air and remoteness of this GA barrier island is no place to leave a painstakingly rebuilt ‘59 Imperial Speedster. Host Skip Smith makes it his mission to locate the talented builder behind this island mystery. Guest host Totem joins Bryan Fuller in the C&O lots to pick out his favorites.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Big Yellow Taxi
programme.desc: Imagination, ingenuity, and heartache join friends who set out with a simple goal of transforming a ‘35 Plymouth into a running taxi cab. Provenance and passion take center stage as families and friends strive for best in show. Host Rickey Gadson checks out perfect replicas of the original Shelby Cobras and takes Skip and Bryan on ‘borrowed’ taxi ride.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane - Peach State Challengers
programme.desc: Call the Peach State Challengers a “car club” and you will quickly be corrected. The defenders of everything Dodge are “family” and they make no excuses for their loyalty to brand and brother. Spend a day at the track with these Challengers and find out what their version of the family photo looks like.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage - Detailing a Motorcoach
programme.desc: Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how to detail various aspects of a motorcoach, including wheels and tires, granite care, proper leather care, as well as glass cleaning.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage - How To Wash Car
programme.desc: Nick Rutter showcases the products and process to properly wash your vehicle, from start to finish, starting with the wheels and tires and finishing with cleaning door jambs.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - WeatherTech Bound
programme.desc: Kevin hits the road to Bolingbrook, Illinois to find out what it takes to proudly display “Made in America”, as he tours WeatherTech to see how they make all those great American products.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Can’t Stop This Mini
programme.desc: The guys have a Mini Cooper S in the shop today. They add some horsepower, some stopping power, and fix up a worn-out suspension to improve handling. Then they see if they can even fit in it for the test drive!

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Get It Runnin’
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie have a problematic Trailblazer in the shop today. They tackle multiple issues and get it up and runnin’ again. The guys also kick start a performance build project on a Gen5 Camaro!

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Tuned Up Stang’
programme.desc: The guys have a 6 Speed 2015 Mustang GT in the shop and they’re adding some power by installing a cold air intake, an exhaust package, a tune, and a … thermostat?

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Cobra Replica Kit Car Build
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie are working on a build again, but this time it’s no work truck! They’re diving in head first on a 550 Horsepower Cobra Replica Kit Car!

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - Fun With A Gen 1 - Part 1
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie have a Gen 1 Camaro in the shop and their work is cut out for them! They’re installing a new sub frame, rack and pinion, brakes, gauges … and that’s just half of the work!

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - More Fun With A Gen 1 - Part 2
programme.desc: The Gen 1 Camaro is back in the shop and the guys still have a lot to do if they want to finish this build!

programme.title: Two Guys Garage - WeatherTech Racing – N.C. Facility
programme.desc: Drivers start your engines! This week, Kevin takes a trip to racing country. We’re giving you a backstage look at WeatherTech’s Porsche Race Team and their North Carolina racing facility.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Mark, Dougie, Allysa, Oh My!
programme.desc: Mark, Dougie, and Allysa team up to kick things into high-gear around the shop. They begin the restoration of a Challenger T/A, Will paints a 1968 GTX in B7 Blue, Allysa learns how dashes are assembled, and they install the drivetrain for the ultra rare, 1 of 2, 1970 Hemi Convertible Coronet R/T.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Shaking the Magic 8-Ball
programme.desc: Mark pulls back the curtain on the next four Mopar’s in desperate need of resurrection while also showcasing the fans favorite moments from Seasons 8 and 9.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Rapping Up the Dash
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghouls are back, and they are ready to get to work! With a call in from the owner of the super rare 1 of 2 ever made, 1970 Coronet Hemi Convertible, Mark has to work fast to reach a looming deadline. At the same time, Will primes the body of our 1969 Daytona, bringing it one step closer to being back on the road.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: While Mark is on a road test of the just completed 1968 Charger, its owner surprises the shop by arriving in person! While the owner waits, Will completes the paint on a beautiful 1970 Challenger in B5 blue. Finally, with Mark returned the owner receives his restored Charger and cooks a meal for the Ghouls as thanks!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Upshift Creek
programme.desc: It’s time to hit the casino! Mark has been invited to a massive car show at the Little Creek Casino but before he can go there are a few things that need to be finished first. Mark and Doug disassemble the Phoenix ‘Cuda, a car that survived a massive garage fire. At the car show, Allysa and Will interact with fans and find their “pick of the show.”

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - It's A Duster Buster
programme.desc: Mark has once again taken Allysa under his wing and is teaching her the finer points of installing a grill and headlights on our 1972 Duster, meanwhile George is in the body shop attaching a tricky quarter panel to a 1969 ‘Cuda which Mark has to check off the list…military style? Finally, the Duster gets it’s drive train and is finally reunited with its engine.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Carbituary: Charger
programme.desc: Who better to explain the history and discuss the changes, year to year, of the Dodge Charger, than the Master of Mopar himself, Mark Worman. In this special episode of Graveyard Carz, Mark will show you unique differences, surprising insights, and cool features on multiple years of the same car: the Dodge Charger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - 1.5 Million Dollar Baby
programme.desc: The focus has shifted, with parts having arrived at the shop it’s time to install the Grill, Bumper, Dash and Interior of our 1968 Turbine Bronze Charger. Mark and the Ghouls work their magic on the Charger until a familiar face shows up. With Royal there, Mark shifts the crew back to the 1 of 2 1970 Coronet and finishes the interior. Then, it’s time for a test drive!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - Willie, Paint it Black?
programme.desc: With SEMA 2018 looming on the horizon, it’s time to address the elephant in the room. Mark’s 1964 A100 Hemi truck, the Little Dead Wagon, built as an homage to Bill Maverick’s Little Red Wagon. Will is set to prime and paint, but has a disagreement with Mark over the color. When the engine for the A100 shows up it’s time to unbox one of the most powerful engines Graveyard Carz has ever put in a car!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz - The A100 Team
programme.desc: Mark and the Ghouls get down to work like never before in order to get the A100 ready for SEMA which is only weeks away. Brakes, suspension, tail lights, bed sealer, you name it and the Mopar Maniacs are racing to get it done. With time flying and stress mounting the team works long hours and weekends trying to finish this iconic build. With SEMA only days away, the A100 finally gets it’s iconic 426 HEMI engine, well, if they can make it fit!

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Smart offers its iconic city car with a convertible option. The Mini cabriolet is bigger and provides room for four people. When it comes to roadster feeling, the Mazda MX-5 is on top of the list. We took a closer look at these three open-top contenders.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: The Paris Motor Show features the automotive world of tomorrow. In 2016 Mercedes-Benz introduced their “Generation EQ” and Volkswagen announced to build 20 new electrified models by 2020, possibly in order to distract from the emission scandal.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: What would make coupe fans opt for a more traditional two-door model like the Mercedes-Benz E400 instead of its bigger brother, the CLS with four doors? Also: does the Volkswagen Arteon stand a chance against the Mercedes CLS?

programme.title: Arden AJ23
programme.desc: A Jaguar that is able to terrify the world alone with its roar. This Jaguar F-Type R tuned by Arden is a real bad boy. Already in the series production configuration, the F-Type R Coupe is a dream car that can really bite but this Jaguar which has been upgraded from Arden, now calls itself "AJ23“ and is more powerful, louder and more aggressive than any of his brothers.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Skoda Octavia, the Opel Insignia Country Tourer, the Subaru Outback, the Audi S4 allroad quattro and the Seat Leon x-perience want to be more than roomy family cars. Their offroad features show that it doesn't always have to be an SUV.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: We present some of the more extreme specimens in the offroad world: a Fiat Panda monster truck, a Ford Raptor, a conversion of a Mercedes G-class Edition, a modified Volkswagen Touareg, a Jeep Grand Cherokee SRT8 and the Fiat Panda Cross.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: With its extravagant design the Lexus NX200t definitely stands out. Infiniti, Nissan's luxury division, is more conservative in that regard. The QX30 features a classic Infiniti design with a curved bonnet. Also: the city SUV Mazda CX-3.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: Three brothers from the same Volkswagen production platform: the Skoda Kodiaq provides room for seven people, the Volkswagen Tiguan is a bit more expensive but offers a broader range of engines, and Seat infuse the SUV segment with Spanish passion.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Jaguar XF-S is supposed to put pressure on BMW, Audi and the other competitors in the business class segment. Volvo take a different approach. Their S90 is captivating due to its Scandinavian design and economical four-cylinder engines.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: ORZ Vehicles, a German company specializing in the production, sale and installation of Jeep parts and accessories, makes the American off-road dream come true. A good example for this approach is the Brute, a pickup version of the Wrangler.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Seat Arona is a typical compact or mini SUV. Another pseudo off-roader is the Volkswagen T-Roc. Can the smallest Volkswagen SUV repeat the success of the best-selling Tiguan? Also: the Asian competitors Hyundai Kona, KIA Stonic and Toyota C-HR.

programme.title: BMW F 800 R
programme.desc: BMW F 800 R is a robust roadster with a lot of spirit, and even motorcycle world champions count on its agility. World champion, Chris Pfeiffer is showing just how much fun you can have with a BMW F 800 R. His work motorcycle is based on the version that you can buy.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The emphatically sporty cars and motorbikes of BMW are equally successful with customers and in racing. However, the former aircraft engine manufacturer's entry into automobile production threatened to fail at an early stage.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Porsche 550 Spyder is small and fast, but only 140 units were built. It was Porsche's first racing sports car and laid the foundation for the German manufacturer to be considered a force in car racing today.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Racing has been a matter of the heart for Ford for over 100 years. Henry Ford already wins the first race with his first car. Thousands of other victories were to follow.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The development of engineering at BMW has always been closely linked to motorsport. Racing has always played a decisive role in shaping the brand and setting the pace for its future.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: In the 1980s and 90s, Porsche races from victory to victory. A McLaren with Porsche engine wins the Formula 1 World Championship three times. In Le Mans in 1982, Porsche starts an unbelievable winning streak with the new 956/962 prototype.

programme.title: Glas 1700 GT
programme.desc: The Glas GT looks like a Ferrari, but comes from the province of Lower Bavaria in Germany. In the early 1960s it was one of the few German sports cars.

programme.title: Peugeot 205 Turbo 16
programme.desc: Peugeot released this classic, all wheel drive monster for one purpose only: It should bring the World Rally Championship to France. The Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 shook up the rally world in the 80s.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: The teams gather in Albaida in Spain for the opening round of the 2025 supermoto season, the Grand Prix of Comunitat Valenciana.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: The competition moves to Italy where Round 2, the Grand Prix of Sardegna, takes place in Tramatza on the island of Sardinia.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: The third round, the Grand Prix of Germany, takes us to the town of St. Wendel in the Saarland region.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: Round 4, the Grand Prix of Hungary, takes us to the town of Visonta in the north-eastern part of the country.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: Busca in the Piemonte region of Italy is the location of the fifth round of this year's competition.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: The teams head to Mettet in the Wallonia region in Belgium for the seventh and final round of the 2025 season, the Grand Prix of Belgium.

programme.title: FIM Supermoto World & European Championship
programme.desc: For Round 6, the S1GP of Nations, the teams head to Vysoké Mýto in the Czech Republic.

programme.title: An Bord des Mclaren 570S Spider
programme.desc: Wir fahren mit dem McLaren 570S Spider ein wenig durchs Gebirge und geniessen den schönen Tag.

programme.title: Crash
programme.desc: When ambition exceeds driving ability and when well-secured racing pros are carried out of the bend, we are there with the camera. Breathtaking stunts of professional drivers and slapsticks of high-powered sheet metal bullets. Spectacular scenes in which no one is harmed.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: Zee finds out if the Land Rover Discovery is still the king of the hill. Jetour’s T1 and T2 SUVs make their South African debut and Zee meets Chelsy Pinto, Changan's general manager marketing & product.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We search for a practical run around for a 19-year-old. We find the ideal MPV for a growing family and we examine price differences between OEM and aftermarket car parts.

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We kick off the season with sending to George to the Old Car Show. And we kick off our Garage Gold Concourse competition with a Morgan Roadster and a Jaguar XK120.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: We make our way to the East London Grand Prix Circuit for a race of a different kind. Streamline media showcases a highly tuned Toyota 86. Sbu chats to a local spinning star and Leon puts a Chevrolet Camaro restomod through its paces.

programme.title: MOTORVISION.TV #SPOTTED
programme.desc: Frank Slopianka, a US car dealer from Berlin, takes about eleven seconds to finish the quarter mile race at the drag racing event Race@Airport with his 700-hp Camaro. And: the tuning company Mansory promises even more power for Lamborghini cars.

programme.title: MOTORVISION.TV #SPOTTED
programme.desc: The Nürburgring is the most dangerous, yet the most beautiful race track in the world and meeting point for racing icons and car rarities. The annual Sport1 Track Day lures thousands of petrol heads to the iconic track.

programme.title: MOTORVISION.TV #SPOTTED
programme.desc: Ola Stenegard, Head of Vehicle Design at BMW Motorrad, meets world-famous motorcycle customizers in Los Angeles. Also: we present the craziest 'homemade supercars' such as the Fahrradi Farfalla FFX, the slowest sports car in the world.

programme.title: Lancia Stratos HF
programme.desc: The Lancia Stratos with Ferrari power, the rally icon of the 1970s.

programme.title: BMW M6 Gran Coupe
programme.desc: The M6 Gran Coupe is the latest creation from BMW's M-works subdivision. The Bavarians show that driving this V8 powered car almost feels like flying, even with the whole family on board.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: Zee finds out if the Land Rover Discovery is still the king of the hill. Jetour’s T1 and T2 SUVs make their South African debut and Zee meets Chelsy Pinto, Changan's general manager marketing & product.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We search for a practical run around for a 19-year-old. We find the ideal MPV for a growing family and we examine price differences between OEM and aftermarket car parts.

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We kick off the season with sending to George to the Old Car Show. And we kick off our Garage Gold Concourse competition with a Morgan Roadster and a Jaguar XK120.

programme.desc: We make our way to the East London Grand Prix Circuit for a race of a different kind. Streamline media showcases a highly tuned Toyota 86. Sbu chats to a local spinning star and Leon puts a Chevrolet Camaro restomod through its paces.
