programme.title: Business Issues
programme.desc: Sonia and Lou deal with a terrible boss and his instigating employees.

programme.title: Wrench in the Works
programme.desc: A wrench is thrown in the works, and at the car, when Froy and Matt try to repo from a plumber.

programme.title: Hidden Cars and Higher Powers
programme.desc: Matt and Froy get some help from a friendly gardener that lead them to discover a car hidden in the backyard.

programme.title: Rolling Away
programme.desc: Lou, Sonia, and Froy have to push away a debtor while trying to push a classic car up a hill.

programme.title: Matt's Back
programme.desc: Froy & Mike repo at paintball range. Matt intervenes. Sonia & Froy repo sedan. Matt & Lou take risky job.

programme.title: Burgers, Bottles, and Hustlers
programme.desc: Lou & Sonia repo from gangsta gals. Matt & Froy dispute with burger-slinger. Sonia & Froy face hustler & crew.

programme.title: Strapped on the Court
programme.desc: Matt & Froy encounter armed players. Lou & Sonia crash reunion. Lou & Lyndah face unexpected van owners.

programme.title: Role-players and Blade Swayers
programme.desc: Lou, Matt, & Froy face owner with blade. Matt & Froy reclaim Prius from role-players.

programme.title: Caught with Their Pants Down
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy's repo turns bizarre with strangers. Lou, Lyndah face indecent ranchers; chaos at pool hall.

programme.title: Honor Rolling Away
programme.desc: Sonia & Lyndah confront student. Matt & Sonia face armed thugs. Lou & Sonia repo Escalade from couple.

programme.title: Tazed and Amazed
programme.desc: Matt & Froy call cops for old-timer. Lou & Froy clash with bowler. Froy & Lyndah deal with Altima owner.

programme.title: Intoxicated Marina Idiots
programme.desc: Lou & Sonia pursue Porsche & Audi. Matt & Froy recover truck. Matt & Lou seize BMW from rich couple.

programme.title: Playing the Role
programme.desc: Lou devises a plan to have Froy and Sonia pose as house buyers.

programme.title: Broken Bones and Broken Phones
programme.desc: Froy, Lou & Matt face bodybuilders for Jeep. Lou & Lyndah startle broker. Froy learns text lesson from Sonia.

programme.title: The Hearse Isn't Empty?
programme.desc: Matt & Lou handle accountant & son. Sonia & Froy manage pool party. They chase a hearse.

programme.title: Froy Gets Beat Up
programme.desc: Sonia & Lou encounter economy impact. Matt & Sonia deal with spoiled princess and unpaid bill on Jetta.

programme.title: This Is No Fantasy
programme.desc: Froy & Lyndah handle bride. Matt intervenes with players. Sonia, Lyndah, Froy, & Lou tackle flaming car.

programme.title: The Missing RV and the Private Jet
programme.desc: Lou, Sonia, and Froy find an RV missing for 30 years, now used by young Canadian rock stars.

programme.title: Pyramid Scams and Princesses
programme.desc: Lou, Sonia, and Matt face tough truckers; Lyndah and Lou expose a scam; the team confronts a club princess.

programme.title: Jet Skis and Massages
programme.desc: The team repos jet skis at the beach, confronts a skilled masseuse, and unknowingly pulls a costly prank.

programme.title: Get That Prowler
programme.desc: Lou, Sonia, and Froy repo a taxicab with a drunk client, while Matt and Froy repo a stuck-in-the-80s DeLorean.

programme.title: Up Up and Away
programme.desc: Lou, Froy, and Matt tackle two hot air balloons, repo a sports car, and handle graffiti girls with Frankie.

programme.title: Family Drama
programme.desc: Lou, Froy, and Matt team up with Eva, an alluring agent, to repo a limousine in an elaborate sting operation.

programme.title: Kegger and Refrigerator
programme.desc: Repo tension escalates; kegger chaos ensues; explosive surprise shocks.

programme.title: Going Green and Falling Down
programme.desc: Sonia, Froy repo biodiesel car, owner resembles Sonia.

programme.title: Look What You Did!
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy face angry debtors; Lou and Matt tangle with a taser-wielding P.I.; Frankie jeopardizes Matt.

programme.title: That's Disrespectful
programme.desc: Sonia, Lyndah weigh options: reclaim burnt car or give up?

programme.title: Smoke, Lead, and Alcohol
programme.desc: Matt, Froy face peril in dangerous hood as debtor defends ride.

programme.title: Missed Dates
programme.desc: Lyndah handles sobbing debtor; Matt, Froy face car and flirty ex; team confronts cultists.

programme.title: Matt Vs. Giant Chicken
programme.desc: Matt repos Vespa & Yaris, confronts insolvent dealership, unsure about Lou.

programme.title: Broken Tooth Lou and Bad Breath Frankie
programme.desc: Froy, Lyndah deal with dentist; Frankie's repo mishap jeopardizes; Lou faces wrecked Camry with Froy trapped.

programme.title: Segway This Way
programme.desc: Matt, Sonia vs. surfer; Froy, Matt handle Segway renter; Lou, Lyndah, Froy confront gangster at party.

programme.title: The Canals of Deceit
programme.desc: Sonia, Froy get canoe; Lyndah, Sonia aid widow; Lou, Matt clash with soccer players for Camaro.

programme.title: Captain Lou
programme.desc: Lyndah, Matt dispute Jeep; Froy, Sonia manage debtor; Lou, Sonia, Froy face captain, Coast Guard.

programme.title: Native Operation
programme.desc: Matt, Lou repo BMW at club; Sonia, Matt deal with biker; Matt, Froy face debtor, tribal police on reservation.

programme.title: Should Have Seen This Coming
programme.desc: Lou, Sonia, Froy sting taxi repo, deal with drunk passenger.

programme.title: Vampires and Drunks
programme.desc: Froy, Sonia clash with wife; Matt, Sonia repo at vampire party; Matt, Froy confront drunken relatives.

programme.title: I Don't Know What That Is
programme.desc: Matt, Froy grab ATV; Matt, Lou handle frat prank; Lou, Lyndah, Sonia repo Corolla from mom-to-be.

programme.title: Incompetent and Unfaithful
programme.desc: Matt, Froy vs. guards; Lou, Sonia confront team; Froy, Sonia in love triangle.

programme.title: Don't Cry, Bro
programme.desc: Matt, Froy confront polygamist cult over Prius.

programme.title: Don't Spray Me with That
programme.desc: Sonia, Froy repo bike; Froy, Sonia vs. receptionist; Froy, Matt deal with exterminator.

programme.title: There Was an Accident
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy head to a supermarket to repossess a Mitsubishi from a truant bagboy.

programme.title: Yoga-to Be Kidding Me
programme.desc: Matt and Froy head into a nice part of town to repossess a BMW from an entitled yuppie.

programme.title: Go Kart Them Away
programme.desc: Matt and Froy repossess a car from a cheating husband who's shacked up at a nearby motel.

programme.title: Repo, the Final Frontier
programme.desc: Froy and Sonia trace an out-of-state skip account to a seedy motel.

programme.title: Coffee-slinging Waitress
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy storm a studio to repossess a Corvette from a surly European photographer.

programme.title: Matt Vs. Sonia
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy respond to a tip from an informant and wind up in the middle of an epic story of intrigue.

programme.title: It's Not Funny
programme.desc: Matt and Froy interrupt a comedian's preparations for a show to repossess his Dodge.

programme.title: A Zamboni?
programme.desc: Matt and Froy interrupt a debtor's tattooing session to reclaim his vehicle.

programme.title: Instruction and Destruction
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy repossess an experimental concept motorcycle from a hose-wielding yuppie.

programme.title: Angry Swarms
programme.desc: Matt, Lou, and Lyndah try to repo a car from a man who is not afraid to throw some punches.

programme.title: We Have to Dispose of It
programme.desc: Sonia and Matt hunt down a truck that's being used by a pool cleaner to engage in some illicit activities.

programme.title: Smart and Stupids
programme.desc: Lou and Froy repo a vehicle in a bad part of town and somebody gets punched in the face.

programme.title: Repo Basher vs. Matt
programme.desc: Matt, Froy, and Lou get a tip on a car whose owner has a boyfriend known for taking his fists to repossessors.

programme.title: Tactical Planning
programme.desc: Matt and Froy walk into a moral gray area when they repossess a vehicle by stealing it.

programme.title: Four Wheel Surprise
programme.desc: Lou and Matt confront a big-time player and his bodyguards at a Brazilian restaurant.

programme.title: Breakdowns and Beatdowns
programme.desc: Matt and Froy face gang bangers, a teacher's brawl, and a tow truck breakdown.

programme.title: You Again?
programme.desc: Sonia and Lou face an angry doctor, a furious athlete, and a minister's van repo with unexpected trouble.

programme.title: Scavenger Hunt
programme.desc: Lou and Froy prank bikers, Sonia and Matt repo a tanning bed, and a sting on a shady tow driver takes a twist.

programme.title: The Dune Buggy
programme.desc: Lou and Froy face snobby diners, Lyndah and Froy repo a van from thieves, and Matt nabs a rare dune buggy.

programme.title: High and Low Spirits
programme.desc: Lou and Sonia face a wild love triangle, Sonia repos a designer's van.

programme.title: Repo Outside the Box
programme.desc: Matt and Sonia face violent cooks, Froy repos a model's van, and a street gang outmatches the team.

programme.title: Horse Semen & the Rolls Royce Golf Cart
programme.desc: Froy, Sonia repossess truck; handle flower dispute; reclaim Rolls Royce golf cart.

programme.title: Involuntary Voluntary
programme.desc: Lou and Matt expose a cheating husband's scheme, repossess a drunk debtor's car, and confront an armed driver.

programme.title: Froy's Bait and Lou's Cake
programme.desc: Lou & Froy bait a debtor, face pepper spray, crash a wedding for a DJ's car, & confront bikers.

programme.title: Blow-Up and Cool Down
programme.desc: Lou & Lyndah repo a mower, Sonia & Matt face heat & elderly debtors, & a shocking secret is found in a car.

programme.title: The Car That Rolled Away
programme.desc: Lou & Lyndah face drunk outdoorsmen, Froy & Lyndah repo a bad guitarist, and Froy & Sonia confront an ex-NFL.

programme.title: Naked and Dangerous
programme.desc: Sonia & Lyndah repo a hot tub, Lou & Matt face angry paraders, and Lou & Lyndah take a car from old men.

programme.title: Hooligans and Explosions
programme.desc: A pan-wielding housewife fights Lou & Sonia, while Matt & Froy’s repo of a contraband-filled truck goes wrong.

programme.title: Reading, Painting, and Physical Education
programme.desc: Froy & Sonia repo a Corvette, Matt & Froy face feuding brothers, & Lou & Matt take a bus from a baseball team

programme.title: Heavy Hitters
programme.desc: Lou, Matt & Froy retry a bus repo & take a crane, while Sonia & Froy are chased by bikers to the office.

programme.title: Ruffians and Wrestlers
programme.desc: Sonia & Matt face skaters, Froy & Sonia repo from a volatile couple, & Lou & Froy take on backyard wrestlers.

programme.title: Everybody Just a Child?
programme.desc: First, Matt and Froy get the worst service ever from a street-side coffee vendor who won't give up his truck.

programme.title: Off the Hitch
programme.desc: In this very special episode of Operation Repo, it's the 36 hours that change everything.

programme.title: Matt & Froy Auto Recovery
programme.desc: First, Lou and Sonia make their way to a home in the hills to clean a germaphobe of his car.

programme.title: Win Some, Quarrelsome, Lose Some
programme.desc: First, Lou and Sonia have an order for a Jaguar behind a retail outlet center.

programme.title: We Weren't Informed
programme.desc: Matt and Froy end up on one of the weirdest repo's they've ever encountered.

programme.title: Tijuana Surprise
programme.desc: Matt and Froy's business hits another snag when a gang of bat-wielding partiers keeps them away.

programme.title: Lyndah's Revenge
programme.desc: Matt and Froy continue their risky run in Tijuana, confronting a strip club owner who keeps a tight grip.

programme.title: El Prisionero
programme.desc: Lou and his cousin Rob face trouble on the job when a debtor makes shocking claims to police.

programme.title: The Final Showdown
programme.desc: After Froy bails him out from a Tijuana prison, Matt is on the warpath, and somebody needs to pay.

programme.title: What the Truck?!?
programme.desc: Lou, Matt, Sonia, Froy, and Lyndah are back together and better than ever.

programme.title: Contact
programme.desc: After reclaiming their stolen truck, the repo team struggles to keep their fragile alliance intact.

programme.title: The Crush
programme.desc: Lou faces his toughest loss, repossessing a truck, a tricked-out bus, and tracking a debtor to a junkyard.

programme.title: Daddy's Little Girl
programme.desc: With their truck gone, the team fights on—repossessing a van, facing a wild baker.

programme.title: The Junior Partner
programme.desc: With Matt onboard, the team repos a rich kid’s ride, an "Uncle Sam" vehicle, and battles rowdy rugby players.

programme.title: Hard Turns Ahead
programme.desc: Take a look inside the fast-paced, high pressure world of car repossession with highly trained professionals.

programme.title: Minutes of Fame
programme.desc: The confusion over Lou's new business relationship with Matt continues to mount.

programme.title: The Mindsetters - Guest Lipstick Ladies Part 2
programme.desc: Coach Lorraine Lindsey talks to reoccurring guest the Lipstick Ladies Carmen Smith and Sharlene Ruiz about their personal insecurities

programme.title: Mindsetters - Interview with Devon Pearson
programme.desc: Lifecoach and Host Lorraine Lindsey has a candid conversation with her adult son about growing up with a teenage mother

programme.title: The Mindsetters - Guests Vito Papariello and Rodney Allgood
programme.desc: Its is time for the gentlemen to chime in and give their perspective on Love vs Lust.

programme.title: HealthDay - Which Diet Trends are Most Effective?
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll be breaking down several popular diets and eating routines and looking at the different effects they can have on your body.

programme.title: HealthDay - Supporting Kids and Teens
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll be looking at some of the top health and wellness issues affecting children and adolescents in 2022, including diabetes, long COVID, and mental health.

programme.title: HealthDay - Secrets to Good Sleep
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with health experts about the importance of sleep, sharing different techniques and tips that can improve your sleep schedule and help you to wake up each morning feeling rested and refreshed.

programme.title: HealthDay - Mental Health and Depression
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with a group of nurses about their experiences dealing with increased workplace violence and harassment during the COVID-19 pandemic. We’ll also go over the effects of COVID-19 and irregular sleep patterns on depression in children and adults.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 17 Practice Dolphin
programme.desc: For day 17 Kino wants to help you find the playful spirit in your heart, even as you commit to practice.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 18 Awakening Anjaneyasana
programme.desc: In today’s lesson we will use the crescent lunge to awaken the energy at the core of your being.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 19 Wisdom Side Plank
programme.desc: For day 19 we will use side plank as the vehicle of awareness that might help us glimpse the truth of any given moment.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 20 Equanimity Lolasana
programme.desc: Lolasana is a challenging position that offers a unique opportunity to experience balance and equanimity in both the body and mind.

programme.title: The Aware Show - The Aware Show - Human Powered Health
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Laura Kunces and Cory Greenberg on the topic of Human Powered Health

programme.title: The Aware Show - The Aware Show: Robert Thurman - Wisdom is Bliss
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Professor Robert Thurman, the preeminent scholar and interpreter of Tibetan Buddhist philosophy for the modern world, who believes that Wisdom is Bliss and in fact, that’s the name of his latest book. Thurman is a very close friend of HH Dalai Lama and today he discusses deep ideas about mindfulness and presence and leads us on a joyful exploration into the nature of reality through Buddha’s threefold curriculum.

programme.title: The Aware Show - The Aware Show - Power of Healing
programme.desc: Join Lisa Garr as she speaks with millennial Author, Speaker, & Inspirational Entertainer Justin Michael Williams about the true power of healing. Justin discusses creating a future of inclusion and diversity while using music and meditation to spread his message of waking up the world! Info: justinmichaelwilliams.com.

programme.title: When Sparks Ignite
programme.desc: A film about the challenges we face that then become that match point that ignites something within us that becomes our gift to the world.

programme.title: Fund Tank - Fund Tank - IKW Solutions
programme.desc: Matthew Aarsvold, the owner and president of IKW Solutions, takes center stage, seeking $1,000,000 to elevate his innovative software, Constantly Current. This cutting-edge prototype promises to transform Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems by ensuring they remain updated seamlessly, offering potential time and cost savings for businesses.

programme.title: The Principle
programme.desc: A wise master is called upon to heal a painfully misguided cyberbully and his tragic victim

programme.title: Admissions
programme.desc: Admissions tells a transformational tale about what it takes to find lasting peace.

programme.title: ALCOHOL - THE MAGIC POTION
programme.desc: Alcohol is the world’s most powerful drug. Four billion people drink it regularly and the number is rising. Of the world’s 30 countries with the highest per capita alcohol consumption, no fewer than 26 are in Europe. Big business with 3 million victims each year. But who profits from all this?

programme.title: Fund Tank - Fund Tank - Peak Custom Construction
programme.desc: Dan Notartomaso seeks $650,000 in funding for his companies, Peak Custom Construction and Oak and Iron Design Co. As Dan unveils his unique niche in high-end home remodels catering to professional athletes, the panel of experts delve into his ambitious plans and financial challenges. With rapid growth during the pandemic, Dan grapples with cash flow issues and the need for strategic investment.

programme.title: Fund Tank - Fund Tank - Teach Your Heart Out
programme.desc: Mother-daughter duo Tosha Wright and Lisa Dunnigan from Teach Your Heart Out seek $600,000 in funding to propel their educational conference business to new heights. With a mission to rejuvenate and empower educators nationwide, they share their inspiring journey and ambitious plans with the panel of experts. Despite facing challenges such as the impact of COVID-19 on educational conferences and the need for strategic expansion, Tosha and Lisa impress with their passion and dedication to their cause.

programme.title: The Wright Turn - The Wright Turn: La Dolce Vita
programme.desc: La Dolce Vita (Sweet Life) - Ten years after the divorce from Maxwell Turner, with children grown, Celeste Wright Turner makes a choice to start living her life. No SEX with the EX! Simon and Mimi try to get Celeste’s head on straight when it comes to Maxwell’s charm. After facing an emotional challenge, Celeste decides to take a trip abroad.

programme.title: The Wright Turn - The Wright Turn: London Bridges Burning Down
programme.desc: London Bridges Burning Down - Breakdowns are inevitable when Celeste tries to run from her past. Her therapist gives Celeste sound advice on how to spice up her sex life.

programme.title: The Wright Turn - The Wright Turn: Butter Me Up
programme.desc: Butter Me Up - Celeste returns back to Los Angeles after her journey. Her friends throw her a sex toy birthday party. When an old flame comes back, can he melt her butter? Nikki reveals a trauma from her childhood.

programme.title: The Wright Turn - The Wright Turn: The Pearl Necklace
programme.desc: Pearl Necklace - Can a long-desired gift bring Max and Celeste closer together? While Father Cross’s guilty pleasure is exposed, leaving a young family member seeking revenge and Celeste on his trail. A Fundraiser brings Maddy back to the stage with new comic material on the stage of Denim & Diamonds fundraiser for Autism Care Today.

programme.title: Sex Talk - Sex Talk - How Often Do Men Think About Sex?
programme.desc: How often do men really think about sex? Plus, we talk about ways to maintain intimacy when you're both the caretaker and the lover.

programme.title: Sex Talk - Sex Talk - Fake Orgasms: Bad for Women & Men
programme.desc: Alcohol may help get you in the mood but how does it affect your sex life? And do men fake orgasms? All this and more on Sex Talk with Dr. Lia.

programme.title: The Mindsetters - Guests Ashley Nichols and Meghan Buckley
programme.desc: Guest Ashley Nichols and Coach Meghan Buckley discuss with host Coach Lorraine Lindsey and Co Host Carmen Smith Relationship Patterns

programme.title: The Mindsetters - Guest Jeremy Lewis
programme.desc: Realtor and Social Media Influencer Jeremy Lewis discusses how he used social media to make his come back in Real Estate after losing everthing

programme.title: The Mindsetters - Guest Maria Baez
programme.desc: Actress and Model Maria Baez shares how a violent attack lead her to creating her own beauty line to help accident and burn victims

programme.title: The Mindsetters - Guest Rueben DeSilva and Rodney Allgood Part 3
programme.desc: Coach Lorraine Lindsey invites the men to join her talk on insecurities. What are men really insecure about?

programme.title: The Rising Man Podcast - Why Clear Standards Spark Creation with Christine Hassler & Jeddy Azuma
programme.desc: Author, coach, and podcaster Christine Hassler shares how incredibly clear and detailed standards help you manifest partnership. We also cover why the universe rewards risk takers, how to create safety with women, and what qualities women crave most.

programme.title: HealthDay - Improving Heart Health
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with the chair of last year’s American Heart Association Scientific Sessions on new diet guidelines and programs to combat health inequity. We’ll also share tips on improving your heart health and identifying potential symptoms of heart damage and disease.

programme.title: HealthDay - Health Tips for Seniors
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with several experts on the often stigmatized topic of sexual intimacy among older adults. We’ll also share information on how seniors can slow the spread of Parkinson’s disease, deal with symptoms of menopause, and reduce their risk of Alzheimer’s.

programme.title: HealthDay - Health and the Environment
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll cover common public health issues caused by smog, pollen, and other environmental hazards. We’ll also discuss how to avoid Lyme disease, West Nile virus, and sinusitis.

programme.title: HealthDay - Fighting Health Inequity
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll speak with experts on how the lack of accessibility to basic healthcare has affected people around the country, as well as what steps can be taken to ensure greater health equity.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 21 Unity Pigeon
programme.desc: For day 21 of our challenge we will explore this concept through the restorative Pigeon Pose.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 22 Energy Bakasana
programme.desc: Today's posture is Bakasana, a powerful arm balance that will help you find that energy in the arms, the core and the entire body.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 23 Love Gomukhasana
programme.desc: Day 23 is all about love. Start practice by tuning into breath and body, bringing a special attention to the heartspace. Take a moment for feeling into the vibration of the heart, welcoming a feeling of receptivity. Warm yourself up as Kino brings extra attention to opening the chest and front body. Next we segue into finding and loving your particular expression of Gomukhasana, the cow facing posture. Remember that the cow is a sacred symbol of giving and love as you feel into the postures heart opening effects.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series - Yoga Is - Day 24 Sanctuary/Refuge Ustrasana
programme.desc: Today’s lesson is about sanctuary and how to find a place of calm and peace deep within yourself.

programme.title: The Aware Show - The Aware Show - Dr. Lisa Miller
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Dr. Lisa Miller.

programme.title: The Aware Show - The Aware Show: Dr Harley Rotbart - No Regrets Parenting
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Dr. Harley Rotbart, a nationally renowned infectious diseases specialist, pediatrician, parenting expert, speaker, and educator who discusses his latest book No Regrets Parenting: Turning Long Days and Short Years into Cherished Moments with Your Kids. He shares special keys for parents to guide children to live a life of wonder and contentment by conscious parenting.

programme.title: The Aware Show - The Aware Show - Finding Harmony When Overwhelmed
programme.desc: Feeling overwhelmed? Host Lisa Garr talks with author and women’s empowerment expert Christine Arylo. Finding balance may be challenging, but we can always strive for harmony and flow. Arylo discusses setting boundaries and allowing ourselves space to breathe by finding ways in which we can receive support. Info: christinearylo.com.

programme.title: Unsupersize Me
programme.desc: Unsupersize Me documents the inspiring story of personal trainer Juan-Carlos Asse and his quest to prove that a whole foods, plant based diet coupled with an exercise regimen is capable of remarkably improving the health of any and every individual.

programme.title: BREAD. AN EVERYDAY MIRACLE
programme.desc: Bread is a branded product with an endless number of varieties and providers. But do we actually know what we eat every day? We meet small craft bakers who stand up for their quality and we meet CEOs who work on bread as an industrial mass product which becomes increasingly artificial. How can traditional bakery skills survive? And how will the future of bread look like?

programme.title: Get Your Yoga On - Practice Downward Facing Dog
programme.desc: Dive into the fundamentals of yoga with this sequence that builds up to downward facing dog.

programme.title: Get Your Yoga On Series - Practice Plank
programme.desc: Join Kino for a short, gentle practice that is centered around core engagement and the plank pose

programme.title: Yoga For All - Yoga For All Day 1: Notice
programme.desc: Your Day 1 practice offers an invitation to slow down and take stock.

programme.title: Yoga For All - Day 10: Balance
programme.desc: Your day 10 practice starts with a standing warm up and eases into a yoga flow for balance and transformation! Bring calm alertness to the mind and body as you continue to ride the wave of the breath. Build a strong foundation to set yourself up for greatness. Be patient and courageous.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Twist What You Missed
programme.desc: This vinyasa class transforms the lessons from Day 6 into a series of playful asana. You’ll begin by establishing your base, then focus on twisting variations in Chair Pose (Utkatasana) and Wide-Legged Forward Fold (Prasarita Padottanasana), with a peak in Revolved Half Moon (Parivrtta Ardha Chandrasana).

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Day 8: Rhythm
programme.desc: Your day 8 practice invites you to get in tune with your natural rhythm and make it your own.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: This is Your Spine on Yoga
programme.desc: Apply everything you've learned so far in this well-rounded sequence of twists, folds, and heart openers. Some points to remember: Lengthen the spine out of the pelvis before back bending, focus your twists toward the thoracic spine (the middle twelve vertebrae—not your neck or lower back), and discover the essence of a back bend in every forward fold.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 6: Hack Your Hormones
programme.desc: Regulating your blood sugar is one of the most important things you can do to hack your hormones. Having a balanced blood sugar is not only foundational to hormones, but it’s also critical to our neurotransmitters, the chemicals in your brain that produce the feelings of happiness, sadness, or make us feel energized. If your blood sugar is all over the place, you might not be making the right amounts of serotonin and GABA to keep you feeling happy, chilled out, and calm.

programme.title: Gut Health with Dr. Mary Pardee - Day 10: Test, Don't Guess
programme.desc: For day 10 we learn about the different kinds of tests that give us insight to one's gut symptoms. Knowledge is power!

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Overcoming Overwhelm
programme.desc: Today we learn the first step to dealing with overwhelm - settling firm boundaries.

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Stress
programme.desc: Today’s course walks you through best practices, habits, and mindsets for dealing with stress. Examine your life and identify your stress points, using Brendon’s techniques to release your tension and get back to showing up like you want. Together we’ll prepare for the eventuality of stress by adjusting our relationship with it.

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Cultivating Joy
programme.desc: We experience two types of joy. One is momentary, when something funny happens or a nice word is said in passing and we laugh or smile - for a bit, we’re filled with joy. The other is long term and lasting, sustained by gratitude and a life of meaning and purpose. If we’re waiting on joy to enter our life, we’re not living as connected or congruent as we could be.

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Physiology vs Psychology
programme.desc: Today’s session will focus on the different ways we can care for our body, from better sleep hygiene to eating for sustained well-being. Explore how feeling better can lead you to doing more, and feeling better while doing it.

programme.title: Commune Meditation Summit - CMS - Kimberly Snyder
programme.desc: Today, you will learn how to tap into your unwavering inner knowing, which is also and often called your intuition. Kimberly Synder shares why being connected to your inner source of beauty is so important.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 9: Detoxification
programme.desc: Today we’ll address the ways different metabolic and environmental toxins make their way into your system and how your body eliminates them. We’ll learn to look for excess buildup of these toxins and how to boost your own ability to process them.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 8: Metabolism and Mitochondria
programme.desc: What if I told you there was a reason you feel tired, achy, and foggy all the time? And what if I told you the solution was healing your body on the cellular level?

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Fat is Your Friend
programme.desc: Don’t demonize fat. It’s actually your friend! Today, you will learn the importance of the quality of the fat you’re consuming, how to select the right kind of monounsaturated fats that nourish your brain, and why it’s important to choose the right cooking oils.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Mindfulness Practices for Mealtime
programme.desc: We’ve all heard about the importance of being present—but how does that translate to meal time? Today is all about how to practice presence at every meal by feasting with your other senses first, and how to recognize how food actually makes you feel.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Energize Your Morning
programme.desc: Well, the secret is about to be out... today you’ll learn all about the real breakfast of champions! Jason talks about the power of intermittent fasting, how to use breathwork techniques and lymphatic pounding to wake up your body, everyday energy-boosting foods to add to your breakfasts.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Optimize Your Sleep
programme.desc: Do you have trouble sleeping—or just want to enjoy a deeper, more rejuvenating sleep? Today, Jason talks about how to wind down from a stressful day, the foods and nutrients that improve relaxation and sleep, and his supplemental practices and biohacks for sleep hygiene.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Hormones and Hanger
programme.desc: Today is all about feeling hangry, when you get so hungry, you actually get angry! Jason shares the hormones that affect hanger and how you can be mindful of controlling them. We’ll discuss the importance of proper hydration, blood sugar levels, starvation diets, and weight loss.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 9: Detoxification
programme.desc: Today we’ll address the ways different metabolic and environmental toxins make their way into your system and how your body eliminates them. We’ll learn to look for excess buildup of these toxins and how to boost your own ability to process them.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 8: Metabolism and Mitochondria
programme.desc: What if I told you there was a reason you feel tired, achy, and foggy all the time? And what if I told you the solution was healing your body on the cellular level?

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: The Innocence in Everyone
programme.desc: To truly grasp the concept of forgiveness, we have to be willing to see past the person's mistakes. The benefit we get from being more forgiving isn't that other people are going to be more forgiving towards us, it's that it won't affect us when they aren't.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: Special and Holy Relationships
programme.desc: In this lesson, we'll discover the significance of holy relationships. After all, souls are brought together for the purpose of enlightenment.

programme.title: Spiritual Makeover with Marianne Williamson - Spiritual Makeover - Part 1
programme.desc: This is not a religious course; rather, it’s a universal system based on love. You think you have many different problems, but you have only one — the illusion of your separation from God, the true nature of reality. We get trapped in illusions (and create our own suffering) when we over-identify with a particular problem or stay stuck in fear-based thinking. This program is here to remind you of a key universal principle: Only love is real.

programme.title: The Superpowers of Your Gut - The Superpowers of Your Gut - Day 5
programme.desc: The geometry of the pancreas is exquisite. The real work of nutrient availability begins with the elegant coordination of liver, gallbladder, pancreas, and small intestines.

programme.title: The Superpowers of Your Gut - The Superpowers of Your Gut - Day 4
programme.desc: In terms of its surface area and musculature, the stomach is designed to listen to your food. What is your stomach listening to? It�s listening to how your food was grown, lived, and died. It�s picking up on the microRNA that was in your food right at the moment you consumed it.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: The Innocence in Everyone

programme.desc: What is real? How do we know it's real, and how does that deeper understanding of reality help us fulfill our dreams, desires, and intentions? So let's go for it.

programme.title: Spiritual Makeover with Marianne Williamson - Spiritual Makeover - Part 1
programme.desc: This is not a religious course; rather, it’s a universal system based on love. You think you have many different problems, but you have only one — the illusion of your separation from God, the true nature of reality. We get trapped in illusions (and create our own suffering) when we over-identify with a particular problem or stay stuck in fear-based thinking. programme.title: Spiritual Makeover with Marianne Williamson - Spiritual Makeover - Part 2
programme.desc: It’s time to stand in your power and stop buying into the belief that you are wounded beyond repair. God already created the perfect you, and it's an undeletable file.

programme.title: Spiritual Makeover with Marianne Williamson - Spiritual Makeover - Part 4
programme.desc: The ego asks, ‘Who are you to dream big?’ Spirit is ready to show you the answer when you are ready to see all that is possible.

programme.title: A Strong & Stable Spine - Check Your Neck, Volume 1
programme.desc: This class primarily focuses on increasing the flexibility and suppleness of your cervical spine (the top 7 vertebrae, otherwise known as your neck). We tend to neglect the neck when we practice/train. It has the tendency to be stiff and weak. So, before we practice some strength building mobility work in the next class, let's stretch it out and create some more space in the areas that tend to hold tension. Get your strap out and get ready for some yummy, feel-good stretches that lengthen the tissues of your neck in 360 degrees.

programme.title: A Strong & Stable Spine - Check Your Neck, Volume 2
programme.desc: Now that we've stretched out our necks and created some space in this area, let's add some mobility work to the mix. Most of us tend to focus on strengthening bigger muscles and more obvious joints like our shoulders and hips, and our neck tends to get left out and neglected. This class is all about strengthening the neck in 360 degrees.

programme.title: A Strong & Stable Spine - Boulder Shoulders
programme.desc: The shoulders are the seat of the neck. They influence the way it moves and positions itself in space. When we strengthen and stabilize the shoulders we free up room for better mechanics in the neck. This class will take you on a journey in all the directions the shoulder can mobilize. Let's go.

programme.title: A Strong & Stable Spine - Flexion Section (Abdominals)
programme.desc: A strong stable core is truly the foundation for proper movement mechanics. Most of us are stuck in spinal extension. Our ribs flare out and our lower back is overly compressed. We need to learn how to access our abdominal muscles through articulating our spine into flexion. Here's a class that will toughen up your abdominal muscles, and teach you how to flex and segment your spine efficiently.

programme.title: Break Out of the Addiction Frequency - Section 1: The Addiction Frequency & The Power of Breath
programme.desc: Breathing is the single most important thing we do. Addiction is characterized by a sense of lack, of missing something. And when you breathe poorly, like when anxious or angry, you’re caught up in your head and aren’t breathing well and that sends a signal to your body that perpetuates the addiction frequency. Deep, long breathing is how we interrupt this pattern.

programme.title: Yoga For All - Day 2: Befriend
programme.desc: Your Day 2 session invites you to use the tools of the at-home yoga practice to befriend your body and your breath. Build on the art of noticing from Day 1 as we expand our vocabulary with a focus on a strong foundation. This session encourages a healthy flow of energy up and down the spine and lovingly guides you to learn how to take responsibility for your experience on the mat.

programme.title: Yoga For All - Day 3: Align
programme.desc: Your day 3 practice invites you to get to know your body through the structure of the practice and the art of aligning. We build on day 1 and 2 with a focus on action and alignment through asana and energy.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 8: Metabolism and Mitochondria
programme.desc: What if I told you there was a reason you feel tired, achy, and foggy all the time? And what if I told you the solution was healing your body on the cellular level?

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 1: Hormones 101
programme.desc: Your hormones work like a symphony. When every instrument is in tune, they play harmoniously. However, if one instrument is out of tune, or one hormone is out of balance, the entire piece is thrown off. Together, we'll decode your symptoms and work with your body to create hormonal balance. This means clear skin, easier periods, less hot flashes, better sex, and more restful sleep. Yes, it can be that good when your hormones are in check.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 2: Adrenal Glands
programme.desc: This sentence sums it up: The adrenal glands are the foundation of hormone balancing. If your adrenals aren't functioning at full capacity, you'll feel it. In today's lesson, we take a deep dive into the hormones that our adrenal glands produce. We'll start to get an idea of why taking care of and keeping these glands happy is so important.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 5: Estrogen
programme.desc: You can thank estrogen for keeping your lips full and plump and your body curvy. Today, we take a deep dive into the importance of estrogen, how it impacts our body, and the effects of having too much or too little can have on your health. You'll also learn ways to support your body's estrogen production, such as seed cycling, bioidentical hormone replacement therapy, and even by having more orgasms.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 3: The Thyroid
programme.desc: How common are thyroid conditions? Women are 5 to 8 times more likely than a man to develop thyroid disease. If your thyroid isn't functioning optimally, every single cell in your body will feel it, including your ovaries. A thyroid function that is too high or too low can lead to symptoms that include low heart rate, fatigue, weight loss, and menstrual irregularities.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 4: Progesterone
programme.desc: When it comes to having a calm, chilled-out mindset or the sweet feelings of love, you can thank progesterone. On the flip side, suboptimal levels of this hormone can cause you to have headaches, breast tenderness, inability to fall asleep, and painful or heavy periods. Together, we'll learn what you can do to get your body producing the right amount of progesterone. Because this hormone is everything when it comes to feeling at peace.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 9: Detoxification
programme.desc: Did you know that 80,000 toxic chemicals have been released into the environment since the Industrial Revolution? What's worse is that very few have been tested for their long-term impact on human health. Today's session is all about detoxification, the natural process that our liver, kidneys, lungs, lymphatic system, gut, and skin perform daily to get rid of metabolic byproducts that our body produces and toxins that are absorbed from the environment. You'll learn how to avoid toxins and how to address those that you already are carrying due to the nature of the environment, as well as how to optimize your body's ability to detoxify.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 5: Heart Health
programme.desc: Today we learn which tests you should be pursuing for a total view of your heart health and how to synthesize those results systemically.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 7: Hidden Inflammation and Disease
programme.desc: We’ve all experienced inflammation in some form. Today we address how to find this hidden symptom, identify it and its root causes, and stop it in its tracks. There is no optimal health with uncontrolled inflammation.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Fat is Your Friend
programme.desc: Don’t demonize fat. It’s actually your friend! Today, you will learn the importance of the quality of the fat you’re consuming, how to select the right kind of monounsaturated fats that nourish your brain, and why it’s important to choose the right cooking oils.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Mindfulness Practices for Mealtime
programme.desc: We’ve all heard about the importance of being present—but how does that translate to meal time? Today is all about how to practice presence at every meal by feasting with your other senses first, and how to recognize how food actually makes you feel.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Cheat Codes
programme.desc: There are certainly things that can add a plus to our A, but these aren’t replacements for eating better and moving more. Nothing in this lesson will come close to impacting your results like diet and exercise. Nonetheless, Jillian offers her thoughts on cold exposure, heat exposure, and supplements.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Way Beyond Willpower: Managing Relationships and Environments to Beat Temptation
programme.desc: Willpower is like a muscle: If you use it long enough without a break, it fatigues. It’s the moment at the Mexican restaurant when they go to drop the chips and you say, 'No thanks.' If the chips sit on that table, there is no chance you won’t end up eating the basket. So, let’s go over some basic techniques you need to program into your behavior and environment to safeguard yourself against momentary vulnerabilities. We also cover some serious boundary setting, so get ready.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Your Complete Weight-Loss Plan
programme.desc: A big goal (if you have one) can feel a bit intimidating or overwhelming. This episode is here to help remove any of those anxious feelings with something called a goal pyramid. This simple technique will help you know exactly what to do and when to make that vision a reality!

programme.title: A Strong & Stable Spine - 360 Degrees Hips
programme.desc: The hips are the seat of the lower back. If you have low back pain, you will benefit from strengthening and stabilizing the various articulations of the hips. This class will take you on a journey of the hip joint in 360 degrees. When the hips are strong they serve as a foundation for your entire spine. Your spine will move better, function better and feel better when it has the support and stability of the hips.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 5: Heart Health
programme.desc: Today we learn which tests you should be pursuing for a total view of your heart health and how to synthesize those results systemically.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 7: Hidden Inflammation and Disease
programme.desc: We’ve all experienced inflammation in some form. Today we address how to find this hidden symptom, identify it and its root causes, and stop it in its tracks. There is no optimal health with uncontrolled inflammation.

programme.title: The Work of Byron Katie - My Mother Terrifies Me
programme.desc: The way you recall a memory and the way it actually happened might be completely different. The question is, do you know which version feeds you? We can become so wrapped up in our recollections, we convince ourselves of these untruths. Is that person a monster? Were they wishing you harm? Or were they dealing with a difficult situation in the best way they knew how?

programme.title: The Work of Byron Katie - I Want to Be Famous
programme.desc: Stop focusing on the object of your desires and start focusing on the reason for desiring that object in the first place. When you turn it around, you may find that what you really want is completely different than what you’ve been telling yourself.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: How to Have Miraculous Relationships
programme.desc: A miracle happens when you stop thinking with fear and start thinking with love. Your greatest power lies in your mind. To establish stronger connections, you need to go into every situation requesting to be an instrument of love. When you approach your interactions with love, you'll begin to have more miraculous relationships.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: Overcoming the Ego Mind
programme.desc: In the following lesson, we'll discover how the ego mind influences both our way of thinking and our relationships. We'll also identify the unconscious barriers we've built that cause us to form these judgments and thoughts. That's where the problem is, and that's where the solution lies.

programme.title: Ecstatic Breathwork - Ecstatic Breathwork: Integration
programme.desc: Thank you for showing up for yourself. Completing five days of breathwork is a major accomplishment. As you carry this practice forward, you will find that it elevates not only your inner-world, but also elevates others around you.

programme.title: The Emerging Science of Longevity - The Emerging Science of Longevity: Secrets to Healthy Aging
programme.desc: The body has inherent systems to slow and even reverse aging. When you activate these systems you increase stem cell production, reduce inflammation, increase antioxidant enzymes, build muscle, lose fat, and increase cognitive capacity.

programme.title: The Emerging Science of Longevity - The Emerging Science of Longevity: Measuring Health & Aging
programme.desc: Are there biomarkers we can measure that determine our biological age and the state of our operating system? How do we start to measure DNA methylation? What about our telomeres? How do we measure protein changes, or all the various nutrient sensing pathways that have gone awry, and could we use precision medicine to get to longevity escape velocity — i.e. the extension of lifespan indefinitely?

programme.title: The Emerging Science of Longevity - The Emerging Science of Longevity: Eating for Longevity
programme.desc: Now that we understand the root causes of aging, how do we actually address the hallmarks of aging? What are the levers we have to optimize our health and longevity? Because medicine has it all wrong. We don't need to treat disease. When we focus on fostering optimal health, disease goes away as a side effect.

programme.title: The Emerging Science of Longevity - The Emerging Science of Longevity: Optimizing Health with the Fundamentals
programme.desc: There are basic fundamental ways we can optimize our health, starting with topics we’ve already discussed, like eating well and exercising appropriately. But, just as important for health and longevity is the need to rest, relax, and connect with each other. Community is essential, and being of service to one another can help you heal.

programme.title: The Emerging Science of Longevity - The Emerging Science of Longevity: Adversity Mimetics to Activate Healing and Repair
programme.desc: Too much stress will take you down, but the right amount of stress at the right time can activate your body's repair and healing mechanisms. What natural elements stress our system in such a way that it then activates the body to heal?

programme.title: The Emerging Science of Longevity - The Emerging Science of Longevity: Abundance Mimetics to Activate Longevity Pathways
programme.desc: If you get a brand new Toyota Camry, you can probably drive it for ten years without much attention. But if you have a 1938 Mercedes-Benz, it takes more love and care to keep it running. As we age, we become like that classic car, needing extra love and care.

programme.title: Gut Health with Dr. Mary Pardee - Day 2: The Gut-Brain Connection
programme.desc: For day 2, we'll look at the connection between the gut and the brain. We'll also practice mindful eating.

programme.title: Gut Health with Dr. Mary Pardee - Day 4: IBD and Helminthic Therapy
programme.desc: For day 4, we learn about common GI disorders and how to test for them.

programme.title: Gut Health with Dr. Mary Pardee - Day 5: GERD and Food Sensitivities
programme.desc: Healthy gut, healthy brain. For day 5, we learn how certain GI disorders affect brain functionality.

programme.title: Gut Health with Dr. Mary Pardee - Day 3: IBS and other Gastrointestinal Issues
programme.desc: Today, we dive into the most commonly diagnosed functional GI disorder, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - The Role of Exercise in Weight Loss
programme.desc: Finally, the exercise episode! Exercise is the most powerful lever you can pull when it comes to longevity, health, and weight loss. It’s also the number one form of preventative medicine and helps prevent yo-yo dieting. Here Jillian provides clear guidelines for how much and what types of exercises you should be building into your weekly routine.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Why Do We Have Insatiable Hunger?
programme.desc: Hopefully by now you understand that you gain weight because you have eaten more energy than you have burned in your day and stored that energy in your fat cells. But, have you ever wondered WHY you are overeating — i.e. eating more than you are burning? Why do we have such insatiable appetites when our bodies are usually pretty good at staying in balance? And no… it’s not because you have no willpower. This episode digs into where the physiological and psychological hunger is coming from — and how to cope with it.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Cheat Codes
programme.desc: There are certainly things that can add a plus to our A, but these aren’t replacements for eating better and moving more. Nothing in this lesson will come close to impacting your results like diet and exercise. Nonetheless, Jillian offers her thoughts on cold exposure, heat exposure, and supplements.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Way Beyond Willpower: Managing Relationships and Environments to Beat Temptation
programme.desc: Willpower is like a muscle: If you use it long enough without a break, it fatigues. It’s the moment at the Mexican restaurant when they go to drop the chips and you say, 'No thanks.' If the chips sit on that table, there is no chance you won’t end up eating the basket. So, let’s go over some basic techniques you need to program into your behavior and environment to safeguard yourself against momentary vulnerabilities. We also cover some serious boundary setting, so get ready.

programme.title: Weight Loss Master Class - Weight Loss Master Class - Your Complete Weight-Loss Plan
programme.desc: A big goal (if you have one) can feel a bit intimidating or overwhelming. This episode is here to help remove any of those anxious feelings with something called a goal pyramid. This simple technique will help you know exactly what to do and when to make that vision a reality!

programme.title: Yoga For All - Day 7: Prana
programme.desc: Your Day 7 practice is an invitation right to the good stuff. This fiery session is a warming sequence that guides to you create a healthy flow of energy in the body welcoming total mind and body health.

programme.title: Yoga For All - Day 9: Bold
programme.desc: Your day 9 practice asks you to check in with body and breath as a way of cultivating more awareness. The journey continues! The vocabulary grows. Move fearlessly through this practice by simply listening to your body. Check your habits and move with intention as a way of moving forward with confidence and focus.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Forward Bending for Forward Thinking
programme.desc: Use what you learned in Day 4 to stretch the hamstrings and your backbody safely and effectively. Bring attention to your spine in Downward Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana) and Intense Side Stretch (Parsvottanasana), before working on Hand-to-Big-Toe Pose (Padangusthasana) with a strap. Finish in a supported backbend to counter your diligent forward folding.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Foundations of Twisting
programme.desc: In this class, you'll investigate the mechanics of twists, one of Schuyler's personal challenges. Learn where you want to twist from—and where you don't. Apply the concept in active (think: core work!) and passive twists as well as standing, seated, and supine. You’ll finish class by massaging the base of the skull for a juicy release.

programme.title: Commune Meditation Summit - CMS - Light Watkins
programme.desc: In this lesson with Light Watkins, you will learn to examine bliss as more than a buzzword. You’ll come to see and know it as a powerful state of presence that is accessible through the practice of meditation.

programme.title: Commune Meditation Summit - CMS - Michael B. Beckwith
programme.desc: In this lesson, you will focus on the gift of the body temple, which is the signature for revealing life, love, peace, joy, wisdom, harmony, and abundance. When the body’s temple is healthy, you can hold more energy. More of life’s cosmic energy can flow through you.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - COMMUNE-Dr Hyman, Hacking Healthcare-Day 4: Hormones
programme.desc: What could a hormone imbalance look like for you?

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 5: Heart Health
programme.desc: Today we learn which tests you should be pursuing for a total view of your heart health and how to synthesize those results systemically.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 7: Hidden Inflammation and Disease
programme.desc: We’ve all experienced inflammation in some form. Today we address how to find this hidden symptom, identify it and its root causes, and stop it in its tracks. There is no optimal health with uncontrolled inflammation.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 8: Metabolism and Mitochondria
programme.desc: What if I told you there was a reason you feel tired, achy, and foggy all the time? And what if I told you the solution was healing your body on the cellular level?

programme.title: Deep Relaxation with Tracee Stanley - Energy: Energetic Awareness Relaxation Practice
programme.desc: This Deep Relaxation session revolves around cultivating sensitivity towards the energetic body, with the aim of cleansing and rejuvenation.

programme.title: Good Mood Food with Jason Wrobel - Meditation for Brain Health
programme.desc: On our last day of the course together, Jason will show you specific mindfulness practices for enhancing your emotional health, discuss how meditation affects neuroplasticity, and teach you how to balance your neurotransmitters and the hemispheres of the brain.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 7: Hidden Inflammation and Disease
programme.desc: We’ve all experienced inflammation in some form. Today we address how to find this hidden symptom, identify it and its root causes, and stop it in its tracks. There is no optimal health with uncontrolled inflammation.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 8: Metabolism and Mitochondria
programme.desc: What if I told you there was a reason you feel tired, achy, and foggy all the time? And what if I told you the solution was healing your body on the cellular level?

programme.title: The Nature of Reality with Deepak Chopra - The Nature of Reality: The Science of Reality
programme.desc: What is real? How do we know it's real, and how does that deeper understanding of reality help us fulfill our dreams, desires, and intentions? So let's go for it.

programme.title: The Nature of Reality with Deepak Chopra - The Nature of Reality: Fundamental Experience
programme.desc: Let's shift away from the scientific model to a different way of looking at that which we call reality.

programme.title: The Nature of Reality with Deepak Chopra - The Nature of Reality: Dreaming Reality
programme.desc: You dream every night, and whether or not you remember a dream, it's still an experience you have. Usually you will dismiss it in the morning, saying, “It was just a dream,” meaning it was not real. And the reason it's not real is that you look back and the dream is not here, it's over. So a dream by definition is transient, evanescent, ephemeral, ungraspable.

programme.title: Break Out of the Addiction Frequency - Section 1: The Addiction Frequency & The Power of Breath
programme.desc: Breathing is the single most important thing we do. Addiction is characterized by a sense of lack, of missing something. And when you breathe poorly, like when anxious or angry, you’re caught up in your head and aren’t breathing well and that sends a signal to your body that perpetuates the addiction frequency. Deep, long breathing is how we interrupt this pattern.

programme.title: The Highest Pass
programme.desc: Part heart-pounding adventure, part spiritual quest, THE HIGHEST PASS, a feature length documentary, premiered in Los Angeles to sold out audiences. The award-winning film shares the journey of seven seekers, including one who has never ridden a motorcycle, who follow a guru with a Vedic death prophecy on a moto journey up to the highest pass of the Indian Himalayas. Over 21 days and up to an elevation of 18,000 feet along a winding road, they never let low oxygen, altitude sickness, river-flooded roads, icy edges, snow and loaded trucks dampen their spirits or, ultimately, their deeper selves.

programme.title: Road To Dharma - Real Love at Badrinath
programme.desc: Badrinath – Reverberating with thousands of years of yogic wisdom… But Jeff won’t even wear a helmet. You try and talk to him, he won’t listen to me, says Jen. The ebb and flow of relationships and how to sustain them is found here in Badrinath, the temple of Naryana, the sustainer. This isn’t religious, it is all about getting empty and receiving the wisdom of the sages in the great Himalayas.

programme.title: Road To Dharma - True Power in the Hidden Valley of the Flowers
programme.desc: Before Riding to the Hidden Valley of the Flowers, we get a rare view of the hidden life of the riders in this real world of yogis opening scene. This lightness contrasts a big incedent at the the following morning, setting the riders and Ryan up for some harsh truths about Power and passivity. True Power is yours to embrace. This is not a journey to feel better.

programme.title: HEAL
programme.desc: Director Kelly Noonan Gores’ HEAL takes us on a scientific and spiritual journey where we discover that our thoughts, beliefs, and emotions have a huge impact on our health and ability to heal. We have more control over our health and life than we have been taught to believe.

programme.title: The Superpowers of Your Gut - The Superpowers of Your Gut - Day 2
programme.desc: You have an intimate relationship with everything you put in your mouth. The tongue is a magical instrument for you to start to remember the power of flavor and nutrients, to slow it down and experience food again.

programme.title: The Superpowers of Your Gut - The Superpowers of Your Gut - Day 1
programme.desc: Human biology is a symphony played between the body and the greater nature around us. The great conductor of that symphony, in many ways, is the gut and microbiome. This course will take a multifaceted look at this organ system � which is our primary interface with the chemistry of the world � so you can get an understanding of how to co-create health and well-being.

programme.title: Fantastic Fungi: Remastered
programme.desc: Fantastic Fungi Remastered is a breathtaking journey into the hidden world of mycelium. Through stunning imagery and expert insights, the film reveals fungi’s beauty, intelligence, and power to heal, inspire, and offer solutions for our planet’s future.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Front Shoulders Feelin' Fine
programme.desc: Explore your newfound spaciousness in this shoulder lovin' class. Waste no time waking up the wrists, then move through variations of Low Lunge (Anjaneyasana) with Cactus Arms before building to Side Plank (Vasisthasana). Counter those actions with Eagle Arms for a deep stretch across the upper back and some seated twisting.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Gliding Into the Overhead Plane
programme.desc: Get the arms up and those shoulder blades sliding! Start with a shoulder warmup as Schuyler teaches proper alignment when lifting the arms overhead. Then get into side body strengthening and visit Downward Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana). Finish with some handstand playtime at the wall and a savory chest opener.

programme.title: Breath, Body, Beats with Schuyler Grant - Breath, Body, Beats with Schuyler Grant - Day 1: Breathing with the Beats
programme.desc: Welcome to Day 1! Congratulations on making this powerful commitment to yourself and giving yourself the gift of flow state. Research shows that if you cultivate the flow state in your daily life, the benefits touch every part of your life—job performance, peace of mind, creativity, and your own sense of purpose. Connecting to the breath is that powerful. Remember that it’s important to have your blocks and yoga blanket or thick towel. If you find yourself empty-handed, you can always DIY your own. In this first class, you will learn key postures and proper shoulder alignment to establish a foundation for this challenge. (Upcoming classes include less talking and more flowing, but this one is important for everything that follows, so stick with it!)

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Front Shoulders Feelin' Fine
programme.desc: Explore your newfound spaciousness in this shoulder lovin' class. Waste no time waking up the wrists, then move through variations of Low Lunge (Anjaneyasana) with Cactus Arms before building to Side Plank (Vasisthasana). Counter those actions with Eagle Arms for a deep stretch across the upper back and some seated twisting.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Gliding Into the Overhead Plane
programme.desc: Get the arms up and those shoulder blades sliding! Start with a shoulder warmup as Schuyler teaches proper alignment when lifting the arms overhead. Then get into side body strengthening and visit Downward Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana). Finish with some handstand playtime at the wall and a savory chest opener.

programme.title: Balance Your Hormones with Dr. Jolene Brighten - Balance Your Hormones - Day 2: Adrenal Glands
programme.desc: This sentence sums it up: The adrenal glands are the foundation of hormone balancing. If your adrenals aren't functioning at full capacity, you'll feel it. In today's lesson, we take a deep dive into the hormones that our adrenal glands produce. We'll start to get an idea of why taking care of and keeping these glands happy is so important.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Easing into Back Bending
programme.desc: Establish long term success for your practice by learning about one of the most crucial body parts in yoga—your spine. In this class Schuyler teaches you how to backbend safely, followed by three practical applications. Class ends with a soothing restorative posture. Body awareness never felt so good.

programme.title: Yoga For All - Yoga For All Day 1: Notice
programme.desc: Your Day 1 practice offers an invitation to slow down and take stock.

programme.title: Break Out of the Addiction Frequency - Section 1: The Addiction Frequency & The Power of Breath

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 1: Health Care vs. Sick Care
programme.desc: Today, we talk about a revolutionary approach to health called Functional Medicine, and how you can have a healthy doctor-patient relationship.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: Relationships and Your Spiritual Journey
programme.desc: Today's lesson is a bit of a reality check, as we'll begin to question the current way we look at relationships, romantic or not. How we see ourselves and our relationship to God influences our view of our relationships with other people. Today we're going to examine that view from a place of love.

programme.title: Live Fearlessly with Anita Moorjani - Welcome to Live Fearlessly with Anita Moorjani
programme.desc: In this course, Anita Moorjani guides you toward loving yourself as if your life depends on it – because it does! When love (rather than fear) determines your life, you will recognize what is truly important for you to be happy and healthy.

programme.title: The Work of Byron Katie - Intro to the Judge-Your-Neighbor Worksheet
programme.desc: As humans, we are constantly struggling between the poles of what we think we want and what is. When we lose touch with the truth of what is, we create and compound our suffering. What narratives are you constructing? Are they in conflict with the truth of the situation? Are you struggling with what is?

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Energy & Motivation
programme.desc: As we prepare for Day 1 tomorrow, celebrate yourself for setting out on the path to lasting, exuberant wellness. Come to the course with an open mind for earnest personal dialogue and you’ll lay the groundwork for better performance, better experiences, and true depth to your life.

programme.title: The Nature of Reality with Deepak Chopra - The Nature of Reality: The Science of Reality
programme.desc: What is real? How do we know it's real, and how does that deeper understanding of reality help us fulfill our dreams, desires, and intentions? So let's go for it.

programme.title: Vinyasa for Life - Vinyasa for Life: Easing into Back Bending
programme.desc: Establish long term success for your practice by learning about one of the most crucial body parts in yoga—your spine. In this class Schuyler teaches you how to backbend safely, followed by three practical applications. Class ends with a soothing restorative posture. Body awareness never felt so good.

programme.title: Yoga For All - Yoga For All Day 1: Notice
programme.desc: Your Day 1 practice offers an invitation to slow down and take stock.

programme.title: Break Out of the Addiction Frequency - Section 1: The Addiction Frequency & The Power of Breath
programme.desc: Breathing is the single most important thing we do. Addiction is characterized by a sense of lack, of missing something. And when you breathe poorly, like when anxious or angry, you’re caught up in your head and aren’t breathing well and that sends a signal to your body that perpetuates the addiction frequency. Deep, long breathing is how we interrupt this pattern.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 1: Health Care vs. Sick Care
programme.desc: Today, we talk about a revolutionary approach to health called Functional Medicine, and how you can have a healthy doctor-patient relationship.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: Relationships and Your Spiritual Journey
programme.desc: Today's lesson is a bit of a reality check, as we'll begin to question the current way we look at relationships, romantic or not. How we see ourselves and our relationship to God influences our view of our relationships with other people. Today we're going to examine that view from a place of love.

programme.title: Live Fearlessly with Anita Moorjani - Welcome to Live Fearlessly with Anita Moorjani
programme.desc: In this course, Anita Moorjani guides you toward loving yourself as if your life depends on it – because it does! When love (rather than fear) determines your life, you will recognize what is truly important for you to be happy and healthy.

programme.title: The Work of Byron Katie - Intro to the Judge-Your-Neighbor Worksheet
programme.desc: As humans, we are constantly struggling between the poles of what we think we want and what is. When we lose touch with the truth of what is, we create and compound our suffering. What narratives are you constructing? Are they in conflict with the truth of the situation? Are you struggling with what is?

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Energy & Motivation
programme.desc: As we prepare for Day 1 tomorrow, celebrate yourself for setting out on the path to lasting, exuberant wellness. Come to the course with an open mind for earnest personal dialogue and you’ll lay the groundwork for better performance, better experiences, and true depth to your life.

programme.title: The Nature of Reality with Deepak Chopra - The Nature of Reality: The Science of Reality
programme.desc: What is real? How do we know it's real, and how does that deeper understanding of reality help us fulfill our dreams, desires, and intentions? So let's go for it.

And when you breathe poorly, like when anxious or angry, you’re caught up in your head and aren’t breathing well and that sends a signal to your body that perpetuates the addiction frequency. Deep, long breathing is how we interrupt this pattern.

programme.title: Hacking Your Healthcare - Day 1: Health Care vs. Sick Care
programme.desc: Today, we talk about a revolutionary approach to health called Functional Medicine, and how you can have a healthy doctor-patient relationship.

programme.title: Relationships with Marianne Williamson - Relationships: Relationships and Your Spiritual Journey
programme.desc: Today's lesson is a bit of a reality check, as we'll begin to question the current way we look at relationships, romantic or not. How we see ourselves and our relationship to God influences our view of our relationships with other people. Today we're going to examine that view from a place of love.

programme.title: Live Fearlessly with Anita Moorjani - Welcome to Live Fearlessly with Anita Moorjani
programme.desc: In this course, Anita Moorjani guides you toward loving yourself as if your life depends on it – because it does! When love (rather than fear) determines your life, you will recognize what is truly important for you to be happy and healthy.

programme.title: The Work of Byron Katie - Intro to the Judge-Your-Neighbor Worksheet
programme.desc: As humans, we are constantly struggling between the poles of what we think we want and what is. When we lose touch with the truth of what is, we create and compound our suffering. What narratives are you constructing? Are they in conflict with the truth of the situation? Are you struggling with what is?

programme.title: The Wellness Master Class - The Wellness Master Class: Energy & Motivation
programme.desc: As we prepare for Day 1 tomorrow, celebrate yourself for setting out on the path to lasting, exuberant wellness. Come to the course with an open mind for earnest personal dialogue and you’ll lay the groundwork for better performance, better experiences, and true depth to your life.

programme.title: The Nature of Reality with Deepak Chopra - The Nature of Reality: The Science of Reality
programme.desc: What is real? How do we know it's real, and how does that deeper understanding of reality help us fulfill our dreams, desires, and intentions? So let's go for it.

programme.title: GOAT - The Greatest Of All Time
programme.desc: Who deserves the honour of being the greatest boxer of all time?

programme.title: The Inside Line
programme.desc: Red Bull's opportunities to compete in F1 are limited by the calendar, but the team and the promotion campaign never stop outside of the track, the team begin famous for its astonishing demonstration races.

programme.title: The Front Row
programme.desc: How has F1 evolved in order to seduce fans in the modern era? What new unmissable attractions have been added to the Grand Prix weekend? What is the global success of the Sprint format among fans and drivers?

programme.title: The Front Row
programme.desc: We explore the tactics, methods and approaches of the teams to mark up precious points during the weekend's racing, their preparation for an F1 season and their collaboration with the FIA.

programme.title: The Front Row
programme.desc: How has the Formula 1 motor developed with the advent of new technologies? Does the more silent turbo style still give rise to enthusiasm in the modern era? What are the novelties that put rhythm into a Grand Prix weekend?

programme.title: Heroines
programme.desc: Enthusiasm for sport is a key element in creating a link and a feeling of belonging to your favourite team.

programme.title: The Short List
programme.desc: The top 20 of former Olympic fighters who have gone down in history.

programme.title: Top 20
programme.desc: Top is a unique classification of news on the champions who are causing a buzz in the world of sport!

programme.title: Star Guide
programme.desc: Ever wondered which of your favourite sport stars would make the best party guest? Who would you take home to meet your family and who would you never date in a million years? Who's hot and who's not? Well - we've done your homework for you in this fresh, entertaining look at exactly who's got it going on in and out of the sporting arena... let us be your personal chauffeur through the sports celebrity universe...welcome to Star Guide!

programme.title: Tennis Stars
programme.desc: In this episode of Tennis Stars, we meet Ivo Karlović at the top of his game, Carla Suárez Navarro who is quietly climbing the world rankings and Rafael Nadal who keeps his relationship with his girlfriend very secret.

programme.title: The Challenge
programme.desc: It's all about endurance in this episode with the ultra-marathon, ultra-triathlon and some adventurers in Canada.

programme.title: GOAT - The Greatest Of All Time
programme.desc: Which sporting exploit deserves the honour of being chosen as the greatest of all time?

programme.title: The Inside Line
programme.desc: Anglo-Thai driver Alex Albon has shown himself to be one of the most brilliant talents of F1 with spells at Toro Rosso, Red Bull Racing and now Williams.

programme.title: The Iconic
programme.desc: They are the icons of the winter games, notably female skier Mikaela Shiffrin, ice skater Tonya Harding, Britain's Eddie the Eagle and the miraculous United States ice hockey team.

programme.title: Foul Play
programme.desc: The scandal of the figure skating judges at the Salt Lake City Winter Olympics.

programme.title: The Iconic
programme.desc: China's Eillen Gu became the queen of the snows at the Winter Olympics of 2022, Jamaica's bobsleigh team inspired a film, the big names of downhill skiing take it easy, while Shaun White has appropriated the snowboard half-pipe.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Jonah Lomu changed rugby during the 1995 World Cup. Another New Zealander, Peter Snell, put his country on the map 30 years earlier. And the 2018 World Cup final gave rise to an own goal which became a masterpiece.

programme.title: The Iconic
programme.desc: The most emblematic moments of rugby take us from Nelson Mandela to China via Jonny Wilkinson's right boot.

programme.title: Flashpoint
